loans.name: Elsy

texts.en: Elsy S. sells provisions and runs a restaurant. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Elsy and their four children. Demand for her goods is high, so she is seeking a loan of $475 to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Patience Arthur sells refrigerators. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Patience and their three children. Demand for her goods is high, so she is seeking a loan of $475 to expand the business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Awawou

texts.fr:
Awawou I. is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three. She lives and work in Adéta, a small village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. To earn money, she buys cola nuts and sells them retail. With the money from her second FECECAV loan, Ms. I. hopes to enlarge her business by buy nuts for retail sale abroad, especially in Niger. She will use the profits she is going to make from her business to better cover household expenses and school fees for her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Awawou I. est âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle habite et travaille à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Pour gagner de l’argent, elle achète et revend les noix de cola. Avec l’argent de son deuxième crédit de FECECAV, Madame I. espère agrandir son commerce en achetant plus des noix pour revendre à l’extérieur surtout au Niger. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager de son activité, elle peut mieux participer aux charges du foyer et supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants.

loans.use: To expand her commerce

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ama D. is 54 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She takes care of the school fees of her children who are at school in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. To earn money for her expenses, she makes and sells bread at the roadside. With her first loan from FECEVAV, Ama wishes to buy bags of wheat flour and sugar, and have a new oven built in order to satisfy the demands of her ever-increasing clientele. With the profit she will make from sales, she will be able to provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Ama D. est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle supporte les charges scolaires de ses enfants qui sont à l’école à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Pour gagner de l’argent pour ses dépenses, elle prépare et vend du pain au bord de la route. Avec son premier crédit de FECECAV, Ama souhaite acheter des sacs de farine de blé, du sucre et se faire contruire un nouveau four pour satisfaire la demande de la clientèle qui ne cesse de croître. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager de ses ventes elle sera capable de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery has worked filling orders for a variety of products on demand for 20 years. Her customers are friends and acquaintances. Some time ago, she used to offer a daily lunch in her home, but she had to stop doing that because of personal problems. Two years ago, Mery began selling cosmetics by catalog, but she had to stop doing that activity as well, because there was too much competition.

Nonetheless, Mery never stopped selling products on demand. She offers her customers what they desire. She has even organized social activities for her customers. She is also a school promoter for a school close to her home. She works there for 6 hours every day.

The loans that she has requested thus far have helped her. Mery would like to obtain more capital in order to open a storefront for sales of a variety of items.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Mery se dedica a la venta de diversos productos a pedido desde hace 20 años. Sus clientes son sus amistades y conocidos. Hace algún tiempo, ella ofrecía menú en su casa, pero tuvo que dejar esta actividad por problemas personales. Igualmente, hace 2 años Mery incursionó en las ventas de cosméticos por catálogo, pero tuvo que dejarlo, ya que había mucha competencia.

Sin embargo, Mery nunca dejó las ventas por pedido. Ella le ofrece al cliente lo que él desee. Incluso ha organizado actividades sociales por encargo. Asimismo, ella es promotora escolar de una escuela cerca de su casa. Allí trabaja 6 horas diarias.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido. Mery quisiera hacerse de un mayor capital de dinero para así instalar una empresa de ventas múltiples.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products that her customers request

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael sold chifles (plantain chips) in the streets but realized that the business wasn’t making enough money, so he needed to reevaluate new possibilities. One year ago he decided to rent a stall and sell soup in a market in his neighborhood. He works there from 6am until 4pm. He sells a variety of soups, such as chicken soup, lamb soup, and stewed corn soup, among others. The loans that Rafael has received thus far have helped him to purchase the ingredients he needs to make his soups. He would like to open another stall to sell chicken soup.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Rafael se dedicaba a la venta de chifles (chips a base de plátano) en las calles, sin embargo, se dio cuenta que el negocio no le estaba rindiendo económicamente, por lo que tuvo que evaluar nuevas posibilidades. Fue así que desde hace 1 año decidió poner un puesto de caldos en un mercado de su barrio. Él trabaja allí desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Vende diversos tipos de caldos, como de gallina, de cordero, de mote, entre otros. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los ingredientes que necesita en la elaboración de sus caldos. A Rafael le gustaría poder abrir un puesto más de caldo de gallina.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for his soups

loans.name: Madogou Béthé

texts.fr:
Originally from central Togo, Mrs. Madougo Bétché T. was born in 1959 in Sokodé. Her husband is Mr. Saka Oyewale Bello, who sells frozen produce. She has two children in school and has opened a store selling staples in the neighborhood of Agoè, to the north of Lomé. She gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé. The geographical location of her store allows her to make many sales since it is near the bus station. This is her first loan and she is requesting it to stock up by purchasing 15 cans of peanut-based vegetable oil, 10 bags of rice and 10 bags of spaghetti.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Originaire de la région centrale du Togo, madame T. Madougou Bétché est née en 1959 à Sokodé. Elle a pour époux Monsieur BELLO Saka Oyewale qui est un revendeur des produits congelés. Elle a deux enfants qui sont scolarisés et a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Son lieu d’approvisionnement est le grand marché de Lomé. La situation géographique de son magasin lui permet de bien vendre étant proche d’une gare routière. Elle est à son premier crédit et sollicite ce crédit pour faire un approvisionnement a travers l’achat de 15 bidons d’huile végétale à base d’arachide, 10 sacs de riz et 10 sacs de spaghetti

loans.use: To buy staples

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Eight years ago, Margarita started a videogame business in her home. Her brother had recommended that she start the business. Three years ago, when the Internet became extremely popular, Margarita decided to expand her business and offer Internet stations. Her son suggested this addition, as he was studying computer science.

Currently Margarita offers Internet service and videogames from 7am until 1am. The loans that she has received thus far have helped her add new programs to her computers and to update the videogames. Margarita would like to further update or purchase some new computers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 8 años, Margarita puso su negocio de videojuegos en su casa. Fue su hermano quién le recomendó que incursionara en esta actividad. Asimismo, hace tres años, a raíz del auge de la Web, Margarita decidió ampliar su negocio y ofrecer cabinas de Internet. Su hijo la orientó en el negocio, ya que él estaba estudiando Informática.

En la actualidad, Margarita ofrece el servicio de Internet y Videojuegos desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la madrugada. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para complementar las computadoras con nuevos programas, y para actualizar los videojuegos. A Margarita le gustaría poder actualizar más sus maquinas o comprarse unas nuevas.

loans.use: Install new programs on computers and update videogames.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Born on December 31, 1968 in Sokodé, a town situated 350 km from Lomé, Mrs. Bintou Allassani is a widow with four children, two of whom are at school and the other two married. She has been selling charcoal and firewood in Lomé's Agoè neighborhood since 1998. She has a supplier from whom she obtains supplies on credit. It is therefore after she has made her sales that she pays her supplier. The amount she pays her supplier means that she does not make a decent profit. To this end, she is requesting a loan to buy 4 bags of charcoal and 5 bundles of firewood.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 31 décembre 1968 à Sokodé, ville située à 350 Km de Lomé, Dame ALLASSANI Bintou est une veuve ayant quatre enfants dont deux scolarisés et deux autres mariés. Elle a commencé l’activité de vente de charbons de bois et de bois de chauffe dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé depuis 1998. Elle a un fournisseur auprès de qui elle s’approvisionne à crédit. Donc c’est après avoir vendu qu’elle fait le remboursement à son fournisseur. La somme qu’elle paie à son fournisseur fait qu’elle ne gagne pas un bénéfice sensible. A cet effet, elle sollicite ce crédit afin d’acheter au comptant 04 sacs de charbon de bois et 5 tas de bois de chauffe.

loans.use: To buy 4 bags of charcoal and 5 bundles of firewood

loans.name: Maryuri

texts.es:
Maryuri has sold Ebel brand cosmetics by catalog for one year. Her mother had this business before, but she retired and left the business to Maryuri.

She also works selling jewelry in a mall.

The loans that she has requested have helped her cover the costs of the Ebel products and to invest in the store that her mother has had in their house for five years.

Maryuri would like to start a business of selling clothing and accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Maryuri vende cosméticos por catálogo de la marca Ebel desde hace 1 año. Fue su mamá quién antes se dedicaba a esta actividad, pero ella se retiró y le dejó a Maryuri el negocio.

Asimismo, ella trabaja como vendedora en una joyería de un Centro Comercial.

Los préstamos que ha pedido han servido para cubrir los gastos de los productos Ebel, y para invertir en la tienda que su mamá tiene en su casa desde hade 5 años.

A Maryuri le gustaría poner un negocio de ventas de ropa y accesorios.

loans.use: To pay for her Ebel products and to invest in the store that her mom has in their house

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra A., age 38, is married and the mother of two. Her main business is selling 'pagne' cloth (colorful fabrics) and boubou (traditional clothing) in the Agoè district in Lomé. She is a traveling salesperson and sells from district to district, such that she travels 12 km per day on average.

She is a loyal client of WAGES and once obtained a loan that enabled her to increase her sales figures. After a prompt repayment of her first loan, she requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy 35 pieces of traditional pagne cloth.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 38 ans, Madame A. Abra est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de pagne et de boubou dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle est une revendeuse ambulante et vend de quartier en quartier ce qui fait qu’elle parcourt en moyenne 12Km par jour.

Elle est un client fidèle de WAGES et a une fois obtenu du crédit qui lui a permis d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit, elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000FCFA pour acheter 35 pièces de pagnes traditionnels

loans.use: To bjy 35 pieces of traditional pagnes

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz María and her husband began silk-screening 8 years ago. They have a small workshop in their house, where they work from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m.

Luz María’s husband used to have a workshop where he made faucets, however he was not successful in this endeavor and instead decided to only make the bags in which faucets are sold. As a result, he learned silk-screening and now makes plastic bags with logos for various faucet companies.

Luz María also learned silk-screening so that both she and her husband could work together in their workshop. Two other people work with Luz María and her husband, as 8 months ago they formalized their business.

The loan that she has requested will help her purchase the materials she needs in her business, such as plastic bags, paint, etc.

Luz María wants to expand her workshop and increase the number of employees.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Luz María y su esposo se dedican a la serigrafía desde hace 8 años. Tienen un pequeño taller dentro de su casa. Allí trabajan desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

El esposo de Luz María tenía un taller donde elaboraba grifos de agua, sin embargo, no le fue bien en esta actividad, por lo que decidió dedicarse solamente a hacer las bolsas de los grifos. De esta manera, aprendió serigrafía y ahora trabaja proveyendo de bolsas plásticas con logotipo a distintas empresas de grifería.

Luz María también aprendió serigrafía, por lo que los dos laboran conjuntamente en su taller. Asimismo, tienen dos personas más trabajando con ellos. Recién han podido formalizar su negocio hace 8 meses.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los materiales que necesita en su negocio, como bolsas plásticas, pinturas, etc.

Ella quisiera agrandar su taller y aumentar el personal de trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as plastic bags and paint for her silk-screening business.

texts.fr: Information removed at borrower's request

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga owns a bazaar in the market near her home, and has been running it for the past six years. It was her sister who left her the business since she was traveling to Chile. Now Olga owns the locale and invests in it.

She sells a variety of products such as jewelry, clothing, stuffed animals, etc. She works for several hours since she also has to tend to her family.

The loans she has previously requested have been used to invest in the purchase of the products she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

Olga tiene un bazar en el mercado cerca de su casa desde hace 6 años. Fue su hermana quién le dejó el negocio, pues viajó a Chile. Ahora Olga dispone del local e invierte en él.

Ella vende diversos productos, como alhajas, ropa, peluches, etc. Trabaja por horas, ya que tiene que atender a su familia.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para invertir en la compra de los productos que ofrece.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of the products she offers in her store.

loans.name: Lydia Floridalma

texts.es:
Lydia Floridalma A. C. resides in the municipality of Cantón Cojxac in the state of Totonicapán. She is the mother of five children. She married when she was 17 years old and back then worked making huipils (typical Mayan embroidered blouses) but left that to join her husband in his work that consists of making furniture (wardrobes, chairs, china cabinets and beds). As a help to him she sells the furniture in the local market of Totonicapán where the business is in great demand.

The loan that she is requesting from ASDIR will serve to increase business capital because, with the help of her children, they will be able to distribute in different parts of the city and in other towns.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Lydia Floridalma A. C. quien con residencia en el Cantón Cojxac, municipio y departamento de Totonicapán. Es madre de cinco hijos. Contrajo matrimonio cuando tenía 17 años, en ese entonces se dedicaba a la costura (elaboración de Güipiles Típicos) pero dejó su trabajo y se dedico al de su esposo el cual consiste en la fabricación de muebles (roperos, sillas, Chineros y camas) como una ayuda a su esposo ella los vende en el mercado local de Totonicapán, el cual tiene mucha demanda este negocio, el crédito que solicita en ASDIR le servirá para el aumento de capital en el negocio ya que con la ayuda de sus hijos podrán distribuirse en diferentes puntos de la ciudad y en otros pueblos circunvecinos.

loans.use: Increase business capital to improve distribution (furniture sales)

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
A plumber by profession, Yaovi V. was born in 1963 in Notsè in Haho prefecture. His has as his wife Dovi ASSIOGBO, a hairdresser. In 2000, he opened a shop "Bar Christian City" selling beverages in the Agoè district in the north of Lomé. In this shop, he also sells plumbing supplies.

He is on his second loan and is requesting 450,000 francs CFA to buy 76 bottles of liquor and plumbing supplies.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Plombier de profession, Monsieur V. Yaovi est né en 1963 à Notsè dans la préfecture de haho. Il a pour épouse madame ASSIOGBO Dovi qui est une coiffeuse. Depuis 2000, elle a ouvert une boutique de vente de boisson « BAR CHRISTIAN CITY » dans le quartier Agoè au nord de Lomé. Dans sa boutique, il vend également des matériels de plomberie.

Il est à son second crédit et sollicite 450.000FCFA pour acheter 76 bouteilles de liqueur et des matériels de plomberie.

loans.use: To buy 76 bottles of liquor and some plumbing supplies

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea used to sell clothing 10 years ago, but she decided to suspend this work because many customers owed her money. This is why she started her jewelry business.

She makes earrings, bracelets, and necklaces by hand. To do this, she uses special pliers and materials like silver, pearls, and wire. She also gives jewelry-making classes at a mothers club near her home. She learned this activity 13 years ago, and that's when she started to sell her products.

The loans that Andrea has received have helped her to purchase the materials she needs to make her products.

She would like to have a stand where she sells the products she makes and to give jewelry-making classes.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Andrea se dedicaba desde hace 10 años a la venta de ropa por pedido, sin embargo, decidió suspender esta labor porque muchos clientes le estaban debiendo dinero. Fue así que incursionó en el negocio de la bisutería.

Ella hace aretes, pulseras y collares a mano. Para esto utiliza alicates especiales y materiales como plata, perlas y alambres. También dicta clases de bisutería en un club de madres cerca de su casa. Ella aprendió esta actividad hace 13 años y desde esa fecha empezó a vender sus productos.

Los préstamos que Andrea ha recibido le han ayudado para comprar los materiales que necesita en la elaboración de sus productos.

Ella quisiera tener un stand en donde vender los productos que hace, y también dictar clases de bisutería.

loans.use: To purchase the materials that she needs to make her hand-made products

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
For 10 years, María Rosa has sold beef at a market near her house. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.

She learned this business through her mother and her sister, who used to sell beef. Subsequently, her sister left her the sales stand that she now uses.

The loans she has requested have served her to pay in advance for the meat that she offers and to help her daughter with her studies in English.

María Rosa needs a meet slicer, and she is working to acquire one.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 10 años, María Rosa se dedica a la venta de carne de res en un mercado cerca de su casa. Ella vende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde.

Ella conoció el negocio a través de su mamá y su hermana, quienes antes vendían carne de res. Posteriormente, su hermana le dejó el puesto de venta que ahora ella ocupa.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para pagar por adelantado la carne que ofrece y ayudar a su hija en sus estudios de inglés.

María Rosa necesita una cortadora de carne, por lo que está trabajando para adquirir una.

loans.use: To pay for the meat she offers in advance and to help her daughter with her studies in English

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr:
Ms. Ramatou D. was born in 1971 in Lomé. She married Mr. Bannah TCHAZODI, who is a sheet metal welder. Her main business is selling cosmetics in the Agoè district in Lomé. With the income from her business, she often lends a hand to her husband, who lack a steady income. The first loan that she just paid back enabled her to stock an inventory and to be able to sell a lot.

She is now requesting a loan of 350,000 francs CFA to buy two boxes of straightening agent, six boxes of pomade, and twelve boxes of soap.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame D. Ramatou est née en 1971 à Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur TCHAZODI Bannah qui est un tôlier soudeur. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits cosmétiques dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Avec le revenu de son activité, elle apporte souvent un coup de main à son mari qui a un revenu irrégulier. Le premier crédit qu’elle vient de solder lui a permis de faire l’approvisionnement et de pouvoir bien vendre. Elle sollicite maintenant un crédit de 350.000FCFA pour acheter 2 cartons de défrisant, 6 cartons de pommade et 12 cartons savons.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic items

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes sold vegetables in the market until 8 years ago when she decided to offer lunches in her home to the laborers who work in her neighborhood. She begins cooking at 9am, and at 12 the first diners arrive. She serves food until 2pm. Her husband also delivers lunches to the factories, and they sell around 50 lunches per day. The loans that she has received thus far have helped her to improve her kitchen and purchase more ingredients for her lunches.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes vendía verduras en el mercado, sin embargo, hace 8 años decidió ofrecer menú en su casa a los obreros que trabajan por la zona. Ella empieza a cocinar a las 9 de la mañana, puesto que a las 12 ya van llegando los primeros comensales. Atiende hasta las 2 de la tarde. Igualmente, su esposo reparte menús a las fábricas. Vende alrededor de 50 menús por día. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han ayudado a implementar su cocina y a comprar más ingredientes en la elaboración de sus menús.

loans.use: Improve her kitchen and purchase ingredients for preparation of lunches

loans.name: Mégbéwé

texts.fr:
Born August 23rd, 1970 in Panalo in the Kozah prefecture, Mrs. Mégbéwé T. is married and the mother of two children who are going to school. Her main business activity is selling charcoal in the Agoè neighborhood of Lomé. Her primary suppliers are the villagers of Tsévié. This first loan she is seeking will allow her to buy 29 bags of wood charcoal.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 23 août 1970 à Panalo dans la préfecture de la Kozah, Dame T. Mégbéwé est mariée et mère de 2 enfants qui fréquentent. Elle a pour activité principale la vente du charbon de bois dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle a pour fournisseur principal les paysans du village de Tsévié. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 29 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.use: Purchase 29 bags of wood charcoal

loans.name: Mujeres Necesitadas Group

texts.en:
Amada is a 50-year-old woman who lives in a secluded village called La 5 Casitas in the eastern province of Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. Two years ago, Amada started a small business selling arepas (a sweet bread), corn and other snacks. Since her first loan, she has expanded her business to incluD. other needs of the community, such as shoes and slippers. Amada is requesting this loan to buy larger amounts of flour, oil, sugar and other ingredients to meet customer demand.

She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more stable in order to proviD. her and her family with a sustainable income. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International and from Amada herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl is a salaried taxi driver and works in the South zone of the city of El Alto. His wife offers scuba diving services. These activities are their main sources of income and cover the maintenance of two of their children. They have a total of four children, and in regard to the other two, one is studying electromechanical engineering and the other one is in Cuba studying medicine on a scholarship). Raúl and his family live in the Nuevos Horizontes zone of the same city.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of construction material (bricks and cement) for the construction of a protective wall they very much need in their home.

For their first loan with Impro, the evaluation conducted qualified Raúl favorably.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

Raúl es chofer asalariado de taxi, trabaja en la Zona Sur de la Ciudad de El Alto, la esposa es comerciante minorista de buzos deportivos. Dichas actividades son las principales fuentes de ingresos que cubren la manutención de un par de sus hijos (en total tienen cuatro, en cuanto a los otros, uno esta estudiando electromecánica y el otro esta en Cuba estudiando becado la carrera de medicina). Raúl y su familia viven en la zona Nuevos Horizontes de la misma ciudad.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de material de construcción (ladrillos y cemento) para la construcción de la muralla que hace mucha falta.

Es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica favorablemente a Raúl.

loans.use: Construction of a protective wall in their home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase work material.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lupita is married and is the mother of five children: two daughters who are 20 and 17 years of age and three sons who are 19, 18, and 10. She began her business selling fruit and vegetables 12 years ago in her home. Upon seeing that her business was growing, she decided to rent a shop dedicated exclusively to selling produce. In this manner, she has increased sales and now she wants to begin selling groceries which her customers have been requesting.

Now, she needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 3 months, so that she may purchase products and expand her business.With your help, she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Lupita es casada y madre de 5 hijos 2 mujeres de 20 y 17 años y 3 varones de 19, 18 y 10. Empezó con su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 12 años en su casa, al ver que su negocio crecía cada vez mas, decidió rentar un local para dedicarlo exclusivamente a su frutería, es así como ha ido incrementando sus ventas y ahora quiere empezar a vender abarrotes ya que sus mismos clientes se lo han pedido.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprra abarrotes y expandir su negocio. con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma is a trader. She is dedicated to the buying and selling of cheese. She acquires the product every weekend and distributes it among homes in the area. Emma's husband is a mason. They have four children who attend elementary school. The family's home is located in the Irpavi II zone of the city of La Paz. This is the fourth loan requested from Impro, the purpose of which is to reduce the purchasing costs and increase the benefits. Through the results of her work and a desire to overcome, Emma may access the loan without any inconvenience.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Emma es comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de queso, el producto es adquirido cada fin de semana y se distribuye en los domicilios de la zona. El esposo de Emma es albañil, la pareja tiene 4 hijos que asisten a la escuela primaria. El domicilio de la familia esta en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz. Este es el cuarto préstamo que solicitan en Impro, el crédito será destinado para adquirir queso en mayor cantidad, el propósito es reducir los costos de compra e incrementar sus beneficios. Por los resultados de su trabajo y ganas de superación, Emma puede acceder al crédito sin ningún inconveniente.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Silvia Carolina

texts.es:
Silvia learned to raise chickens by observing her parents and she decided to start her own business. An entrepreneurial woman, she began with two small chickens two years ago. Currently, she has more than 40 chickens; however, now she wishes to purchase turkeys in order to fatten them so that they will weigh more and their selling price will be greater than that of chicken. Currently, Silvia is pregnant. Her child is the reason why she is more motivated than ever to raise not only chickens but also turkeys. In this manner, she will have better income and provide a better quality of life for her child.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in three months, in order to purchase turkeys and begin to fatten them since, in five months, her town's festivities begin as will demand. With your help, Silvia will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia aprendió a criar pollos observando a sus padres y decidió empezar su propio negocio, ella que es una mujer emprendedora comenzó con dos pollitos hace ya 2 años, en la actualidad ya son mas de 40 los pollos que tiene pero desea ahora comprar pavitos para engordarlos, pesan mas y su costo de venta es mayor a la del pollo. Actualmente Silvia esta embrazada, espera a su primer hijo razon por la cual esta mas motivada que nunca de ademas de la crianza de pollo añadir la de pavo, para asi tenr mejores ingresos y darle mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar pavos y empezar a engordarlos porque en 5 meses inician las festividades del pueblo donde aumenta la demanda. con tu ayuda silvia hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase turkeys.

loans.name: Elda Maria

texts.es:
Elda is married and is the mother of two children who are 17 and 7 years of age. Two years ago, she began to sell refreshments to help and contribute towards expenses. Because of this situation and so not to neglect her home, she began to sell refreshments in her own home. Currently, her sales are greater but she lacks capital to invest in more merchandise. And, since the distance to the distributor is far, and she needs to buy more, she doesn't want to pay for freight service so that her business is more profitable.

She is requesting a loan of US $250, which she will repay in three months, in order to purchase merchandise. With your help, Elda C. move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Elda, es casada y madre de 2 hijos de 17 y 7 años. Comenzó hace 2 años a vender refrescos para ayudarse con sus gastos y contribuir con los gastos , por tal situación y para no descuidar su casa comenzó a vender refrescos en su propio hogar, en la actualidad sus ventas ya son mayores, y le hace falta capital para invertir en mas mercancía, ya que la distancia a la distribuidora es lejana y necesita comprar mas para no estar pagando servicio de flete tan seguido y que su negocio sea mas rentable.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia. con tu ayuda Elda saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel is a humble 37-year-old mother. She left her hometown of Pusi more than 11 years ago along with her husband and children with the hope of finding better living conditions. They currently live in the city of Juliaca, and with the little money they took with them, they have constructed their home where they currently shelter their loving children.

Soon after arriving in this city, she started weaving beautiful skirts, pants and ponchos for women and children, which she sells as a peddler in the San José market of that city. Her hard-working husband, Felix, offers transportation services in his tricycle. As exemplary and responsible dedicated parents, they have been offering an education to their loving children, but especially to Edwar, their youngest, who due to life circumstances was born with a serious illness and is the chief motivator of their efforts and immeasurable desire to progress with their noble work and without losing hope of seeing their children in the path to a bright future.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

Ysabel, es una humilde madre de 37 años de edad, hace más de 11 años salió de su pueblo natal, Pusi, junto a su esposo y sus hijos con la esperanza de buscar mejores oportunidades de vida.Actualmente radican en la ciudad de Juliaca, con el poco dinero que llevaban en las manos han construido su vivienda, lugar donde actualmente cobijan a sus amorosos hijos.

Doña Ysabel inmediatamente después de llegar a esta ciudad se dedicó a tejer hermosas enaguas, pantalones, chompas para damas y niños que vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado San José de dicha ciudad.En tanto, su laborioso esposo Félix, trabaja brindando servicios de movilidad en su triciclo, ambos como ejemplares padres responsables y dedicados vienen brindándoles educación a sus 3 queridos hijos y sobre todo a Edwar el menor de sus niños, quien por cuestiones de la vida nació con una grave enfermedad y es el principal motivo de su esfuerzo e innumerables ganas de seguir adelante con su noble labor y sin perder la esperanza de ver a sus hijos encaminados hacia un buen porvenir.

loans.use: Purchase capital to increase the variety of products they offer.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
The enthusiasm and joy that Magdalena transmits daily to her clients is her best advertisement and the chief reason that her customers buy their products from her. This diligent woman is both a mother and father to her young teenage children, who thanks to their team effort are achieving to improve their living standards. Magdalena sells school supplies and haberdashery, merchandise she offers as a peddler through the main intersections and local fairs in the city of Juliaca. Magdalena has planned to expand her business and to do that, she has come to us to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

El entusiasmo y alegría que día a día transmite a sus clientes es su mejor carta de presentación y el principal motivo que tiene Doña Magdalena para que sus clientes adquieran sus productos. Esta diligente mujer es padre y madre de sus dos adolescentes hijos, quienes gracias al trabajo en equipo que desempeñan están logrando mejorar su calidad de vida, Magdalena se dedica al negocio de venta de útiles escolares y mercería, mercadería que ofrece en forma ambulatoria por las principales arterias y las ferias locales de su localidad Juliaca.Magdalena tiene proyectado ampliar su negocio y para ello se presenta ante vosotros para solicitarte un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Pascuala

texts.es:
Two years ago, Maria Pascuala started her business raising chickens in the patio of her house in order to help her husband with household expenses. He did not have a steady income since he only worked a few days a week as a motorcycle taxi driver. For this reason they needed extra income for household expenses and those of their 2-year-old son.

Currently she needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 3 months, as she would like to increase the number of chickens since her business has gone well and has more demand. With your help this will be possible

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Pascuala empezó su negocio hace 2 años, la crianza pollos en el patio de su casa para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que el no cuenta con un sueldo seguro ya que solo trabaja unos días a la semana como chofer de una moto taxi y por esta razon requiern de ingresos extra para los gastos de la csa y los de su hijo de 2 años.

Actualmente necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses ya que desea incrementar la cantidad de pollos, esto gracias a que le ha ido bien y tienen mayor demanda. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase chickens.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva is very popular and well-liked in her city. Ever since she took the responsibility of caring for her two loving children all on her own, she has worked in different activities with the goal of offering them superior schooling so that they have better opportunities for work in the future. Genoveva currently runs a small candy stand in a highly-frequented street in the city of Juliaca. In addition to that job, she buys and sells American stuffed animals on the weekends. Thanks to her efforts, and especially her desire for self-improvement with her two activities, she has managed to obtain great results but she believes that with more investment capital, she could improve her income considerably.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

Genoveva, es muy popular y querida en su localidad, desde que se hizo cargo sola de sus dos queridos hijos, trabajó en diferentes actividades con el fin de ofrecerles estudios superiores a fin de que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo.Doña Genoveva actualmente tiene un pequeño puestito de golosinas en una concurrida avenida de la ciudad de Juliaca, adicionalmente a esta labor los fines de semana se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de peluches americanos; gracias a su empeño y sobre todo voluntad de superación en las dos actividades a las que se dedica esta logrando obtener buenos resultados pero cree que con mayor presupuesto de inversión podría mejorar considerablemente sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Increase capital to increase the variety of her products.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
We found Feliciana very happily tending to her candy stand. This diligent mother of three loving children works hard daily with the goal of maintaining her children without any financial deprivation and offering them a good education. Her little stand is situated in a very strategic location in the city of Juliaca. Taking advantage of this location, she decided to offer telephone services as well as battery recharging services. Thanks to these activities, she has managed to offer her children the most valuable inheritance - an education. Feliciana believes that selling sodas and some fruits could further satisfy her customers’ requests and at the same time, increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a Feliciana, muy contenta atendiendo su puestito D. golosinas, esta diligente madre D. 3 queridos hijos se esfuerza diariamente con el fin D. mantener sin privaciones económicas y brindarles una buena educación a sus retoños.Su puestito D. ventas está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, aprovechando dicho lugar decidió también ofrecer llamadas móviles y brindar servicio D. recarga D. baterías; gracias a estas actividades está logrando brindarles la herencia más granD. a sus hijos, su educación.Feliciana considera que vendiendo bebidas gaseosas y algunas frutas podría satisfacer aún más las solicitudes D. sus clientes y al mismo tiempo incrementar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase capital to increase the variety of products she offers.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Since she was very young, Maria has been selling cosmetics through catalog. Thanks to her sales abilities and the great number of acquaintances she has, she made this occupation her principal source of income. Accompanied by her catalogs, she travels daily throughout the city to offer her beauty products to obtain as many orders as possible with the goal of increasing her earnings and open her own cosmetics boutique in the near future. With this objective in mind and with the hope she places on us, she hopes to receive your support.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

María, desde muy jovencita se dedicó al negocio de venta de cosméticos de belleza por pedidos, gracias a sus cualidades para la venta y a la gran cantidad de amistades que tiene hizo de este oficio su principal ingreso económico.Ella, acompañada de sus catálogos diariamente recorre su ciudad para ofrecer sus cosméticos de belleza y obtener la mayor cantidad de solicitudes posibles con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y en un plazo no muy lejano abrir su boutique de productos cosméticos, con ese objetivo en mente y con la esperanza depositada en vosotros espera recibir tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase capital to increase the variety of products she offers.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is an exemplary and loving mother whom has been deceived many times during her life. Since her children's father abandoned her, she has worked very hard to support them so that they don't suffer from this traumatic situation. This diligent mother used to sell hats on the street, but in very small quantities. Now realizing the needs of her children she decided to ask for help from lenders and invest in her business. Currently, with much hard work and dedication her business is experiencing success, with which she has been able to provide safety and tranquility for her two precious children. Nelly now sells her merchandise in two large booths within one of the busiest markets in Juliaca, and aspires to amplify her business to increase her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly, es una madre ejemplar y muy amorosa que ha sufrido muchas decepciones en la vida, desde que la abandonó el padre de sus hijos trabajó arduamente con el fin de que sus retoños no pasen limitaciones económicas y no sufran dicho abandono. Esta diligente madre en un principio vendía sombreros y gorras en muy pocas cantidades y en forma ambulatoria, pero viendo las necesidades de sus hijos decidió recurrir a la ayuda de instituciones e invertir mayor capital en su negocio. Actualmente con esfuerzo, mucha dedicación y entrega su negocio viene proporcionándole buenos frutos, con la cual tiene la dicha de brindarles seguridad y tranquilidad a sus dos amados hijos.Nelly ahora cuenta con dos amplios puestos de venta al interior de uno de los mercados más concurrido de la ciudad de Juliaca, y ahora aspira aumentar su capital de inversión, está segura que con dicha inversión mejorará notablemente su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase hats to amplify  her business.

loans.name: Marizol

texts.es:
Marisol is a woman who, as a result of the great responsibility she assumed at a young age, was able to complete her advanced studies to become a teacher. Now, due to the lack of job opportunities, cannot work as a teacher. Because of this and the support of her husband, who works as teacher in the city of Juliaca, Marisol started a business selling clothes and towels. Marisol has always believed that with dedication and hard work she could become one of the largest clothing distributors, and now with your support she can realize this desire. Marisol awaits your helping hand, don't disappoint her.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Marisol, es una mujer que pese a la responsabilidad tan grande que asumió a muy corta edad, pudo concluir sus estudios superiores de maestra, ahora, viendo la falta de oportunidades de trabajo no puede ejercer su profesión.Es por ello que con apoyo de su esposo quien se desempeña como profesor en un centro educativo de la ciudad de Juliaca viene incursionando en el negocio de venta de prendas de vestir y toallas al por mayor, Marizol siempre estuvo segura que con voluntad, dedicación y entrega podría convertirse en una de las distribuidoras más grandes de estas prendas y ahora con el apoyo de cada uno de vosotros podría cristalizar este anhelo.Marizol se encuentra en espera de tu mano amiga, no la defraudes.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and towels for her business.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga learned how to embroider from her mother when she was a girl. Now that she has her own family, she decided to begin embroidering as a business. This way she helps her husband, who works as a bricklayer and does not have a steady income. She started working from home 8 years ago when her acquaintances began to ask her to embroider some clothing.

She now needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy material and thread so she can finish some embroidery work she has pending. With your help, Olga will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Olga aprendió a bordar desde niña con su mama, ahora que ya tiene su propia familia decidió empezar a bordar como negocio y con eso ayuda a su pareja quien trabaja como albañil, por lo que su ingreso no es seguro. Comenzó hace 8 años en casa, cuando entre sus mismos conocidos le empezaron a pedir que les bordara algunas prendas.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir la tela y los hilos para poder terminar los bordados que tiene pendientes. Con tu ayuda Olga saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buy supplies for her work.

loans.name: Esthela

texts.es:
Esthela started her business after her husband suffered an accident at his old job that left him without work. He didn't have insurance to cover the medical bills and they had many debts. Their triplets had only recently been born and there was no money for household expenses. She needed to care for her husband and children and scrape together enough money to pay for medicine, therapy for her husband and everyday household expenses. She started what's now a tortilleria (a shop for making and selling tortillas) four years ago, working at home so that she could be there to care for her family. Thanks to the business, she's been able to support them.

Esthela is applying for US$600 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can remodel her shop and expand it so that she can better service her customers. With your help, she'll be able to do it.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Esthela inició el negocio ya que su esposo se encontraba desempleado debido a que había sufrido un accidente en su antiguo trabajo, y no contaba con seguro de gastos médicos, tenían muchas deudas, sus trillizos estaban recién nacidos, no tenia dinero para el gasto familiar. Ella necesitaba sacar adelante a su esposo, e hijos, tener dinero para medicinas, terapia de su esposo, y para el gasto familiar. Comenzó su negocio hace cuatro años, decidió emprenderlo en su casa para sacar adelante a su familia, sin tener que descuidarlos, fue asi como inicio la que haora es una tortilleria, gracias a esta ha podido salir adelante.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para hacer una remodelación en su negocio, el cual ampliara, para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Remodel shop.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma's family is filled with talented artists who use their creativity to make beautiful paintings. When she was a little girl Normal learned to paint, and has continued to improve since. Thanks to her performance and dedication she has been able to sell her works outside of her neighborhood, and therefore has earned more money. For this reason she is asking you for a loan which with she will purchase material to use in the creation of her beautiful works of art. Your support will allow this diligent and talented mother to reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Toda la familia de Norma da muestra de la elaboración de bellos trabajos y de la inmensa creatividad que poseen al elaborar sus bellos cuadros; ella desde niña aprendió esta labor y sus cualidades le han dado la posibilidad de mejorarlos.Gracias a su desempeño y dedicación pueden ofrecer sus productos fuera de su zona de residencia y en ellos obtener mayores ganancias, debido a esa razón en esta oportunidad recurren a vosotros para solicitarte un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus bellos trabajos.Nuestro aporte permitirá cristalizar los deseos de esta diligente y talentosa madre.

loans.use: Purchase art supplies.

loans.name: Laura Patricia

texts.es:
Laura is married and the mother of 3 children: 12-year old Laurita and 3-year old twins, Pedro and Pablo. She started her business three years ago after the the twins were born. They were born premature and needed several expensive operations and other care. Her husband was out of work and she needed to start a business at home so that she could both care for the kids and help with the family's expenses. She now makes and sells flour torillas. She started by selling the tortillas to neighbors and, over time, her business has grown and her sales have increased.

Laura is applying for a US$500 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, that she will use to remodel the business (expand it) so that she can offer better service to her customers. With your help, Laura will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Laura es casada y madre D. 3 hijos Laurita D. 12 años, y unos gemelos Pedro y Pablo D. 3 años. Inició el negocio hace tres años, cuando nacieron sus gemelos, los cuales nacieron prematuros, y requirieron varias operaciones, y tratamientos muy caros, su esposo se encontraba desempleado, y se vio en la necesidad D. emprender un negocio en su casa para ayudar al gasto familiar, y poder cuidar a sus hijos .menores. Ella necesitaba dinero para operar a sus gemelitos, y requería D. una entrada D. dinero para poder salir adelante con el gasto familiar. Comenzó su negocio hace tres años, ya que su esposo estaba desempleado y no contaban con ningún recurso, fue entonces que empezó a hacer tortillas D. harina y las vendía a sus vecinos, con el paso del tiempo, su negocio creció y sus ventas aumentaron.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses el cual le servirá para remodelar el negocio (Ampliarlo), así podar ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Laura saldra adelante.

loans.use: Expand business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Right after finishing high school, Juan decided to leave his village, Atuncolla, in search of a better future. Since then he has been living in the city of Juliaca. As he has not been able to find work, he decided to rent a moto-taxi (motorcycle-taxi) and work as a chauffeur. With the savings from this endeavor he was finally able to purchase his own moto-taxi. Now he is required to join a company so that he can insure his vehicle. As joining the company is very expensive, Juan is asking for a loan to help him bear the initial cost.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Apenas concluyó sus estudios secundarios Juan decidió salir de su pueblo natal Atuncolla en busca de un mejor porvenir, desde entonces radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, al ver que no lograba conseguir trabajo decidió alquilarse un mototaxi y prestar servicios de movilidad, con los ahorros que fue reuniendo durante el tiempo que trabajaba pudo finalmente adquirir su propia movilidad.Ahora le exigen que se asocie a una empresa, para que los servicios que preste sean seguros y formales y todo ese trámite le demanda un gasto económico sustancial, Juan espera recibir tu colaboración para llevar a cabo este propósito.

loans.use: Help defray the initial cost of joining a transportation company.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel is married and has 5 children, all grown and no longer dependent on him. He earned a living selling cheese and chorizo in the state of Tamaulipas for more than 20 years. Due to family problems, he moved to the city of Monterrey to live with his son and since he knows how to make cheese and chorizo, he started a business selling them in the city. Thanks to the business, he's been able to earn enough money to support himself.

Manuel is applying for a US$700 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that he can buy merchandise and go on selling his products. With your help, Manuel will continue to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Manuel es casado y tine 5 hijos quienes son mayores y ya no dependen economicamente de el. Se dedica en la venta de queso y chorizo desde hace mas de 20 años, en el estado de Tamaulipas pero debido a que tuvo problemas familiares, se vino a la ciudad de Monterrey a casa de su hijo a vivir y como sabe hacer queso y chorizo inicio el negocio en la ciudad hace algunos años, y gracias a esto ha podido obtener ingresos que le permiten solventar sus gastos.

El solicita un prestamo por US $700 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y asi poder seguir vendiendo los productos. Con tu apoyo Manuel seguira adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lupita is married and has 3 children, 22, 18 and 16. Her husband, Manuel Arellano Hernandez, is a construction worker. She started working primarily to help her father-in-law who, for more than 10 years, had earned a living selling cheese and chorizo. He had just arrived from the countryside so, to help him and to help her husband with household expenses, she decided to start selling and little by little she's managed to earn a good income.

Now she need a US$700 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can stock more merchandise and buy a display case for more kinds of cheeses and chorizo. With your help, Lupita can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Lupita es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 22,18,16 años. Su esposo Manuel Arellano Hernandez trabaja como albanil. Inició el negocio primero para apoyara su suegro en la venta de queso y chorizo quien desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica a esto, para que se ayudara porque acababa de llegar del rancho, despues como necesitaba ella tambien dinero para apoyar a su esposo en la economia familiar decidio empezar a vender y poco a poco ha logrado buenos ingresos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $ 700 que pagara en 6 meses para poder invertirlo en mercancia y comprar un aparador para vender mas tipos de queso y chorizo en su casa. con tu ayuda Lupita hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Haidee Sarai

texts.es:
Haidee started her business when she had the chance to sell clinical uniforms at the office where she works. She liked the idea because it didn't require much extra effort to find the clothing since it was provided for her in the same place.

She wanted to have her own business but didn't know what to do, until in a few chats she was offered to help with the sale of clinical uniforms where this was needed. She accepted the offer, since the business could also bring extra income to pay for the household expenses.

She started four years ago, when she sold one or two uniforms. But later, as she got to know more people in other locations, she placed more clothing and was able to increase her earnings and replentish supplies.

She now needs a loan for US $600 which she will pay back in 6 months. The loan will help her by enabling her to buy more clothing since she has a considerable order from some girls and must have it ready in the next days.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Haidee inició el negocio cuando surgio la oportunidad de vender uniformes clinicos en la oficina donde trabaja y le gusto la idea porque no tendria que esforzarme demasiado en conseguir las prendas porque alli mismo las proporcionaban. Ella queria poner su propio negocio pero no sabia de que, hasta que en platicas le ofrecieron que les ayudara a vender uniformes clinicos en los lugares donde se dedicaban a esto y acepto la propuesta, ademas de que esto representaria un ingreso extra para poder solventar los gastos que tiene en su casa. Comenzó hace 4 años con el negocio y en un inicio solo vendia uno o dos uniformes, pero despues conforme fue conociendo a mas gente de otros lugares fue colocando mas prendas, gracias a esto puede incrementar mas sus ganancias e ir surtiendo a la vez para no quedarse sin mercancia.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses que la va a ayudar para poder comprar mas prendas porque tiene un pedido considerable de unas chicas y debe de tenerlo listo para los proximos dias.

loans.use: Comprar mas mercancia / Purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan started his business after he tried working at other jobs and couldn't make enough to support his family. For that reason, he had to start his own transport business and it's worked so far because, thanks to the business, he's been able to cover his needs and those of his family.

Juan started the business some years ago and since then he hasn't stopped working for even a day. He rented the bus at first but then came to own it because making monthly payments when he was renting didn't leave much of a margin. Now that the bus is his, he gets a little more use from it but he has to ensure that it's properly maintained to avoid having to replace parts so often.

Juan is applying for a US$975 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that he can buy some parts for the bus that need to be replaced and also to be have an extra reserve for gas. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Juan inició el negocio porque habia intentado trabajar en otras partes y no le alcanzaba con su sueldo para sostener los gastos de la casa, por eso tuvo que optar por arrancar su propio negocio de transporte y hasta la fecha le ha funcionado porque gracias a esto ha podido cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia.

Comenzó hace varios años con el negocio y desde entonces no ha parado de trabajar un solo dia. En un inicio solo rentaba el microbus pero ya despues se quedo con el y pudo sacar mas ganacia porque si lo rentaba tenia que pagar cuota y no le dejaba mucho margen de ganancia, ahora que es suyo tiene un poco mas de utilidad pero de todas maneras tiene que estar dandole mantenimiento para que no tenga que cambiar las piezas tan rapidamente.

El solicita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar unas piezas que ya necesitan cambiarle al microbus y tambien para tener una reserva extra para la gasolina. Con tu ayuda esto sersa posible.

loans.use: Bus maintenance for transport business.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun C., 32, and her husband, Mr. Hong Tol were married in 1998. They have three children--two sons and a daughter. One of the children is in school. The family lives along National Road number five about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Yun has been selling grocery items for 10 years. Her husband is a taxi driver. Currently, she is in the process of creating another business. She is building a shop in front of her house to sell coffee to travelers, but lacks the money to complete the shop.

Mrs. Yun is requesting a loan of $1000 to build her coffee shop.

loans.use: To build a coffee shop

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Mr. Sarun Chorn, 51, and his wife, Mrs. Saron Chem (shown in the picture) were married in 1977. They have nine children--three sons and six daughters. Three of the children are married and live outside the family home. The other six children live at home. Four of the children are in school and the other two are garment factory workers. The family lives along National Road number five about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. (Note: Mr.Sarun is not in the picture because he was busy teaching at school. His wife appears in the picture instead.)

Mr. Sarun has been a primary school principal for many years while his wife stays at home take care of the children. He started teaching when he finished with his studies.

Mr. Sarun is requesting a loan of $1200 to fill in the land around his house.

loans.use: To fill in the land around the house.

loans.name: Khean

texts.en:
Mrs. Khean K., 40, and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Meach, 47, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have four children--two sons and two daughters. One of the children weaves silk at home, and the other three are in school.

Mrs. Khean has been a silk weaver for over 10 years. This is a skill that she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Saroeun has been a taxi driver for over 10 years. The couple is in the process of building their new house. They need money to buy lattices to make the walls of the house.

Mrs. Khean is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase lattices to use to make the walls of their house.

loans.use: To purchase lattices to use to make the walls of the house that she is building.

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorn S., 36, and her husband, Mr. Srong Chrouk, 39, live across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have three children--two sons and a daughter. Two of the children are in a local school, and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Sarorn has been a primary school teacher for 18 years and Mr. Srong has been a secondary school teacher for 19 years. Besides teaching, the couple has also been operating a motorcycle cleaning shop in front of their house for 3 years.

Mrs. Sarorn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter (shown in the picture in the middle) to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to school.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin N., 28, and her husband, Mr. Sinat Ny, 32, live across Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have three sons (shown in the picture).

Mrs. Sophoin has been a silk weaver for five years. This is a skill that she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sinat has been a fisherman for eight years. He fishes from a river and lake near the village and sells the fish to villagers. His boat is old and broken. He needs money to purchase a new boat and fishing net.

Mrs. Sophoin is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase one boat and fishing net for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase one boat and fishing net .

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy T., 40, and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Theng, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1988 and have a son and a daughter. The daughter helps in the business and the son is in school.

Mrs. T. has been selling cucumber pickles and fruit for seven years. She buys them from her village, and other nearby villages, and resales them at the market in Phnom Penh. Cucumber pickles are very popular for people who live in Phnom Penh and nearby province. Mr. Theng has been a motor taxi driver for three years and also assists in his wife’s business. Mrs. T. has hired one shop to sell pickles and fruit. Now she needs money to buy a shop to run the business.

Mrs. T. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a shop to sell fruit and pickles.

loans.use: To purchase a shop to sell fruit and pickles.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum S., 32, and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Poun, 34, live along National Road about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have a son and a daughter.

Mrs. S. and her husband have been selling fish for five years. They buy fish from the Ta Kmao market to resale in Phnom Penh. The couple carries fish from the village to Phnom Penh in the early morning, and finishes their selling around noon.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to expand her fish selling business.

loans.use: To expand the fish selling business

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun P., 60, and her husband, Mr. Sen Van, 62, live across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1971 and have eight children--one son and seven daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home. The remaining three children live at home. Two of the children weave silk at home, and the other child is in school.

Mrs. P. has been a silk weaver for two years. This is a skill that she learned from her daughters. She sells her finished products to a man from the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Van is a carpenter. Before starting this business, the couple grew rice and vegetables on their farm.

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Ajara's Group

texts.en: Ajara is a leader of a three person group. They trade in various items ranging from fresh tubers of yam, bags of maize, charcoal, cloths, scarves etc. The women are all married with children who are currently in school. They have been trading for several years in foodstuffs and clothing and now want to expand their operations to enable them to support their husbands and help take care of the family. They believe this loan will help them to inject more capital into the businesses as their operations are capital intensive. They belong to the group called "Ahobrasee" meaning Humbleness. Members agree to co-guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy yams, maize, charcoal, cloths and scarves

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng C., 51, and her husband, Mr. Chea Ou, 52, live on an Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have seven children--three sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. The remaining four children live at home. Two are construction workers and the other two are in school.

Mrs. Seng has been farming and working as a silk weaver since 1979. These are skills that she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to a man from the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Chea farms and raises cows.

Mrs. Seng is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk material for weaving, and also to buy zinc to roof her daughter’s home.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en:
Mrs. Nheb C., age 56, and her husband, live across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for 20 years and have 3 daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. The youngest daughter sells meatballs in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Nheb has been a silk weaver for 29 years. This is a skill that she learned from a nearby villager. She sells her finished products to a man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises cows in the village. Mrs. Nheb is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk material for weaving..

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy B., age 43, and her husband, Mr. Morn Chhit, age 45, were married in 1985. They have 5 children: 1 son and 4 daughters. Three of their children are garment-factory workers and the other 2 are in school. The family lives along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chanthy has been in the business of renting VCDs to villagers for 1 year. Before she started this business, she was selling desserts. Mr. Morn has been fishing since 1985. He fishes from a lake in the village to sell at the Prek Pnao market. Now the couple is creating another business: producing rice wine to sell. Chanthy is requesting a loan of US$1000 to produce rice wine to sell.

loans.use: To produce rice wine for selling

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mr. Sary L., age 27, is divorced and lives with his widowed mother and 1 younger brother along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. His brother is in high school.

Mr. Sary has been a beauty products seller for 5 years, a skill he learned from his uncle. He bought the products from the market in Phnom Penh for resale in Kampong Cham province about 150 kilometers from his home and at a nearby village. Mr. Sary is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase more beauty products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for resale

loans.name: Phary

texts.en:
Mrs. Phary M., age 24, and her husband, Mr. Vutha Teb, age 39, who live along National Road Number Two about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2006 and have 1 son.

Mrs. Phary has been selling grocery items and vegetables for 1 year. She bought them from Ta Kmao market for resale in her home district. Mr. Vutha has been a soldier for 5 years. Currently, Mrs. Phary has a very small number of grocery items to sell, and she needs to purchase more grocery items such as wine, noodles, candy, sugar, pepper, and fish to sell to the villagers who don’t want to waste the time traveling to the market.

So she is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase more grocery items to increase her inventory for resale at her shop.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale

loans.name: Sokkea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokkea P. (shown in the picture with her husband and the land to build their house), age 28, and her husband, Mr. Visal Nub, age 28, who live in Ta Khmao district about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2005 and have 1 son.

Mrs. Sokkea has been a garment-factory worker for 8 years. Mr. Visal has been a garment-factory worker for almost 4 years as well. Currently, Mrs. Sokkea and her husband live with her parents. Now the couple wants to build their own house but lack some money. So Mrs. Sokkea is requesting a loan of US$800 to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family

loans.name: Samut

texts.en:
Mrs. Samut P., age 43, and her husband, Mr. Sal Sum, age 51, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have 6 children: 3 sons and 3 daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Of the other 3 children, 1 of them is a construction worker and the other 2 are in a local school.

Mrs. Samut and her husband have been farming for 40 years. They grow rice and many kinds of vegetables in the village. Besides the farming business, Mr. Sal is also a carpenter as well. Now Mrs. Samut is requesting a loan of US$600 to rent more land for farming and some for repairing her house.

loans.use: To rent a field for farming and repairing her house

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng C., age 53, and her husband, Mr. Pin Pang, age 51, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1981 and have 6 children: 5 sons and 1 daughter. Their daughter is a hairdresser at home. Of the other 5 sons, 4 of them are in school, and the oldest son helps in his father’s business.

Mrs. Seng has been selling mangoes for 5 years. She bought them from her villagers for resale at the market in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Pin has been in the business of recharging batteries and cleaning a motor shop for 3 years.

Now Mrs. Seng is requesting a loan of US$300 to rebuild a beauty salon for her daughter.

loans.use: To rebuild a beauty salon for her daughter

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy C., age 38, and his wife, Mrs. Rith Pich, age 38, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have 3 sons. All of them are in local school.

Mr. Vuthy has been a blacksmith for 7 years. He operates his business in Phnom Penh and the nearby province. Mrs. Rith has been a weaver for 23 years, but now she stopped her weaving business and created another business of selling food in the village.

Mr. Vuthy is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase blacksmith materials for expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith materials for expanding his business

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun Y., age 27, and her husband, Mr. Sokkheng Sum, age 36, who live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2003 and have 1 daughter. The couple lives with her parents.

Mrs. Sokhoeun has been a silk weaver for 15 years, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Sokkheng has been a silk weaver for 3 years. He learned his skill from his wife.

Mrs. Sokhoeun is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Rachna

texts.en:
Mrs. Rachna B., age 38, and her husband, Mr. Khan Preab, age 39, who live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1992 and have 4 children: 2 sons and 2 daughters. One of their daughters weaves silk at home and the others are in school.

Mrs. Rachna has been a silk weaver for 20 years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Khan has been a ferry-boat repairer for 3 years.

Mrs. Rachna is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny D., age 58, is a widow who lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has 5 children: 1 son and 4 daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home. Of the other 3 children, 2 of them have full-time employment and the other one does farming.

Mrs. Ny has been farming since she was young. She grows jasmine flowers, fruits, and other kinds of vegetables in the farm near her house for her daughter to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase jack fruits and longans for her daughter to sell at the market in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase jack fruits and longans for her daughter to sell at the market in Phnom Penh

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married with four children. All of her children are currently in school. She treks to the nearby villages to buy foodstuffs like gari (milled and fried cassava), maize and cocoyams and then retails them in the local market. Due to an inadequate supply of foodstuffs, there is high demand in the market that has created a good business environment for Elizabeth. Unfortunately, high transport costs do not allow Elizabeth to purchase in large quantities. Elizabeth would like to use the loan to buy more foodstuffs to increase her inventory. She is a member of the group Humbleness. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bags of gari (milled and fried cassava), maize and cocoyam

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married with two children. She has been selling soft drinks for ten years. She used to sell at the road side but with the support from her husband and Sinapi she now has a store of her own. She currently sells snacks to passengers and drivers as her store is close to a lorry station. She wants to stock a larger variety of soft drinks to meet the tastes and preferences of her loyal clients. Abena is a member of the group called “Lydia Mma” meaning Lydia’s children. Lydia is the mother who formed the group in the community to seek financial support to the economically active but poor women. Hence the name, Lydia “Mma” to honor her. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks and assorted biscuits

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is a mother with five children. She is a petty trader that has been selling products like tinned tomatoes, canned fish, fresh tomatoes, egg plants, etc in her community for 26 years. Currently she has realized that there is high demand for pastry foods. Therefore she wants to begin preparing and selling pastries to increase her income. She believes the new business line will help her save money to register for the government sponsored Health Insurance. Her family would then be able to enjoy free medical care. Fati is a member of a group called “Hankuri”. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase pastry flour and more grocery products like oil, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is married with four children. Her children are currently in school. She loves selling and has therefore used part of the veranda in front of her room to sell various items like eggs, fresh tomatoes, eggplant, onions, washing soaps, charcoal, etc to generate income to support  her family needs. Georgina has currently ran out of stock and wants to buy more products like washing soap, fresh tomatoes, fresh yams, spices, etc to enable her to continue her operations. She is a member of the group called St. John. Members agree to co-guarantee for each to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is newly married and thanks Sinapi for helping him. After learning the tailoring trade, Michael did not have the start up capital to begin a business but a friend introduced him Sinapi and he secured a loan to start out on his own. Since Sinapi has helped him, Michael has decided to train others and has now recruited four people to train. He wants to use the loan to buy an embroidery machine and sewing materials to expand his operation. He hopes that  this loan will also help his wife to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy embroidery machine and sewing materials

loans.name: Ayeshetu

texts.en: Ayeshetu is married with three children.
