loans.use: To ask for a loan to start a cow breeding business.

loans.name: Gulrakat

texts.ru:
Gulrakat K. lives in Yavan. She is 29 years old and is not married. Gulrakat works as a nurse at the medical center in her village. In addition, she raises livestock. Gulrakat has a small farm, but due to weather conditions all the grass has dried out and there are problems with getting animal feed. Gulrakat would now like to purchase hay and needs to take out a 6 month loan to do this. This loan is her only way to save her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Гулракат жительница города Яван. 29 лет , не замужем. Работает медсестрой в медецинском центре их кишлака. Кроме того занимается животноводством.Имеет небольшое хозяйство. Но в связи с погодными условиями посохла вся трава. Поэтому возникли проблемы с кормами. Сейчас она хочет купить сено , но для этого необходимо получить кредит со сроком на 6 месяцев.Это пока единственный способ сохранить дело.

loans.use: Purchase Feed

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Mrs. Vy L., 48, and her husband, Mr. Noun Khut were married in 1980. They have eight children, three sons and five daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Of the other seven children, who all live at home, four are garment workers and three children are in local school. The family lives along National Road Number Five, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Vy has been selling cucumber pickles for four years, and her husband assists her in the business. She buys cucumbers from the market and makes the pickles by herself at home to resell. When we visited her house, we noted that the house is very small and has a lot of family members to live in it. She told us that she wants to expand her house to become larger than how it is now, but she lacks some money. So, Vy is requesting a loan of US$800 to purchase wood to expand her house for her family members to live in it.

loans.use: Vy would like to purchase wood to expand her house.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Mrs. Sophy P. is a farmer in Chambork Thom Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a 31 year old mother of three, whom are all currently attending a local school. Her husband, Mr. Roeurn Chum, is a motorcycle repairer in the village. His business faces difficulties because he has insufficient money to purchase more motorbike equipment for his customers. Thus, Mrs. Sophy P. would like to ask for a loan to buy motorbike equipments for her husband business.  Previously, Mrs. Sophy P. obtained a loan from AMK to start her husband's business. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy motorbike equipment

loans.name: Hirobon

texts.ru:
Hirobon B. lives in the city of Yavan. She takes care of the household and farm animals. She has a cow and sells the cow's milk to the neighbors. Hirobon would like to begin producing yogurts. But there is not enough milk from one cow for this kind of business. This is why Hirobon would like to purchase another milk cow. Additional milk will help Hirobon start her business. She is 50 years old and has 3 children. They live together and help each other. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобомуродова Хиробон проживает в городе Яван. Домохозяйка , занимается животноводством. Имеет корову , молоко которой продает соседям. Хочет начать свой бизнес по производству кисло-молочных продуктов . Но получаемого молока не хватает для такого рода производства. Пэтому она хочет получить кредит и купить еще одну дойную корову. Дополнительное молоко поможет Хиробон начать свой бизнес. Ей 50 лет и она имеет 3 детей , и все они живут дружно и весело. Погашать кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru:
Murodjon R. lives in the city of Nurek. He is 22, single and does not have children. He has been trading for the past 3 years. He has a small place where he sells DVDs. Murodjon would like to increase his sales by receiving a loan. This will help him increase his family income and help his parents. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Рискулов Муроджон житель города Норак. Возраст 22 года, холост , детей не имеет.Уже три года занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку , где продает ДВД диски. Хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Это поможет ему увеличить доходы семьи и помочь родителям. Погасить кредит планирует 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase new items for sale

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn D. is a 50 year old widow who lives Prey Chap Lich Village in Kampong Speu Province. She has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, one is attending school and the other two remain at home because they are too young to work or enroll in school.

Mrs. D. is currently in grocery business. She would like a loan to expand and increase profits from her business. As the value of land is going up, Mrs. Morn D. would like to use profits from her grocery business to invest in a piece of land in order to re-sell in the future.

loans.use: Expand grocery business

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru:
Shahlo M. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 31 years old and not married. She lives with her parents and trades for a living. She sells ice cream at the main market. She wants to purchase another refregirator in order to increase product variety. She wants to purchase drinks for sale. This is why she hopes to receive a loan, which she plans to repay within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Матчиева Шахло жительница города Явана. Ей 31 год . она не замужем. Живет со своими родителями . на жизнь она зарабатывает путем торговли . Торгует мороженным на центральном рынке. Хочет купить еще один холодильник для того , чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Хочет закупить напитки и продавать их на разлив. Для этого она планирует получить кредит погасить который сможет погасить в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita S. is a tailor in Kuleshwor town. She lives in a single family home with her husband and daughter. Her husband's name is Gajendra S. and he works in a government office. Her daughter is studying for her BBS (Bachelor in Business Study).
Mrs. S. opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, Blouses, Ladies long dresses, Makhshi, and others. Now she is requesting for a Rs 15000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wishes to use her earnings to upgrade the living standard of her family and support her daughter’s education.

loans.use: Rita would like to buy raw materials for her work as a seamstress and tailor.

loans.name: Anju Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Anju Kumari T., 26 years old, is a tailor in the town of Kuleshwor. Her husband's name is Hari Bahadur T.. She has two sons, both of whom are studying in primary school. Anju opened her tailoring shop 3 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses like the Kurta Sulwar, which are very popular with Nepali women. Before starting her own business, Mrs. T. took a 6 month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her.

Anju is requesting for a Rs 15000.00 loan to use to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use the shop's income for self improvement and for her sons’ education. In Nepal the cost of good education is very high and Mrs. T. is saving her income to provide good education for her sons.

loans.use: Anju would like to buy raw materials for her work as a tailor and seamstress.

loans.name: Resami

texts.en:
Mrs. Resami S. lives in Kuleshwor, located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses like grocery businesses, tailoring shops and so on. Mrs. S. lives in a joint family home with her husband, father-in-law and mother-in-law. Her husband's name is Mr. Rajesh S. and he works in a private office.

Resami is a tailor in Kuleshwor. She opened her tailoring shop two years ago to upgrade the living standard of her family. Before starting her own business she took 6 months of training for tailoring work. She makes different types of ladies' dresses in her shop. She especially prefers to makes popular ladies' dresses like Kurta-Sulwar. Now she is requesting for her second loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: Resami would like to buy raw materials for her work as a tailor.

loans.name: Ashurbeg

texts.ru:
Åshurbeg D. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 50 years old, married and has eight children. He has led a private services business for the past 30 years. He works as a shoe repair man. In order to attract new clients and improve the services he provides, Ashurbeg wants to receive a loan and purchase new equipment. This will help raise his profits and improve living conditions for his children. Besides, his shop is the only shoe repair establishment in the area. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Давлатов Ашурбег житель города Яван. 50 лет , женат и имеет восьмерых детей. Уже 30 лет занимается частным бизнесом в сфере услуг. Работает сапожником. Для того , чтобы привлечь новых клиентов и улучшить качество обслуживания Ашурбег хочет получить кредит и закупить новое оборудование. Это поможет увеличить доход и создать лучшие условия для своих детей. Кроме того его мастерская является единственной в кмшлаке в котором он живет. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi A. is 39 years old, married and the father of 4 children who are all in school. He is a merchant who sells cigarettes in Kpalime, a town located around 120 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. He sells his merchandise in bulk to other smaller merchants. With this loan, his second with FECECAV, Komi would like to expand his business by purchasing more cartons of cigarettes to resell to his customers. With his sales, Komi would like to support his family.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Komi A. est âgé de 39 ans, marié e père de 4 enfants tous à l’école. Il est vendeur de cigarettes à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il livre ses marchandises en gros aux détaillants. Avec ce crédit, le deuxième de FECECAV, Komi désire élargir la capacité de son commerce en achetant plus des cartons de cigarettes pour la redistribution à ses clients. Avec les produits de ses ventes, Komi subviendra mieux aux besoins de sa famille

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of cigarettes

loans.name: Nai

texts.en: Nai B. is an unmarried woman who lives in Sundhara, located in Lalitpur district. The majority of people in this locality are engaged in their own small businesses. Nai B. lives with her father, mother and two brothers. Her father is a tailor. Both of her brothers and herself are engaged in making brass religious statues. They make different types of brass religious statues. They make statues according to the demand of their customers. In this business they need a lot of investment to fulfill the demand of their customers so Ms. Nai B. is requesting for a Rs 15000.00 loan to buy raw materials for their work.

loans.use: Nai would like to buy raw materials for her work making brass religious statues.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Mrs. Anita M. lives in a single family home in Sundhara, Lalitpur. Mrs. M. has four members including herself in her family. Her husband is Mr. Shyam Mohan M. and he works in a hardware store. Her son works in a departmental store. Her daughter is studying for her BBS.

Mrs. M. is a shopkeeper in Sundhara. She sells different varieties of grocery items such as rice, maize, snacks, etc in her shop. All the members of her family help her in her shop. Now she is requesting for a Rs 15000.00 loan to expand her business by purchasing different varieties of grocery items in her shop. She wants to use her income to upgrade the living standard of her family.

loans.use: Anita would like to buy grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Urmila

texts.en:
Mrs. Urmila S. is a tailor in the village of Bhatkepati, located in Kathmandu district. The majority of people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. S. lives in a joint family home with her husband, mother-in-law and two daughters. Her husband Mr. Krishna S. is a farmer in Bhatkepati. Both of her daughters are studying in primary school.

S. is a tailor. Tailoring work is the traditional work for their family. She makes different verities of dresses for both ladies and gents. She especially prefers to make ladies' dresses. Now she is requesting for a Rs 10000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her work. She uses her earnings to provide better education for her daughters.

loans.use: Urmila would like to buy raw materials for her work as a tailor.

loans.name: Nisha

texts.en:
Mrs. Nisha P., 25 years old, is a tailor in the village of Bhatkepati in Kathmandu. Mrs. P. lives in a joint family home with her husband, father-in-law and brother-in-law. Six months ago, her husband Mr. Prem P. went to Dubai to earn money for the family. Her father-in-law and brother-in-law are farmers in the village of Bhatkepati.

Nisha's specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, Blouses, Ladies long dresses, Makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. P. took a 6 month training course in tailoring. Now she is requesting for a Rs 10000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: Nisha would like to buy raw materials for her work as a tailor and seamstress.

loans.name: Hemal Parsotamo

texts.pt:
Hemal is 26 years old, was born in the city of Maputo, Mozambique and is single with no children. He is the youngest of two brothers and he provides for his brother who is visually impaired. He lives with his mother and brother.
Hemal completed high school and also took a course in Computer Science. He says he didn't continue his education due to his family's financial situation and has run his deceased father's store since 2006.

In 2006 he moved to Bela-Vista with his mother at his brother's request to help run the store. Bela-vista is the chief town of the District of Matutuine, in the Province of Maputo. All three now live in a house behind the store. Despite it being owned by all of them, Hemal is the primary manager of the store and opens from 8.30am until 7pm every day with no employees. He learnt how to do business from a wholesaler in Maputo where he was working until his brother asked for his help. The emphasis in the store is on everyday necessities and the daily income is 1200,00 MZN, which Hemal is going to start saving. His biggest challenge in trying to expand the business is having a vehicle with which to transport the merchandise.

He heard of Hluvuku through other merchants in the area and this is his first loan, be it with Hluvuku or any other institution. Hemal is confident he can improve his business with this loan and grow it well, given that he will be able to respond to his clients' demands.

In the future, he aims to sell a greater range of products and eventually open a computer repair workshop as none exist in the area.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Hemal tem 26 anos e nasceu na cidade de Maputo, e é solteiro. Ele é o segundo entre dois irmãos, sustenta o irmão mais velho que tem problemas da vista e sua mãe ambos vivem na mesma casa e ele não tem filhos.

Hemal completou o ensino secundário (ate a 12a classe) também fez curso de informática, diz que não continuou por situação financeira da família e desde 2006 esta gerindo a loja do falecido pai. Em 2007 se mudou para Bela-vista junto com sua mãe a pedido do seu irmão para o ajudar na loja uma vez que o irmão tem problemas de vista, Bela-vista é uma vila sede do Distrito de Matutuine, Província de Maputo, onde Hemal vive com o irmão e sua mãe na casa aos fundos da loja do seu falecido pai.

Hemal é o principal gestor da loja embora sendo bem comum, tem um horário diário das 8:30h as 19:00h e não tem empregados. Aprendeu a fazer negocio numa loja grossista na cidade de Maputo onde se encontrava a trabalhar antes do irmão o solicitar para vir ajuda-lo a gerir a loja. Os produtos com destaque são da primeira necessidade, o rendimento diário é de 1200,00mt e diz que vai começar a poupar. Para ele o maior desafio para conseguir expandir o negocio é ter uma viatura para ajudar no transporte de mercadoria.

É primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca teve nenhum empréstimo em nenhuma instituição e conheceu Hluvuku através de outros comerciantes da zona. Hemal esta confiante que com este empréstimo o negocio vai melhorar e vai crescer dado que poderá responder bem a clientela.

Os objetivos com o negocio daqui em diante são vender produtos diversificados e futuramente abrir uma oficina de reparação de computadores uma vez que na zona não existe nenhuma.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (to increase stock)

loans.name: Sok-Eng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok-eng C. (shown in the picture with her mother), 26, and her husband were married in 2006 and do not yet have children. They live with her old mother and three brothers and sisters, all of whom are garment factory workers. The family lives along National Road Number Five, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sok-eng has been a garment factory worker for eight years, and husband is a garment factory worker as well. Her house is on lower ground than her neighboring ones. It becomes flooded when heavy rains come. So Sok-eng is requesting a loan of US$500 to fill up the ground around her house.

loans.use: Sok-eng would like to fill up the ground around her house.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi Tsige is 52 years old, married and the mother of one. She is a merchant of traditional style skirts in Kpalime, a town around 120 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. She has been practicing her profession for 5 years now. With this loan, she would like to purchase 10 large bags of traditional style skirts so that she can satisfy customer demand that is ever growing. The profits she earns will be used to support her child's education needs.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Afi T. est âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 1 enfant. Elle est revendeuse de pagne à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Kpalimé, la capitale togolaise. Elle exerce cette activité de puis plus de 5 ans. Avec ce crédit, elle souhaite acheter 10 balles de pagnes pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle dont la demande ne cesse d’accroître. Les bénéfices qu’elle dégagera de ses ventes lui permettront de mieux supporter les charges scolaires de son enfant.

loans.use: To purchase 10 large bags of traditional skirts.

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy K., 36, and her husband, Mr. Ka Hin, 45, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1988 and have six children, three sons and three daughters. Five of them are in local school and the youngest one stays at home.

Thavy has been a fruit seller for twenty-eight years. She buys many kinds of fruits from her village and other nearby villages and resells them in Phnom Penh. Mr. Hin used to work at a printing house for thirteen years but now he has stopped to create his own business with a taxi. He just bought one van for driving as a taxi but lacks some money for another.

Thavy is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase fruits to resell and to buy one van for her husband to drive as a taxi.

loans.use: Thavy would like to purchase fruit to resell and to buy a van for her husband drive taxi.

loans.name: José

texts.pt:
Jose is 24 years old and he is from Matutine, district of the Maputo province. Jose is the father of a 2-year-old son and he is married. Jose became a father while attending school. Unexpectedly, his girlfriend got pregnant and Jose had to drop out of school to take care of his family. He stopped going to school in the 10th grade and now he works for the Mozambique's rail system (CFM), earning 3.900,00mt per month. Jose lives in a house that was built precariously and he wants to build a new one using masonry . This is his second loan request from Hluvuku and his first through Kiva. The first loan was used to purchase cement to build blocks. This loan will be used to purchase, among other items, zinc sheets, iron for beams, sand and stones for the foundation. Jose plans on paying the loan back early because the amount will not be enough to pay the construction worker and the person responsible for bringing in the water for the construction. His dreams are to continue his education and also acquire furniture for the house -- a project he wishes to complete using other loans from Hluvuku. Jose mentioned that he would not be able to save money from his salary to buy furniture because it would take a long time and also because there are no institutions that are able to set up a savings account in his area.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

José tem 24 anos de idade e é natural de Matutuine, um distrito na Província de Maputo. Jose é pai de 1 filho de 2 anos, e é casado maritalmente. José teve filho ainda a estudar, sua namorada teve uma gravidez não planificada, situação que lhe obrigou ao casamento cedo e assim abandonou os estudos para cuidar da família. Deixou os estudos na 10ª classe e hoje é trabalhador dos caminhos de ferro de Moçambique (CFM), onde aufere um salário de 3.900,00mt mensalmente. José vive numa casa própria de construção precária, assim pretende construir uma casa de alvenaria. Para ele este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. O primeiro empréstimo foi para compra de cimento para fabrico de blocos. Este empréstimo pretende comprar chapas de zinco, ferro para vigas, areia, e pedras para fundações, entre outros. Jose pretende pagar muito cedo antes do prazo dado que não poderá começar com a construção porque o valor ainda não é suficiente para pagamento da mão de obra do pedreiro e de uma pessoa que vai acarretar a água. Constitui o sonho para futuro a continuação com os estudos e também mobiliar a casa, projeto que pretende contar com mais empréstimos da Hluvuku. Jose mencionou que não consegue poupar do próprio salário para comprar mobília porque demoraria muito tempo e também porque no distrito não há instituição que recebe poupança.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Maisom

texts.en:
Mrs. Maisom L., 42, and her husband, Mr. Hot Yeb, 48, who live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have six children, four sons and two daughters. Four of their children live with them and help them in fishing. Two children are married and are also in fishing.

Maisom and her husband have been fishing since 1979. They do fishing from Mekong River to resell at the market near the village. CurrentL. it is the low fishing season, and they need one kind of fishing net to use during this season. So, Maisom is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase that kind of fishing nets and one motor for her business.

loans.use: Maisom would like to purchase fishing nets and one boat motor.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea H., 56, and her husband, Mr. Sriv Leng, 59, who live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1970 and have nine children, four sons and five daughters. Six of their children live with them, three of whom are garment factory workers and the other three are in school. Three children are married and live outside the family home.

Chea and her husband have been raising pigs and growing vegetables since they were married. Besides the farming business, Mr. Leng has been a mason for over ten years. Now Chea is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: Chea and her husband would like to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ayawo

texts.fr:
Ayawo A. is 32 years old, married and the father of two. He is a motorcycle taxi driver in Kpalime, a town located around 120 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. With this loan, Ayawi would like to purchase a new motorcycle to improve his services and to earn more money which will allow him to better support his family.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Ayawo A. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est conducteur de taxi- moto à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit, monsieur Ayawo souhaite acheter une nouvelle moto pour améliorer son activité et de gagner plus d’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Sabado Samuel

texts.pt:
Sabado is 39 years old and she is from the province of Gaza. Sabado has 7 children with two different wives -- 5 of them are from the same mother and their ages range from 8 to 18 years old. His children from the second wife are 13 and 16 years old. Out of the 7 children, only the oldest one does not go to school anymore. Besides his children, Sabado also supports his mother who lives in Chokwe by sending her a monthly allowance. Sabado went to school until the 4th grade and he says he did not continue his education because he traveled during his vacation to another province and once he returned his spot in the school was not available any longer. In 1980, right after his father death, he moved away from the province of Gaza and relocated to Maputo to look for a better life. In 1981 he worked for Vetagro-Boane and between 1995 and 1997 he worked as a security guard when there were many lay-offs and he was also let go. In 1998 he tried following his friend's steps by opening up a chicken raising business but he had to abandon that activity due to a lethal epidemic that killed many of his hens. Sabado lives in his own home. Sabado learned the trade by watching his friends do it since 1998. He has a permanent location on Namaacha Avenue in the town of Mazanbanine and its normal hours of operation are from 7:00am to 9:00pm -- these hours can be longer if there is a great influx of business. He has been engaged in this field for 6 years and with help from two employees he has been able to sell beer for 25,00mt, juices for 10,00mt and semea for 120,00 per bag. Sabado's income varies between 300,00mt and 1000,00mt per month and, depending on the business volume, it could reach as much as 2500,00mt. It is a goal to Sabado to expand and keep his business growing. His plans for the near future are open up more establishments in the town where he lives and expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Sabado tem 39 anos de idade e é natural da província de gaza. Sabado é pai de 7 filhos com duas esposas sendo 5 filhos de uma mesma pessoa, com idades variando entre 18 e 8 anos de idade. Com a outra esposa Sabado tem dois filhos de 16 e 13 anos. Dos 7 filhos o mais velho já não vai a escola e os outros estudam. Para alem dos filhos Sabado sustenta a sua mãe que se encontra em Chokwe enviando valores monetários para ela. Sabado estudou ate 4ªclasse e diz que não continuou por ter perdido a vaga quando nas ferias do fim do ano viajou para outra província e quando voltou já não havia vaga. Em 1980 mudou-se da província de Gaza para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida, logo apos a morte do seu pai. Em 1981 trabalhou no Vetagro-Boane, em 1995 trabalhou como segurança até 1997, ano que demitiram trabalhadores e ele foi atingido. Em 1998 tentou seguir os amigos abrindo um negocio de criação de frangos que só veio deixar o mesmo em 2002 quando teve a quebra de morte dos pintos. Sabado vive na casa própria. Sabado aprendeu o negocio copiando aos amigos desde 1998. Tem um estabelecimento permanente sita na AV. Da Namaacha no bairro Mazanbanine. Exercendo atividades comerciais ha 6 anos, o estabelecimento funciona das 7:00h até 21:00h excluindo os dias de muito movimento. Sabado tem dois empregados e tem vendido mais cerveja por 25,00mt, refresco por 10,00mt e semea por 120,00mt o saco. Sabado tem um rendimento entre 300,00mt e 1000,00mt por mês dependendo do movimento, pode ate fazer 2500,00mt por mês. Assim constitui como desafio para Sabado expandir ou manter o seu negocio. Para Sabado é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva e nunca teve empréstimo em outras instituições. O primeiro foi de 15000,00mt com qual comprou mercadoria aumentando o seu stock. Assim com este empréstimo Sabado quer comprar novamente mercadoria para de novo aumentar o stock e assim espera melhorar o seu negocio. O plano com o negocio daqui em diante é abrir mais estabelecimento no bairro onde ele reside bairro 07 e futuramente ampliar os negócios.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase stock.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr:
Daniel A. is 29 years old, single and has no children. He is a motorcycle taxi driver in Kpalime, a town located around 120 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. He would like to purchase a new motorcycle with this loan, which will help him to improve his working conditions and services, as well as allow him to give his old motorcycle to his younger brother who has been out of work for a year. The profits from his business will help him to support his younger brothers who are still in school.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Daniel A. est âgé de 29 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il désire, par ce crédit, acheter une nouvelle moto qui lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de son activité et de passer l’ancienne moto à son petit frère en chômage depuis un an. Les gains de son activité lui permettront de supporter ses petits frères qui sont encore sur les bancs de l’école.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Lizabeth

texts.en: Lizabeth H. sells food stuffs. She is married, but her husband's income from driving a taxi is not sufficient for Lizabeth and their four children. Since demand for her goods is high, Lizabeth is requesting a loan of $475 to expand the business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa M. sells soda. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Theresa and their three children. Since demand for her goods is high, Theresa is requesting a loan of $400 to expand the business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla K. is 32 years old, singe and has no children. He is a merchant who sells second hand clothes in Kpalime, a town located around 120 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. He would like this loan to expand his commercial capacity and purchase 5 large bags of second hand clothes and graduate to larger deliveries to his business as until now he has only worked with smaller quantities of product. With the profits, Komla would like to help support his two younger brothers.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Komla K. est âgé de 32 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est revendeur de friperies à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce crédit élargir la capacité de son commerce en achetant 5 balles de friperies afin de procéder à des livraisons en gros, puisque, jusque là, il est un détaillant. Avec Les bénéfices de ses ventes, Komla arrivera à subvenir à ses propres besoins et de ceux de ses petits frères

loans.use: To purchase 5 large bags of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Sara Amelia

texts.pt:
Sara is 41 years and she was born in the province of Maputo. She has a 23-year-old son. She moved from the Namaacha district to Boane along with her husband because of a job transfer. She supports her son and a 15-year-old stepson. They are both in school. Sara completed middle school (7th grade) e did not continue her education because she got pregnant of her only son. She moved from the district of Namaacha to Boane because she got married. She met her husband while he was working in Namaacha. Nowadays, she lives in her own home in zone 7. She has been working as a permanent retailer selling products to children out of a commercial establishment in front of a school. The store is open form 7:30am to 5:30pm and she works by herself -- her son fills in when she is absent. She learned the skills to perform this activity from friends and she has 8 years of experience now. On top of selling to the children she also sells clothing -- specially pants for 300,00mt, skirts for 250,00mt, shirts for 150,0 and dresses for 350,00mt. It has been hard to keep the business functioning for she relies on public transportation to travel to South Africa where the products are bought. Sara states that the sale of clothing generates between 750,00 and 1000,00mt, depending on the season, and the children's product sales bring in between 50,00mt and 100,00mt daily. Sara has been able to even set aside some money at the end of the month. Her challenge at this time is to expand the business. This will be the first loan Sara requests and she has never requested loans from any other institution before. This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise (increase stock). Sara came to know about Hluvuku through a neighbor. With this loan she believes she will improve her business, although she understands that its growth will require extra dedication and sharper focus in her activity. Her plans include not only selling clothing but also selling beverages and sodas. In the future, she intends to request another loan to build a solid commercial establishment and also get married.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Sara tem 41 anos e nasceu na província do Maputo. Mãe de 1 filho com 23 anos de idade, se mudou do distrito de Namaacha para Boane acompanhando o seu marido transferido pelos serviços. Sustenta um filho mais um enteado de 15 anos, que não vão para a escola. Sara completou o ensino primário (ate a 7a classe) e não continuou por ter ficada gravida do seu único filho. Mudou-se do distrito de Namaacha para Boane devido ao seu casamento, porque encontrou-se com o marido quando ele trabalhava em Namaacha. Hoje vive numa casa própria no bairro 7. Comerciante permanente desde 2000, Sara tem um estabelecimento comercial em frente da escola onde vende produtos diversos para criançada. Funciona das 7:30 até 17:30, trabalha pessoalmente só quando esta ausente o filho é que toma conta. Aprendeu a atividade comercial com as amigas e tem 8 anos de experiência. Para além da venda de produtos para alunos também vende roupa diversa , onde destaca calças que vende por 300,00mt, saia por 250,00mt, blusas 150,00mt, vestidos por 350,00MT. Tem sido difícil exercer o negocio devido ao transporte, dado que ela compra na África do Sul e vai de transporte publico de passageiro. Sara diz que com a venda de roupa tem rendimentos que variam entre 750,00 a 1000,00mt, dependendo dos momentos críticos, e pelos produtos da criançada tem rendimentos diários que variam entre 50,00mt e 100,00MT. Sara consegue poupar algum valor nos finais do mês. O desafio que tem Sara é ampliar o seu negocio. Para Sara este é o primeiro empréstimo e nunca teve em nenhuma instituição antes. Este empréstimo destina-se para compra dos produtos (aumentar stock). Sara conheceu Hluvuku através do seu vizinho. Com este empréstimo acha que vai melhorar o seu negocio mesmo reconhecendo que o crescimento exigira mais dedicação e seriedade na sua atividade. Tem como plano para além de vender roupa vender bebidas e refrigerantes e futuramente pretende pedir mais empréstimo para construir um estabelecimento fixo e casar-se.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise to increase stock.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness T. sells cooked rice. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Agness and her child. Since demand for her rice is high, she is requesting a loan of $300 to expand the business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina B. sells smoked fish. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for her and their child. Since demand for her fish is high, Ernestina is requesting a loan of $300 to expand the business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Angelina Fulau

texts.pt:
Angelina is 39 years old and she was born in Vilanculos, province of Inhambane. Angelina is single and she supports a 27-year- old sister who is taking 6th grade classes in the evenings. Angelina completed high school with a professional training and, in 1991, she moved from the province of Inhambane with her older brother before she got married. She continued her education in the district of Boane. Currently, she lives in her own home in zone 7 of the village os Boane. Angelina is a permanent employee of the Joaquim Chissano High School. She works as the principal's secretary since 2003 and her shift is from 7:30am to 3:30pm. She learned the secretary skills at the School of Management and Conduct. This will be the first loan request in her life. Through conversations with friends, she became aware of Hluvuku's existence and decided to contact them to apply for the loan. She wishes to purchase construction material to start building a new room for her house. Angelina plans on requesting another loan in the future to increase her saving and purchase a vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Angelina tem 39 anos e nasceu em Vilanculos província de Inhambane. Angelina é solteira e sustenta uma irmã de 27 anos de idade que freqüenta o ensino primário na 6ªclasse período noturno. Angelina completou o nível médio profissional, e em 1991 mudou-se da província de inhambane na companhia do seu irmão mais velho, antes de casar. Continuou com os estudos no distrito de Boane, neste momento vive numa casa própria no bairro 7 da vila de Boane. Angelina é funcionaria permanente da escola secundaria Joaquim Chissano, trabalhando como secretaria da Diretora da Escola desde 2003 e trabalha das 7:30h às 15:30h. Aprendeu o secretariado na escola de administração e gestão. Para ela este é o primeiro empréstimo na vida e foi através da conversa com os colegas que tomou conhecimento da existência do Hluvuku e dai contactou e solicitou o seu primeiro empréstimo no qual pretende comprar material de construção para construir uma dependência numa fase inicial da obra. Angelina futuramente pretende solicitar um empréstimo para aumentar o valor que tem guardado para comprar uma viatura.

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Adzo A. is 27 years old, married and the mother of one. She has been a hair dresser for 3 years in Kpalime, a town located around 120 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. With this second with FECECAV, Adzo would like to satisfy customer demand and purchase a blow dryer and hair extensions to improve her hair dressing services. This will help her to increase her customer base and to make larger profits to better meet the needs of her child.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Adzo A. est âgée de 27 ans, mariée et mère de 1 enfant. Elle est coiffeuse depuis 3 ans à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, Adzo désire satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle en achetant un séchoir et des mèches pour revendre aux clients . Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, de gagner plus de profits et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de son enfant.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer and hair extensions.

loans.name: Luis Jeremias

texts.pt:
Luis is 36 years old and he was born in the province of Maputo, in the district of Boane. Luis is single and father of 4 children with ages ranging between 4 and 15 years old. They are all in school. Besides his children he also supports his mother and father -- both live with him. Luis went to school until the 5th grade and he says he did not continue due to financial hardship his family encountered and the civil war in Mozambique. The war caused the family to flee to the neighboring country Swaziland. Today Luis lives in his own home located at the 14th kilometer in Boane. Luis is a construction worker and a retailer since 2003 and, gradually, he has been taking over the family's business. He learned how to be a construction worker in Swaziland, and he learned how to be a retailer with friends by selling cookies and sheets around town. He has been doing this for 5 years. The best selling products are sugar, sold for 23,00 MT per kilo, and peanuts for 35,00 MT per kilo. Running his business is difficult because he gets the products in the city of Maputo once a week by public transportation. He generates 300,00 Mt daily and 2.100,00 Mt weekly which amounts to approximately 9.000,00 monthly. Luis has not been able to save any money because he invests largely into the business. The challenge to increase business volume and maintain it moving along is to have enough merchandise and good customer service. This is Luis' second loan. The first one was in the amount of 15000,00 Mt and it was used to purchase basic need products which triggered business expansion. Luis has never requested loans from any other institution. He found out about Hluvuku through friends and made contact with it to request his first loan. This second loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise to beef up stock and, therefore, improve business performance. Luis' plans include fostering business growth and, in the future, he intends to request another loan to further expand this venture.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Luis tem 36 anos de idade e nasceu na província de Maputo no distrito de Boane. Luis é solteiro e pai de 4 filhos com idade variando entre 15 anos o mais velho e 4 anos o mais novo. Todos vão a escola. Para alem dos seus filhos sustenta a sua mãe e seu pai que vivem com eles na mesma casa. Luis estudou apenas até 5ªClasse e diz que não continuou por difícil situação financeira da família e devido a guerra civil de Moçambique, que fez a família abandonar a zona para o pais vizinho Swazilandia. Hoje Luis vive na casa própria no Km 14 em Boane. Luis é pedreiro e comerciante permanente desde 2003 e vem assumindo na integra a questão de negocio da família. Aprendeu na Swazilandia a ser pedreiro, e com os amigos a ser comerciante, vendendo biscoitos e mantas na zona. Fazem 5 anos que se dedica ao negocio. Os produtos com destaque é açúcar que vende o kg por 23,00mt e amendoim por 35,00mt o kg. A sua atividade é um pouco difícil por que os produtos adquire na cidade de Maputo e vai dos transporte públicos uma vez por semana. Tem rendimentos diários entre 300,00mt e 2.100,00mt semanais e aproximadamente 9.000,00mt mensal. Luis não consegue poupar algo por que a tendência é investir mais no negocio. O desafio para aumentar ou manter o seu negocio será ter sempre mercadoria e um bom atendimento aos clientes. Este é o segundo empréstimo para Luis onde o primeiro foi de 15000,00mt que usou para compra de produtos da primeira necessidade ampliando assim o seu negocio. Luis nunca levantou empréstimo noutras instituições. Conheceu a Hluvuku através dos amigos e assim contactou e solicitou o seu primeiro empréstimo. Este segundo empréstimo Luis usara para compra de mercadoria para aumentar o stock para melhorar assim o seu negocio. Luis tem como planos fazer crescer mais o seu negocio e futuramente pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para ampliar o seu negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand business.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness O. sells a local dish called boforot (similar to doughnuts) and bread. She is married, but her husband's income from carpentry is not sufficient for her and their nine children. Since demand for her goods is high, Agness is requesting a loan of $300 to expand the business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income from carpentry is not sufficient for her and her child. Since demand for her goods is high,  she is seeking a loan of $400 to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo Veronique A. is 41 years old, married and has no children. She is a merchant and has been selling cereals for more than 10 years in Kpalime, a town located around 120 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. She would like to purchase 20 bags of corn, 15 bags of meal and 15 bags of beans with this loan in order to satisfy an ever increasing demand from customers. This opportunity will help her to earn more money and to better fund the needs of her family, especially her two young brothers who are still in school.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Adjo V. A. est âgée de 41 ans, mariée sans enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales depuis plus de 10 ans à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Kpalimé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire avec ce crédit améliorer la capacité de son activité en achetant 20 sacs de maïs, 15 sacs de mil, 15 sacs de haricots afin de satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle. Cette opportunité lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent et de subvenir aux besoins de ses deus petits frères encore sur les bancs de l’école.

loans.use: To purchase 20 bags of corn, 15 bags of meal, and 15 bags of beans.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 56-year-old Florence N..  She is married, and has four children aged between 22 and 28. She has two dependents, who live with her because they are orphans.  In 1997, Florence, assisted by her sister, established her poultry business.  Raising kuku (chickens) is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Florence has already received and successfully repaid four loans from SELFINA, and now requests a loan to purchase additional chicks and feed. In the future, Florence plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia B. sells fish and although she is married, her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for her and her two children. Since demand for her goods is high, Lydia is requesting a loan of $400 to expand her business in order to increase profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel T. sells furniture that he makes, but although he is single, his income is not sufficient for his expenses. Since demand for his goods is high, he is seeking a loan of $300 to expand the business in order to increase  profits.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Asha S. is 35 years old, is married, and has three children between the ages 12 and 19. In 2007, Asha started her grocery business.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof. At a genge, customers can purchase general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili peppers, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

Asha has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA. She now requests a loan in order to purchase more fruit, vegetables, flour, and rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits, vegetables, flour, and rice in bulk to stock her genge

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Rehema K. is 40 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of 11 and 24. In 1997, Rehema established her fish business.

SELFINA is a pioneer in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microlending. SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Thus, women are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions, because they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, and thus poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment. This process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

Rehema has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase more fish in bulk to stock her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more fish in bulk to increase inventory

loans.name: Ismat

texts.ru:
Ismat S. has successfully paid off his first loan. He used the received profits to noticeably improve his business. There has been many changes in his personal life, particularly that he has repaired his house. At this time he wants to get another loan to continue expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сидиков Исмат успешно закончил свой первый займ полученный. На полученную прибыль он заметно улучшил условия своего бизнеса, много перемен в его семейных условиях, в частности он отремонтировал свой дом. Сейчас он собирается получить новый займ для дальнейшего расширения своей деятельности.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: La Union En Progreso Group

texts.en:
Marta (pictured in the center) lives in the community of Molquecho in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She has five children, ages 18, 17, 15, 13, and 12. Marta owns and manages her own business making and selling jewellery as well as clothing and undergarments. Her business has continued to grow since she has had greater access to capital through the loans that Esperanza Internacional has given her. She has paid off two loans already and would like to purchase more clothing and undergarments to sell in her store with this next loan. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Marta herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To buy clothing and undergarments for her store.

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Magreth Lwambano is 38 years old, is married, and has four children between the ages of 3 and 12. She has two dependents, who live with her because they are orphans. In 2007, Magreth began her poultry business. She operates her business 7 days a week and 16 hours a day. Her husband assists her in the business.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two kuku, and add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing, they produce eggs that can be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide another source of protein. There are probably hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier or prettier than other animals), but this is all time and space will allow.

Magreth has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional chicks and feed. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately US $435. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed

loans.name: Bernadetha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Bernadetha Lagita is 33 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 6 and 13. She has two dependents, who live with her because they are attending school in the area. In 2007, Bernadetha started her poultry business.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and add more as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing, they produce eggs. You can sell the eggs to provide a supplementary source of income, or eat them to provide a supplementary source of protein. There are probably many other reasons for raising kuku, but this is all time and space will allow.

Bernadetha requests a loan to purchase additional chicks and feed so she can increase her income. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah B. sells sugar, oil, filtered water, and clothes that she sews herself. She is married, but her husband's income from carpentry is not sufficient for her and her three children.  Demand for her goods is high, and she wishes to expand the business to increase profits.
Hannah is requesting a loan of $350 to accomplish this.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia C.  is married, but her husband's income as an electrician is not sufficient for her and her three children, so she sells groceries.  Demand for her goods is high, and she is now looking to expand her business to increase her profits.  Emelia is requesting a loan of $400 for this purpose.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina M. sells groceries. She is married, but her husband's income from his job as a mason is not sufficient for Augustina and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.use: To expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A. sells second-hand clothing. She is married, but her husband's income from his job at the Elmina Courthouse is not sufficient for Joyce and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Sammuel

texts.en: Sammuel O. lives in Elmina, where he works as a television and radio repairman. Demand for his services is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits. He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: One Way Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is 38 years old and married with three children. With her first loan, Fatmata increased her stock of rice and beans. She was able to diversify her business, realize a profit, and meet some family expenses. Fatmat's husband works as a local building contractor and business is sporadic. This leaves Fatmata's business as the main source of income for the family.

The group would like to continue expanding their businesses and is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,100,000.

loans.use: Purchase more rice, vegetables, beans and peanuts to increase their inventory and income

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca T. sells groceries. She is married, but her husband's income from driving a taxi is not sufficient for Rebecca and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. sells fabric and mobile phone airtime transfers. She is single, and her income is not sufficient for Veronica and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Tainutsu Group

texts.en:
The Tainutsu group is composed of three members and Isatu C. is the group leader. All the three members sell African print materials in the market of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Isatu is 38 years old and married with 6 children. With the profit from the business she is able to provide for her children's education.

The members would like to expand their business to earn more income for their families. A loan of Le.2,400,000 will enable them meet their dreams.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of African print cotton materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Mary and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34 year-old Jesca Buloba is 34 years old, married, and has no children. In 2004, Jesca started selling sacks wholesale. The sacks are used to carry products such as maize, rice, and beans.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. By lending to women, SELFINA contributes to the economic empowerment and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. The women are considered not credit worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, and poor access to basic needs and services for these women with low incomes.

Jesca has already received and successfully repaid three loans from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional sacks to add to her inventory. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks, which are used to carry maize, rice, and beans, to sell

loans.name: Tatimalap Group

texts.en:
Fatu is an honest Kiva client and the Tatinalap group leader. She completed repayment of her previous loan and is very grateful to Kiva for expanding her business. With her previous loan, she was able to purchase a truck of firewood and that increased her income. Because of the business expansion, her husband is able to assist in selling and splitting the wood; thus keeping him busy.

Marie S. owns a small, local restaurant. Pusshe Kabbia sells cotton materials in the Makeni market. The group members are requesting for a loan of Le.3000000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stock of fire wood, clothes and food ingredients

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is sweet and a mother who worries about her family and works in agriculture, specifically in lima beans and peas, which she plants in her field since they are crops that do not take more than three months to cultivate. Martha either way is always looking after her children and helps them in whatever way she can in order to do their best in school. Doing double duty in her home is hard and tiring but she has to help her partner with the expenses, and so she is used to this rhythm. She hopes to increase production and help the members of her family reach their dreams. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve production.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

MARTHA, es una tierna y preocupada madre de familia que se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente a la producción de habas y arvejas que siembra en sus terrenos porque son productos que no pasan de tres meses de producción.Martha de igual manera siempre está pendiente de sus hijos y en lo que puede les ayuda tratando siempre de que se desempeñen adecuadamente en su centro de estudio.Desempeñar doble role en su hogar es muy pesado y cansado pero ella trata de apoyar a su pareja en los gastos y por ello que ya se habituó a este ritmo de trabajo, desea aumentar su producción y ayudar a los miembros de su hogar a alcanzar cada uno de sus anhelos.Y solicita un préstamo para la compra de semillas y abonos para mejorar su desempeño.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
HILDA is a mother with 2 children who are her “motor of life”, who motivate her to work and increase her desire to progress as a farmer so as to improve the quality of life in her home. And here we find her in her fields of corn that are ready to harvest now that the growing season is over. Because of her wish to start planting peas she is asking for a loan, mainly for the purchase of pea seeds, since she has observed a great demand for this vegetable in her city market.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

HILDA, es madre de 2 hijos quienes son su motor de vida que la impulsa a trabajar y a incrementar sus deseos de progresar como agricultora a fin de mejorar la calidad de vida dentro de su hogar.Y la encontramos en sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz que está a punto de cosechar ya que se termina la temporada del cultivo y frente a su deseo de iniciar el sembrío de arveja, está solicitando un préstamo básicamente para la compra de semillas de arveja ya que ha observado la gran demanda de este vegetal en el mercado de su ciudad.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, manure and natural fertilizers

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Mariama Seray M. is the God Is Great group leader. She is 35 years old and has been running her business for two years. Before the loan from SMT, Mariama's business was very small. Her business has expanded and she is now renting a stall in the market. With 5 children, Mariama, like any other family woman in Sierra Loene, works hard to provide for her family’s basic needs. She specializes in selling children’s clothing and is requesting a loan for the expansion of the business.

Sento and S. also sell clothes. Jelious sells plastic sandals.

loans.use: Purchase children's clothes and plastic sandals to increase stock and income

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa A. Twumasi is a 28-year-old business woman. She is married with three children who are currently in school. Yaa trades in cosmetics with items like earrings, lip gloss, beads, perfumes and powders etc. She sells by mobile hawking because she does not have a shop yet. Yaa believes that with the loan she can buy good quality standard goods to meet the tastes and preferences of her customers and to make a better income. This, she believes, will provide her with the increased income she needs to help build her own small container shop and ease the drudgery of hawking. Yaa is a member of the community group called Holy Trinity Trust Group. In this group, members vouch for one another, as social collateral, to access loans and to apply peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of earrings, lip gloss, beads, perfumes and powders etc

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi K. is 30 years old, married and has no children. He is a motorcycle taxi driver and has worked for 5 years in Kpalime, a town located about 120 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. To earn more money and to improve his standard of living, Kossi would like to use this loan, his second with FECECAV, to purchase a new motorcycle.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Kossi K. est âgé de 30 ans, marié sans enfants. Il est conducteur de taxi moto depuis plus de 5 ans à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Pour gagner plus d’argent et améliorer ses conditions de vie, Kossi désire utiliser ce crédit, le deuxième à FECECAV, pour acheter une nouvelle moto.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Married with five children, Beatrice B. is a 36-year-old trader. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty, and for that matter, she is very serious with her business. Beatrice has been a retailer of eggs and maize for the past ten years and has since been very resourceful in aiding her family. She wants to use the loan to buy larger supplies of maize and eggs to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of the current food crisis and increasing prices. She is a member of the trust group called Holy Trinity. In this group, members guarantee one another's reliability, serving as social collateral, to access and repay loans.

loans.use: To buy larger supplies of maize and eggs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
MRS. GLORIA, ever since being a little girl, has been involved with agricultural work and now that she is a mother she carries out her work for the benefit of her beloved family. Her production has increased notably and along with this is the requirement for natural manures and fertilizers in order to obtain products of excellent quality. Due to the increase in the costs of these products she is asking for a loan in order to acquire them and obtain an excellent harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

DOÑA GLORIA, desde pequeña se ha relacionado con la labor agrícola y ahora que se ha convertido en madre se desempeña en beneficio de su amada familia, su producción se ha incrementado notablemente y con ella la exigencia de abonos y fertilizantes naturales para obtener productos de excelente calidad, debido al incremento del costo de los mismos solicita un préstamo para adquirirlos a fin de obtener una excelente cosecha.

loans.use: Purchase of manures and fertilizers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther B. is a 35-year-old divorced wife with a daughter who is currently in school. She assumed full responsibility of financing her daughter’s education when she was divorced by her husband. Esther has owned and operated a seamstress shop for the past seven years. She sews all forms of female wear in various styles that suit the tastes of her customers, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes etc. Esther wants to use the loan to buy additional supplies to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to raise a good income to provide her daughter with a quality education. Esther is a member of the community group called Holy Trinity Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another to access loans.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Operating a grocery shop for the past eight years, Ama Y. is a 38-year-old mother of five children. She sells many grocery items such as evaporated milk, soaps, rice, sugar, biscuits, canned foods and drinks, etc. Her focus is to expand the shop and she wants to use the loan to increase her stock of these items, which are commonly demanded by her neighbors. Ama enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard for the betterment of her children’s futures. She belongs to the community group called Holy Trinity. In this group, members guarantee each other's reliability to access loans and they provide peer pressure to encourage loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of rice, sugar, soaps, canned goods, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
DON MANUEL, being a farmer, goes out in the mornings to treat and fumigate his fields so that he can combat the diverse diseases that may harm his crops. And this is how we find him, on his way to his fields with all the necessary tools for his work and he tells us that due to the high prices of fertilizers and treatments, his living has been affected and above all his products. Faced with this situation Don Manual is asking for a loan with the goal to improve the care of his crops and continue his work.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

DON MANUEL, por su actividad agrícola sale por las mañanas a curar y fumigar sus terrenos de cultivo para que pueda así combatir las diversas plagas o enfermedades que puedan perjudicar sus productos agrícolas. Y así lo encontramos rumbo a su chacra con todas sus herramientas necesarias para su trabajo y nos comentó que debido a los costos altos de los abonos y medicinas ha perjudicado su economía y sobre todo sus productos.Frente a esta situación Don Manuel solicita un préstamo a fin de mejorar el cuidado sus cultivos y continuar con su labor.

loans.use: Purchase of manure and natural fertilizers

loans.name: Akuwa

texts.fr:
Akuwa A. is 42 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She has been a seamstress for 7 years in Kpalime, a town located about 120 kilometers from the city of Lome, the capital of Togo. Akuwa would love to purchase a sewing machine with this loan, along with traditional skirts and fabrics in order to satisfy customer demand. Through her work, Akuwa would like to improve her standard of living and the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Akuwa A. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle exerce l’activité de couture depuis 7 ans à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de la ville de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Akuwa aimerait acheter avec ce crédit une machine à coudre, des pagnes et de tissus pour mieux satisfaire la demande de la clientèle. Par conséquent, la demande Akuwa aura à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famill

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, traditional skirts and fabrics.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret Z. is a 50-year-old widow and mother of six children. Margaret lost her husband through a car accident, which according to her was a great loss indeed. She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her operation is on a limited scale because she lacks capital to buy machines for the processing. She wants to take advantage of the loan to buy more raw material (palm kernels) and processing equipment to increase her efficiency and produce larger quantities. She believes this will help to expand her business and increase her income to provide for her family and finance her children’s educations. She belongs to the community group called “So mu yie” (Handle with care) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other, serving as social collateral to access loans and to apply peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw material (palm kernels) and processing equipment.

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Mariatu K. is the Believe In God group leader. She has been with SMT for three years and is one its honest and hard working clients. Mariatu is 30 years old and married with 4 children. Her children's upkeep depends mainly on her business income. Mariatu's husband is a teacher whose salary is insufficient to meet all the family needs. Mariatu's business supplements the family income.

Adamsay and Wulamatu also sell clothes. Alhaji H T. sells cooking utensils. The goup is requesting a loan of Le.4000000 to increase their inventory stock.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of clothes and cooking utensils

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena J. is 48 years old. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her operation is on a limited scale because of limited capital to buy machines for the processing. Abena wants to use the loan to buy more palm kernels and a small milling machine; this would increase her efficiency and production. She believes this will help to expand her business to raise more income, providing food for her family and more education for her children. Abena belongs to the community group called “So mu yie” (Handle with care) Trust Group. In this group, members vouch for each other as social collateral to access loans and to support and encourage loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy more palm kernels and a small milling machine.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
NILDA is a humble woman who loves to raise her little lambs because she knows that by doing this she can provide the necessities for her home and grow economically as a framer. But without a doubt Nilda like everyone would like to increase her income through the efforts of her daily activities and her wish is to buy a pair of sheep, possibly purebred, and in this way improve the lineage of her animals and increase their sale price. In order to buy the pair of sheep she is asking for a loan and she hopes to receive a positive answer soon.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

NILDA, es una humilde mujer que ama criar a sus corderitos porque sabe que con esta actividad puede atender las necesidades de su hogar y crecer económicamente como ganadera.Pero sin duda Nilda como toda persona desea acrecentar sus ingresos con esfuerzo a través de su desempeño diario y su anhelo es comprar un par de ovejitas que puedan ser de raza y así mejorar la descendencia de sus animales y aumentar su valor de venta.Para comprar el par de ovejitas solicita un préstamo y espera recibir pronto una respuesta satisfactoria.

loans.use: To buy two sheep

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice M. is 52 years old, divorced, and the mother of four children who are currently in school. She is a petty trader who sells items like rice, tin tomatoes, sugar, beans, canned foods, evaporated milk, soaps etc. on a table in her neighborhood. She is a very resourceful woman and by dint of hard work, she has managed to support two children to finish teacher training college. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of rice, sugar, beans, evaporated milk, soap and to also include the sale of charcoal. Beatrice believes this will help raise enough income to finance her children's educations. She is a member of the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other, serving as social collateral to access loans and to apply some peer pressure to encourage loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy additional rice, sugar, beans, evaporated milk, soaps and also charcoal.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. is 42 years old. She is married and has two twin boys and two girls. At the moment, the two twin boys have completed junior high school and are ready to enter senior high school. Margaret, a food vendor, sells cooked rice with palm nut soup. She also sells groundnuts, tomatoes, peppers and beans in the community market. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, beans, peppers and groundnuts to increase her stock. Margaret believes the loan will increase her working capital and offer her the opportunity to increase production and help finance her children’s educations. She belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group. In this group, members are social collateral for one another to help access loans and to encourage loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, beans, beans, peppers and groundnuts.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía is a humble woman who works on the farm daily to make a living for her beloved family. She has devoted herself to this cause for awhile and gradually has improved her products and processes. Now that she has gained enough experience, she wishes to increase her orders and improve the quality and quantity of her products. For this reason , she has decided to apply for a loan to launch her project.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

LUCIA, es una humilde mujer que labra la tierra a diario y obtiene de ella el sustento para su amada familia. Se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo y poco a poco ha ido mejorando sus productos y procesos. Ahora que ha obtenido experiencia suficiente desea incrementar sus pedidos y mejorar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos. Por esa razón ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para poner en marcha su proyecto.

loans.use: Capital to launch her farming project

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua A. is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. She is a petty trader who sells items like rice, tin tomatoes, onions, cooking oil, pepper, canned foods, evaporated milk, soaps, etc. on a table in her neighborhood. She is very grateful for her previous loan, which provided her with working capital. At the moment, two of the children have completed senior high school and are ready to enter university this year. Akua is determined to work harder to give her husband the needed financial assistance to support the children in school. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of rice, sugar, beans, evaporated milk, soaps and also to include the sale of charcoal. Akua believes this will help raise enough income to finance her children's education. She is a member of the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group and she was photographed at her group meeting. In this group, members serve as social collateral to access loans and to apply a little peer pressure as encouragement and support to repay the loans.
