loans.use: To buy additional rice, sugar, beans, evaporated milk, soap and charcoal.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta is a very happy farmer who is committed to her work as she is to her role as a mother. This is why she has always tried to work hard in the countryside, leaving very early in the morning, despite the intense cold. Throughout these activities, she has never stopped caring for her husband and her children, who love and help her with her work on the farmland. Although her children are small, they try where possible to offer friendly company to their mother.

Violeta, motivated by her love for them, wishes to increase her agricultural production and sell in nearby cities at affordable and profitable prices, to overcome her family’s poverty. She wishes to obtain a loan to optimize her work and increase profits for the benefit of his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

VIOLETA, es una agricultora muy alegre y comprometida con su trabajo de manera similar con su rol como madre, es por ello que siempre ha tratado de trabajar lo más duro en el campo, saliendo muy de mañana a pesar del intenso frío.Dentro de estas actividades nunca ha dejado de atender a su esposo y a sus hijos quienes la aman y la ayudan con su labor en sus terrenos y aunque sus hijos son pequeños tratan en lo posible de brindarle una compañía agradable a su madre.

Violeta por amor a ello desea incrementar su producción agrícola y trasladarlos en las ciudades más cercanas y venderlas a precios módicos y rentables, de la misma forma poder sacar de la pobreza a su familia. Desea obtener un préstamo para optimizar su labor e incrementar sus ganancias en beneficio de su amada familia.

loans.use: Capital to optimize her agricultural work

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu S. is 26 years old. She is a single mother of one child. Salamatu is a food vendor and sells “waakye”, a dish of cooked rice and beans enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. Almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy this tasty and satisfying dish. She also sells groundnuts, beans and yams in the community market as a subsidiary trade to beef up her income. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans, macaroni, and yams to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group. Group members guarantee each other's reliability, serving as social collateral to help access loans and to strongly encourage loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans, macaroni, and yams.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is a lovely elderly woman who spends that her days caring for her family and animals. In addition, she works in the countrysiD. to raise cattle and sheep, by which she obtains considerable sums of money to improve the quality of life for the members of her household. She wishes to further improve her occupation and, for this reason, she asks for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

TERESA, es una adorable ancianita que se dedica el día entero a cuidar D. su familia y D. sus animalitos, además D. desempeñarse en las labores del campo se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno y ovino y D. estos obtiene sumas considerables D. dinero con los que ha podido mejorar la calidad D. vida D. los miembros D. su hogar, desea mejorar aún más su ocupación y a esa razón atienD. su solicitud.

loans.use: Buying a greater number of animals

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo is a man who grows potatoes and peas. He leaves his home each morning with the desire to observe the growth of his vegetables and to give them the necessary care so that they can thrive. Through his occupation, he supports his beloved family and his desire to work for the fulfillment of improving the quality and quantity of his production, in order to obtain better earnings and make the dreams of his children a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

REYNALDO, es un hombre dedicado a la producción de papa y arveja, cada mañana abandona su hogar con el deseo de observar el crecimiento de sus vegetales y de otorgarles el cuidado necesario para que puedan crecer muy bien, con su ocupación sostiene a su amada familia y su deseo de colaborar con el cumplimiento de lo que anhelan desea mejorar la calidad y cantidad de su producción para obtener mejores ganancias y hacer el sueño de sus hijos realidad.

loans.use: Capital to improve the quality and quantity of his vegetables

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama A. is 55 years old. She is married and has five children. At the moment, three children have completed senior high school. Mariama manufactures palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale because she does not have the capital she needs to buy machines for the processing. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm kernels and a small milling machine to increase her efficiency and her quantity. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to help her husband provide food for their family and to finance the children’s educations. Mariama belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group. In this group, members vouch for one another to help access loans and to provide strong support and encouragement to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more palm kernels and a small milling machine.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 31 years old. She is married and has two children. For the past eight years, she has owned and operated a beauty salon. Elizabeth is a very skillful and talented hair dresser who adds beauty and value to the hair of her many customers and that is her secret. She believes in efficient and effective service; therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomades, shampoos, activators and other products to avoid shortages and poor service. She is a member of the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group. In this group, members vouch for one another as social collateral to access loans and to provide peer pressure, as support and encouragement, to repay loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products such as weavons, pomades, shampoos, activators etc.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria is a humble mother who, with much effort, works on her potato farm to later sell its agricultural products in the markets of the closest towns or to traders from the same area. Her responsibilities as a mother have encouraged her to pursue farming activities to continue growing the best vegetables in the area. However, she wants to increase her investment in agriculture and expand her farmland to improve the living standards of her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

GREGORIA, es una humilde madre de familia que con mucho esfuerzo hace trabajar sus terrenos de cultivo de papa para luego vender sus productos agrícolas en los mercados de las ciudades más cercanas o a los comerciantes desde su misma zona.El tener muchas responsabilidades como madre de familia le ha incentivado a seguir adelante en su actividad como agricultora para seguir produciendo los mejores vegetales de la zona.Pero ella quiere aumentar su inversión en la agricultura y ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo para mejorar el nivel de vida de su amada familia.

loans.use: Increased capital to improve the farming of vegetables

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha M. is 53 years old, is married and has seven children. She has her children's needs and welfare at heart. Currently, two children have completed apprenticeships; two have also completed senior high school and the rest are in primary school. Martha trades in used clothes. Used clothes are worn by many people daily, and because of that Mary has many customers. However, with little capital, she can barely make a profit. She wants the loan, therefore, to buy more bales of a variety of used clothes to meet the demands of her customers and to increase her family's income. Martha is a member of the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group. In this group, members serve as social collateral for one another to access loans and to encourage and support loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Fuente De Esperanza (Source Of Hope) Group 3

texts.en:
Samena, the group leader, has two children, ages 5 and 1 and a half. She has a small business selling clothes out in the country where people don´t have easy access to many products. She buys the clothes near her home and her husband, who works in the country, takes them with him to sell for a profit. Samena would use this loan from Esperanza International to buy even more clothes to sell, which will help her better provide for her family.

Samena currently lives with her family in a small hut constructed from scraps of tin and wood. She is originally from Haiti, where conditions are even worse. She hopes that she will be able to provide a good education for her children through the money she makes from her business.

Note: This is a group loan to 5 people.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to re-sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena Nkansah is 40 years old. She is a wife and the mother of seven children who are currently in school. For the last eight years, she has been manufacturing palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale and therefore her working capital is low. Abena wants to use the loan to buy more palm kernels and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency. She believes this will help expand her business to support her husband and children, especially for food and education. She belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group and was photographed at one of the meetings. Group members guarantee each other's reliability, both to access loans and to encourage and support their peers to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more palm kernels and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima M. is 48 years old and is married with five children. She has manufactured palm kernel oil locally for twenty years. Palm kernels are processed through various stages to obtain the oil which is used to prepare many local dishes. Alima is a supplier to food vendors. However, her production is on the low side because of a limited working capital. Greater capital would allow her to buy a machine for processing. She wants to use the loan to buy 50 bags of palm kernels and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency. Alima believes this will help increase her income to help her husband to support their family, including financing the children's educations. She belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group and she was photographed at a group meeting. In this group, members vouch for one another as social collateral, both to access loans and to provide peer pressure and support to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy 50 bags of palm kernels and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati A. is 49 years old. She is married and has seven children who are currently in school. Fati has been a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil for 11 years. Palm kernels are processed through various stages to obtain the oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. She supplies her oil to food vendors. However, her production is on a small scale because of her low working capital. The loan would allow Fati to buy more palm kernels and an electric milling machine; the machine would increase her efficiency in producing larger quantities. Fati believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to help her husband provide food for her family and to finance her children’s educations. She belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group and she was photographed at a group meeting. In this group, members serve as social collateral for one another, both to access loans and as peer pressure to repay loans.

loans.use: To buy more palm kernels and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Assitan Diakité is 40 years old and the mother of two. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her children, and her co-wife in the district of Hérémakono de Bougouni (prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). With her aunt, she started off making money at a very young age; but she ended up choosing commerce, given her tested experience in this niche.

To have working captial for meeting the mounting demands of her customers, she decided to get a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. This loan will be used to buy 15 pieces of cloth for pants, 20 boubou outfits (traditional dress), 6 lengths of UniWax-brand pagnes (colorful print cloth), and two boxes of parfume (...very popular clothing in Mali). She gets her supplies from Senegal and from Burkina Faso at least once a month. To move her goods, she sells at home, on the road in her district, and to salaried employees in companies. She expects to realize a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA. With this profit, she intends to pay the loan interest and to help cover the expenses of her extended family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Assitan Diakité est âgée de 40 ans , mère de 2 enfant et. vivant dans une famille poligame avec son mari,ses enfants et sa coépouse au quartier Hérémakono de Bougouni (prefecture de la 3ème region administrative de la république du Mali). Elle a commencé les activités generatrices de revenu dès son jeune âge auprès de sa tante; mais c’est le commerce qu’elle finit par choisir vu son expérience averée dans ce crénau.

Afin d’avoir un fonds de commerce pouvant satisfaire la demande de sa clientele de plus en plus croissante elle décida de prendre un prêt à SoroYiriwaso . Ce pret servira à acheter 15 tissus pour pantalons, 20 complets de grands boubous, 6 pièces de pagnes uni wax et 2 cartons de parfums.(vetement très prisés au Mali ). Elle s’approvisionne à partir du Sénégal et du Burkina Faso au moins une fois par mois. Pour écouler sa marchandise elle vend à domicile et fait l’ambulant dans son quartier et auprès des salariés dans les entreprises . Elle compte réalier un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle compte payer les intéterêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille élargie.

loans.use: To buy cloth to make clothing

loans.name: Fight From Shameness Group

texts.en:
Foday is 35 years old and married with 4 children. He learned electronic repairs at the age of 18 after dropping out of school. He worked as an apprentice where he learned the trade and established his own workshop 3 years ago. Foday is the group leader and is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts for his workshop.

Bintu and Abie both own small grocery stores in the Makeni market of Sierra Leone.

The members are requesting loans to increase their inventories.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and grocery store inventory

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells drinks. She is married, but her husband's income from selling goods is not sufficient for Ama’s expenses. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Moh

texts.fr:
Moh B. is 28 years old and lives with her husband, her four children, and her co-wife in a polygamous family in the district of Heremakono Nord de Bougouni (prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She learned her business from her mother at a young age and has total mastery of this business. She has had an association with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for five years and has benefited from seven loans, including four individual loans, all of which were repaid correctly.

She gets her supplies at the grand market of Bamako and sells articles at the Bougouni market. With this loan, she intends to buy 15 pieces of Wax-brand cloth and 10 pieces of embroidered fabric (which are very popular fabrics in West Africa). Her customer base is composed of women visiting the Bougouni marketplace. She expects to realize a monthly benefit of 50,000 francs CFA which will enable her to pay the loan interest and to help her husband to cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Moh B. est agée de 28 ans et vit avec son mari ses 4 enfants et sa coepouse dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de Bougouni (préfecture de la 3ème région administrative de la République Mali).

Elle a apris cette activité dès son jeune âge auprès de sa mère, et a une maîtrise totale de cette activité. Elle est en relation avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 5 ans et a bénéficié de sept prets dont quatre prets individuels tous remboursés correctement.

Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bamako et vend ses articles au marché de Bougouni. Avec ce pret elle compte acheter quinze pièces de tissus Wax et dix pièces de tissus brodés (Tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest). Sa clientèle est composée de femmes fréquentant le marché de Bougouni. Elle compte réalier un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA. Qui la permettra de payer les intérêts du prêt et aider son mari à assurer les dépenses de la famille

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna C. is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of six children living in the district of Heremakono Nord de Bougouni in a monogamous family. She has total mastery of this business that she learned from her mother at a young age.

From three group loans (solidarity loans), she has gone onward to individual loans with two such loans. All previous loans have been correctly repaid.

She gets her supplies at the Bamako market and makes her sales at the Bougouni market. With this loan, she intends to buy 20 dozen pieces of children's clothing and 10 dozen bed sheets. She is a retail seller to customers composed of essentially women. The eve of holidays (Tabaski, Ramadan, etc....) is when she makes a lot of her sales. She expects to realize a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA. With this loan, she will pay the loan interest and help her husband cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Maimouna C. est femme mariée de 40ans, mère de 6 enfants et résidant dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de Bougouni dans une famille monogame. Elle a une maîtrise totale de cette activité qu’elle a apprise dès son jeune âge auprès de sa mère.

Après 3 prêts de groupe (prets solidaires) elle est passée en pret individuel avec deux prets. Tous les prêt précedents ont été correctement remboursés.

Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Bamako et effectue ses ventes au marché de Bougouni. Avec ce pret elle compte achéter 20 douzaines de vêtements pour enfants et dix douzaines de draps de lit. Elle vend en détail à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. La veille des fêtes (Tabaski, Ramadan etc...) constitue sa grande période de vente. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle payera les intérêts du prêt et aidera son mari à assurer les dépenses de la famille

loans.use: To buy children's clothing

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
My business is the sale of food. I have already more than 2 years with the business. This business is the source of income for my family since I am a single mother. Thanks to God the business goes very well in sales. All that I lack is furniture and to have more variety of foods. That it is why I request a loan of $1,000 to buy furniture (chairs and tables and utensils for cooking).

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi negocio es de ventas de comida tengo ya mas de 2 años con el. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera. Gracias a dios el negocio va muy bien en las ventas solo que me esta haciendo falta muebles y tener mas variedad de comidas. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la comprar de muebles (Sillas y Mesas y utensilios para cocinar).

loans.use: to buy furniture and utensils for cooking.

loans.name: Modiéré

texts.fr:
Modiéré Sidibé is married, 32 years old, and the mother of four. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and her children in the district of Heremakono Centre de Bougouni. When she was young, she began to earn money, notably in catering, which she learned from her sister. She makes sales at the Bougouni bus station, where it is very busy. Her customers are generally travelers and truck drivers.

She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for six years and is on her eighth loan, of which five were individual loans. All previous loans were repaid correctly. This loan will be used to buy 800 kg of rice and some condiments for a period of one month. She gets her supplies of rice and condiments from Bamako, She makes several kinds of dishes: fatty rice, rice with tomato sauce or peanut sauce, fish or meat soups, fritters, stews, etc... She expects to realize a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA. With this profit, she expects to pay the loan interest and to help cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Modiéré Sidibé est mariée,âgée de 32 ans et mère de 4 enfants et vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier heremakono centre de Bougouni . Dès son jeune âge, elle a commencé les activités économiques notamment la Restauration qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa soeur. Elle vend à l’autogare de Bougouni ou il ya une grande fréquentation. Ses clients sont généralement les voyageurs et les routiers.

Elle travaille avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 6 ans et est à son.huitième prêts dont cinq individuels. Tous les prêts précedents ont été correctement remboursés. Ce pret servira à l’achat de à 800 kg Riz et des Condiments pour une période d’un mois .Elle s’approvisionne en Riz et Condiments à Bamako Elle prépare plusieurs sortes de plats: (riz au gras, riz avec sauces tomate et arachide, les Soupes de viande et de poisson, les fritures, les ragouts etc...... Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA .Avec ce bénéfice elle compte payer les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: To buy rice and condiments

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Mr. C. works full-time in an insurance agency in Nuevo Laredo. He just purchased his first home through a government program to help Mexican citizens purchase a home. The house is a basic unit that comes without a finished floor and unpainted, though, so Mr. C. is seeking a loan to finish these work items so that he can move in as soon as possible.

What is a Kiva housing loan?

In Mexico, many families are financially unable to purchase a house that is fully built out to meet their needs. Families thus improve their housing in stages in accordance with their resources. For families with limited income, saving up this money can be very difficult and a lack of capital can delay improvements for a long time. Kiva housing loans give families a tool to be able to have access to capital to improve their housing sooner, then pay it back at a pace that they can handle

loans.use: to install a finished floor and paint the interior

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Tomasyo Group

texts.en:
Sallay is the group leader. The three members of the group rotate the savings and activities among themselves. They also have group savings in case a member cannot meet her repayment obligation due to some problem. In this case, the group savings will be used to cover the repayment.

Sallay sells palm oil and earns $4 a day. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband has a small business. They both have to work to earn sufficient income for their family. Sallay is requesting a loan to purchase 85 gallons of palm oil to increase her stock. Fatmat S. and Yeabu C. also sell plam oil and other food items. The group is requesting a loan of Le.2400000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase palm oil

loans.name: Takuru Group

texts.en:
Mariatu B. and Mariatu Sankoh both run small local restaurants in the town of Makeni. Before their first loan from SMT, they could only sell 10-15 plates a day and could not cook a variety of foods. With their previous loans, the members managed to purchase the food items on wholesale. This increased the quality and quantity of the food and also their income. They also replaced the untensils in the restaurants.

Mariatu is the leader and she is 27 years old with 3 children. Her husband works as a driver with a meager income. Both B. and Sankoh would like to expand and diversify their businesses and are thefore requesting a loan of Le.1400,000

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, palm oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Ramatu's Group

texts.en: Ramatu S. is fifty-one years old and married with 9 children.  She lives with 6 of her children who are still young.  Ramatu sells firewood to earn income to provide the children with their needs, including school supplies.  Ramatu's husband is a retired teacher and her business is the main source of income for the family.  Fatamata owns a small kiosk in her homestead. Ramatu and Fatamata would like to expand their businesses and are therefore requesting a loan of Le.1,600,000.

loans.use: Purchase stock of fire wood

loans.name: Perlas De German Buch Group

texts.es:
The 11 members of "Germán Busch" form a very united and organized group centralized in the Huayna Potosí area of the city of El Alto, Bolivia. Only eight of the members finished their schooling, the rest of the group sadly learned to read and write only at a very basic level. It has been a dream for them to enroll in a school for adults to finish their education but at the moment they lack the necessary resources to do it. The majority of the members are mainly dedicated to the sale of fruits and vegetables on the distinct city streets of El Alto. With winter here, the prices for these products tend to rise as a result of frosts on the plantations. It's for this reason they needed to reinforce their capital to acquire their goods, which they do every two weeks. They also want to be able to rent or buy sales posts in the city markets to ensure their sales and better preserve their products. In this way they'll be able to increase their earnings and be able to afford going to school and give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En la ciudad de El Alto, en la zona Huayna Potosí se encuentra el centro focal “Germán Busch” dentro este centro encontramos a la asociación denominada “Perlas de Germán Busch”, 11 miembros forman un grupo muy unido y organizado. Solo 8 de ellas tiene estudios culminados el resto lamentablemente aprendió a leer y escribir da manera muy básica, siendo un gran sueño él poder entrar a la escuela de adultos para culminar sus estudios que de momento por falta de recursos no pueden hacerlo. La mayoría de ellas se dedican principalmente a la venta de fruta y verdura en distintos calles de la ciudad del Alto. ahora que el invierno llego, este tipo de productos tiende a subir de precio por las heladas en las plantaciones, Es por eso que necesitan reforzar su capital para la adquisición de estos productos, que lo realizan quincenalmente, además desean poder alquilar o comprar puestos en mercados o tambos de esta ciudad para asegurar las ventas y la conservación de sus productos De esta manera obtener mayores ganancias y con esto poder culminar sus estudios y apoyar a que sus familias tenga una mejor forma de vida

loans.use: Purchase goods and rent or buy sales posts / necesitan creditos para reforzar su capital de trabajo y tambien poder alquilar puestos en mercados.

loans.name: Together We Tinap Group

texts.en: Abdul K. started his business three years go with small "loans at a time" from SMT.  He is honest and paid his installments diligently.  Abdul K. is very grateful to the loan program.  He sells plastic sandals.  Abdul K.'s business expanded and he can provide 3 meals a day to his family.  Abdul K. is the group leader. He is thirty-one years old and married with 2 children.  Other group members are engaged in various business activities.  The group is requesting a loan of Le.5000000 to further expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase plastic sandals, increase food market, and increase invetory in the general store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mujeres Del Alba Group

texts.es:
Every day of the week, Benita L. rises very early to go to the bakery to purchase traditional lauchas (very rich sweet bread filled with cheese), and then at 7 a.m. starts offering them hot and fresh on the distinctive streets of the city of El Alto, Bolivia. This is one of the most common activities among the members of "Mujeres del Alba" (Women of the Dawn), who also offer their lauchas in canisters to preserve their freshness. The women say that during the current cold season their sales are better, which is why they'd like to double their output and be able to hire assistants to cover other areas of the city, which well help them generate better earnings. They hope this will help improve the economic situations of their households.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Todos las días de la semana doña Benita se levanta muy temprano, para ir al horno a comprar las tradicionales y riquisimas lauchas (empanadas de queso), luego como a las 7:00am empieza a ofrecerlas muy calentitas, en las distintas calles de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta es una de las actividades más comunes dentro la asociación “Mujeres del Alba“, que al igual que su compañeras ofrecen sus lauchas en unas canastas, para poder conservar el calor de éstas. Ellas afirman que con el actual frío, las ventas son mayores por lo que desean duplicar la adquisición de sus empanadas y poder contratar ayudantes, para abarcar otros lugares de venta, con esto generarían mayores ganancias. Para conseguir estabilidad económica en sus hogares.

loans.use: Hire assistants and enlarge sales area / Necesitan capital para poder contratar ayudantes y asi  ampliar lugares de venta

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia is 37 years of age. She currently lives in her own house with her family. Her husband is 42 years of age, and their 5 children are 16, 14, 11, 8, and 6 years old. They live in the western zone of the province. Lucia sells beverages and other products as a street vendor. Her husband is a delivery person for the Sobolma LTDA company under a yearly contract. She and her husband have been working for several years. She has medium competition with regards to her beverage business, whereas her husband has no competition because he has a steady job. They are both successful in their jobs because of their years of experience and constant care. With this loan, they will purchase a motorcycle that costs about 5,000.00 BOB. This is the Lucia’s third loan request in this institution, and she has demonstrated to be a punctual and responsible member. She currently has another small debt in different institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia cuenta con 37 años de edad y actualmente vive junto a su familia en su casa propia. Su esposo tiene 42 años de edad y sus cinco hijos son de 16, 14, 11, 8 y 6 años de edad respectivamente. Su domicilio está ubicado en la zona oeste de la provincia. Lucia se dedica a la venta de refrescos y otros productos al por menor y de manera ambulante. Su esposo es cargador de la empresa Sobolma LTDA. bajo un contrato que es anual. La pareja desarrolla sus actividades desde hace varios años atrás La competencia es mediana en cuanto a la venta de refrescos, respecto a su esposo no haycompetencia ya que es un empleo fijo y seguro, ambos tiene éxito en sus actividades debido a su antigüedad y constante esmero. Con la presente solicitud comprarán una moto que tiene un precio aparoximado de Bs. 5,000.-. Esta solicitud es la tercera de Lucia en la institución y en el tiempo de relación comercial demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad. Actualmente tiene otra deuda pequeña en otra institución.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle

loans.name: Salustiano M

texts.es:
Salustiano Medardo is 34 years of age and lives in his own home with his wife, age 37, and their 3 children ages 12, 10, and 8. Their house is located in the eastern zone of the province in a neighborhood called Alfredo Vaca. Medardo is a full-time bricklayer and part-time motorcycle taxi driver. He has a great deal of experience in both fields. He has medium competition because of the amount of bricklayers and motorcycle taxi drivers that exist in the community, but since there is a demand for both, there is always work available. Merdardo has been planning on purchasing a refrigerator with the loan as well as goods that his wife can sell during her free time. She currently works sweeping streets, but they only had enough money for their second goal. This is Medardo’s third loan request with the institution, and he has demonstrated to be a punctual and responsible member. He currently has another debt with a different institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Salustiano Medardo cuenta con 34 años de edad y vive en casa propia junto a su esposa de 37 años y sus tres hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años de edad. La casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona este de la provincia en un barrio denominado Alfredo Vaca. Medardo es albañil y desempeña en este rubro a tiempo completo y en sus momentos libres se dedica al transporte público urbano en su moto taxi. En ambos rubro tiene bastante experiencia. La competencia es de nivel medio, debido a la cantidad de albañiles y mototaxistas que hay en la comunidad, pero debido a la demanda que existe no le falta trabajo. Medardo tenía previsto comprar una heladera con el prestamo y también mercadería de abarrotes para que su esposa pueda vender en sus momentos libres, ya que ella actualmente trabaja barriendo las calles, pero el dinero sólo alcanzó para el segundo objeto. Esta es la tercera frecuencia de Medardo con la institución y en el tiempo que trabajo en la misma demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad. Tiene una deuda vigente en otra institución.

loans.use: Purchase refrigerator and goods

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina has four children who are 14, 12, 8 and 5 years old respectively. The family lives in their own home, which is register in their name. Reina has a stand in an important market in the city, where she has sold clothing for children for more than 14 years. There is a lot of competition, but the fact that she has been there for a long time permits her to have a fixed set of customers to whom she sells her products. Her current request is for a loan that would allow her to invest in the acquisition of children's clothing for the winter, which she would bring to La Paz. This is Reina's third interaction with the institution and she has shown a good record in paying her quotas.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Reina tiene cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 8 y 5 años respectivamente. La familia vive en casa propia que está registrada en derechos Reales a su nombre. Tiene un puesto de venta en un mercado importante de la Ciudad, donde tiene un puesto desde hace más de 14 años atrás vendiendo ropa para niños. La competencia es alta, pero su antigúedad le permite tener clientela fija (minoristas) a los cuales provee de sus productos. La presente solicitud es para invertir en la adquisición de ropa de niños para el invierno que la traerá de La Paz. Esta es la tercera frecuencia de Reina con la isntitución y demostró un buen cumplimiento en el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: Purchasing children's clothes

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana started the business out of necessity and because she has always wanted to start one. Because there was a lack of jobs in her hometown, she had no choice but to move to Monterrey with her family—her husband and three children. She started selling shoes by catalogue 4 years ago, making small shoe demonstrations amongst her friends and neighbors until establishing a client base that allowed her to increase her income.

She now needs a loan of $400.00 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, in order to purchase an awning so that she can put on demonstrations at home with her neighbors. With your help, Diana will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Diana inició el negocio por necesidad y para empezar un negocio por su cuenta dado que siempre quizo tener un negocio, debido a que de la comunidad donde proviene el trabajo es escaso seo vio obligada a radicar en Monterrey con su familia ( su esposo y sus tres hijos). Comenzó hace 4 años vendiendo zapatos solo sobre pedidos y haciendo pequeñas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas, hasta que genero una cartera de clientes que le permitio mejor sus ingresos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $ 400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar un toldo para hacer demostraciones en casa y con sus vecinos. Con tu apoyo Diana saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase an awning

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A lease

loans.name: Sinda

texts.es:
SInda has a family that is comprised of her husband and three children who are 15, 11 and 5 years old respectively. She has a business of American clothing and new clothing; she has two years of experience in this trade. Because she works in a central market she has very few competitors; moreover, thanks to this strategic location she can count on many customers. Another very important aspect of her work is the good treatment she gives customers. With the current loan she will purchase merchandise - that is, new clothes that she has somebody bring from the fair in a local neighborhood. This loan is her third with this organization in which she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in meeting her obligations. In fact, she has another debt with another organization with she pays in a punctual manner.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Sinda tiene una familia que está conformada por su esposo y tres hijos de 15, 11 y 5 años respectivamente. Tiene su negocio ropa americana y ropa nueva, cuenta con una experiencia de 2 años en este rubro. Como trabaja en el mercado central tiene muy pocos competidores, además debido a que su ubicación es estratégica le permite contar con bastante clientela. Un aspecto muy importante es también el buen trato que la caracteriza. Con el presente crédito comprará mercadería, es decir ropa nueva que la hace traer desde la Feria de barrio lindo. La presente es la tercera operación con nuestra institución donde demostró ser puntual y responsable con sus obligaciones. Actualmente tiene otra deuda con una tercera institución que también paga de manera puntual.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario's family is comprised of a son who is four years old. They live in their own home which is located in the Minero province. Rosario has a business of food sales where she offers a variety of dishes; she has ample experience in this profession. She is very competent and because she is popular in her community she does not lack customers. Her present request is for credit that will allow her to expand her business. She has very good credit; she does not have any debts with other parties, just with this institution.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La familia de Rosario está conformada por su hijito que tiene cuatro años de edad, residen en domicilio propio que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia Minero. Rosario tiene su negocio de ventas de comidas donde ofrece variedad de platos y tiene una amplia experiencia en este rubro. Tiene competencia pero como Rosario es bastante popular en la comunidad, no le falta demanda en su negocio. La presente solicitud es para capital de operación, es decir para la ampliación de su pensión. Tiene muy buenas crediticias, no tiene deudas con terceros sólo en nuestra institución.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina started her business so that she could earn extra money to pay the family expenses. She also receives help from her children, who work and still live with her. A few years ago, she needed more income because one of her children was unemployed, so she decided to start her small clothing business. Two years ago, she started selling her merchandise to her family, friends, and neighbors outside her home. She has been selling all types of apparel, and she currently sells several bundles a month now that she has more customers.

She is now requesting a loan of $400.00 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, because she needs to purchase more of the season’s clothing, thus growing as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina qué inició el negocio para poder conseguir un ingreso extra para pagar los gastos familiares ya que también recibe ayuda por parte de sus hijos los cuales trabajan y aun viven con ella. En aquel entonces necesitaba mas entrada de dinero a su casa ya que uno de sus hijos estaba desempleado, así que ella decidió iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa Comenzó hace 2 años, vendiendo afuera de su casa, con vecinos, amigos y familiares, comenzó vendiendo todo tipo de prendas poco a poco, actualmente ya vende varias pacas en el mes y tiene mas clientes.

Ahora solicita un prestamo por US $ 400 que pagara en 5 meses ya que necesita comprar mas ropa para esta temporada y seguir creciendo así como microempresaria.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of furniture and medical costs

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Maria Juana started her shoe business in order to help her husband with the family expenses. Her husband had barely started working at that time, and did not earn that much income, so his family underwent financial hardships. She decided to start a business that would generate income for her, so she started selling shoes to her friends and family a year ago. Now, her client base has increased considerably.

She is requesting a loan of $400.00 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, in order to purchase merchandise. This is graduation season, which is optimum for her because she has received several shoe orders. With your help, Maria will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Juana inició el negocio de la venta de calzado para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Su esposo tenia muy poco tiempo de haber comenzado a trabajar y estaba ganando muy poco de sueldo, por lo que su familia se veia en aprietos economicos. Ella decicido emprender un negocio que le generara ingresos por lo que comenzó hace poco mas de 1 año vendiendo zapatos a sus amigas y familiares, actualmente su numero de clientes se ha incrementado considerablemente.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancia ya que esta proxima la temporada de graduaciones y es muy buena para ella ya que tiene varios pedidos de calzado. Con tu apoyo Maria saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Villa Antofagasta Group

texts.es:
The "Villa Antofagasta" group has been part of the Pro-Mujer (Kiva partner) family for a number of years. The group comes from the city of El Alto, Bolivia, and to date have 18 members who have proven to be organized with their loans and internal activities. The majority of the members are married with children, most of whom are either in school or college, although some have had to abandon their studies due to a lack of economic resources. The goal of their parents is to work to generate more income so their children's education can be fulfilled and in this way ensure them a successful future.

There a different types of business within the group, for instance the sale of condiments and spices and the sale of casual clothing, but the principal activity of the members is the making of chompas (sweaters), chalinas (scarves) and other traditional clothing items of the area, which they sell at festival markets in La Paz. The group needs more capital to purchase the high-quality raw materials needed to make these types of articles and thus attract a better clientele and increase their earnings. The sole goal is to improve their economic situation in order to offer their children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La asociación denominada “Villa Antofagasta” forma parte de la familia de Pro-Mujer hace ya varios años, esta se encuentra en la zona de Alto Lima, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 18 socias que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas. Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar y también universitarios, de los cuales muchos tuvieron que abandonar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos. Ahora el objetivo de sus padres es el trabajar más para generar ingresos que les permita solventar los estudios académicos de sus hijos de esta forma asegurar el futuro de ellos, afirman. Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de condimentos y especies, de ropa casual , pero la actividad principal es tejido de chompas, matillas, chalinas y otros, que luego las venden en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. La asociación Villa Antofagasta” afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra materia prima de mejor calidad de esta manera sus tejidos también tendrían mejor calidad y así obtendrían mayores clientes y por consiguiente mayores ganancias con el unico objetivo de mejorar su situación económica de esta manera ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor forma de vida principalmente en su educación.

loans.use: Purchase high-quality materials to make tradition clothing items / Necesita capital para la compra de materia prima de mejor calidad.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia began her business to help her husband with the household expenses. His income was not enough to cover their costs, as he did not have steady work. She began selling home products by catalog. She started 3 years ago, only selling by request and doing small presentations house to house to her neighbors and friends.

Now Patricia is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 5 months, so she can purchase more merchandise and make more demonstrations, and fill her customers requests more quickly.

Patricia inició el negocio para salir adelante por por necesidad dado que no era suficiente con lo que ganaba su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar, ya que el no tenia un trabajo fijo esto la obligo a salir adelante por si misma y empezo a vender blancos por catalogo. Comenzó hace 3 años solo vendiendo sobre pedidos y pequeñas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas, asi como casa por casa

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US$400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancia y poder realizar demostraciones asi como agilizar los tiempo de pedido para que sea menor para sus clientes.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE TO BETTER MEET HER CUSTOMERS REQUESTS

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
This business, which at first didn’t seem feasible, is now bringing much satisfaction to Yobana, a 25 year-old woman who more than 5 years ago decided to start selling jewelry in the Túpac Amaru market in the city of Juliaca. She began by selling a few pieces of jewelry (earrings and gold-plated chains) to family and friends, but upon seeing that her novel and beautiful jewelry was much sought after, she became motivated to sell it to the public. She currently exhibits and sells her jewelry every day of the week. Thanks to this, she is able to satisfactorily cover her personal expenses. Yobana hopes, with the help of your generous hearts, to obtain enough capital to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio que en un principio parecía no ser rentable le está trayendo mucha satisfacción a Yobana, joven de 25 años de edad que hace más de 5 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de joyas dentro del mercado Túpac Amaru de la ciudad de Juliaca.Inicio su labor vendiendo pocas joyas (aretes y collares bañados en oro) sólo a sus familiares y amigos, pero al ver que sus novedosas y hermosas joyas eran muy solicitadas se animó a ofertarlas a todo el público.Actualmente exhibe y vende sus joyas durante todos los días de la semana, gracias a ello logra cubrir satisfactoriamente sus gastos personales.Yobana espera reunir con vuestros generosos corazones el capital suficiente para ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: To increase her capital so that she can expand her business.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela is a woman who has creativity and talent in her hands. From the time she was a child, she showed great interest in learning how to make these beautiful handicrafts. At the urging of various friends and neighbors, she is currently taking handicraft classes where she is learning to make a great variety of decorations for the kitchen, bedrooms, and other uses. Mariela works hard with the goal of saving enough to open a small store for her handicrafts. The decorations that she designs and makes with the help of her beloved daughter, Anita, who is ten years old, allow her to cover satisfactorily the household expenses. She has many projects in mind—projects that, with your help, she hopes to carry out.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariela, es una mujer que tiene creatividad y talento en las manos, desD. niña demostró tener gran interés por aprender a realizar estos hermosos trabajos D. manualidades; actualmente por solicitud D. algunas amistades y vecinos viene dictando diferentes cursos D. manualidades, cursos donD. elaboran gran variedad D. adornos para cocina, dormitorios y uso personal, Mariela trabaja arduamente con el fin D. ahorrar lo suficiente y abrir su tiendita D. manualidades. Los adornos que diseña y elabora con apoyo D. su querida hija Anita D. 10 años D. edad le está permitiendo cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos D. su hogar, y tiene muchos proyectos en mente, proyectos que espera con tu apoyo concretarlos.

loans.use: To increase her capital so that she can soon open her handicrafts store

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel started her business out of necessity in order to help her 3 children get ahead in life. Since her husband earns low wages which are not sufficient to cover the household expenses, Anabel decided to work for herself. She started 3 years ago, selling shoes by catalogue both at the local markets and door-to-door. She later started to give shoe demonstrations as well, which is how she established her client base that has increased little by little because of her efforts.

She is requesting a loan of $400.00 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, in order to purchase merchandise, fill her orders, and get settled in the weekend flea markets. With your help, Anabel will reinforce her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Anabel inició el negocio por necesidad para poder sacar a sus 3 hijos adelante dado que su esposo tiene un salario bajo y no es suficiente para solventar los gastos del hogar. Debido a todo esto ella empezo a trabajar por su cuenta, comenzó hace 3 años en los mercados y casa por casa, vendiendo zapatos por pedido y despues haciendo demostraciones. Fue asi que logro hacerse de una cartera de clientes y la cual poco a poco ha incrementado en base a su esfuerzo.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancia y asi poder surtir pedidos que tiene pendientes y establecerse en los mercados rodantes de fin de semana. Con tu apoyo Anabel consolidara su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
Yrma is an expert in the art of macramé. During her free time she makes beautiful purses, bracelets, caps, and crocheted shawls for women and girls. By profession she is a teacher, but another of her passions is making craft items. She is happy because selling them generates income to support her family and the education of her daughters. Irma comes to you with the hope of receiving economic support so that she can buy materials that she needs to continue making her beautiful crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Yrma, es una dama que conoce perfectamente el arte en macramé, ella confecciona en sus horas libres hermosas carteras, pulseras, boinas y chalinas tejidas a crochet para damas y niñas; también es maestra de profesión, pero otra de las labores que la apasiona es realizar sus bellos trabajos manuales que para su satisfacción le genera importantes ingresos económicos para el sustento de su familia y educación de sus hijas.Irma recurre a vosotros con la esperanza se recibir apoyo económico y así adquirir materia prima para seguir elaborando sus hermosos trabajos.

loans.use: To buy a larger quanity of materials for making her craft items

loans.name: Julieth

texts.es:
Julieta is a young lady of 18 years of age. She is very cheerful and ingenious. As soon as she finished her high school studies she immediately got started in the business of selling stuffed animals and also selling cosmetics by order. She has had success in both businesses and it is thanks to this that she is now persuing higher education at a private university in the city of Juliaca. Her economic independence has made her into a responsible woman and she is sure that with hard work she will be able to have success in life. At this time she does not have sufficient capital to invest in her cosmetics sales business, due to the fact that a few days ago she decided to invest her capital in her second-hand stuffed animal business. She requests your support so that she can continue with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Julieth, es una jovencita de 18 años, muy alegre e ingeniosa, desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios inmediatamente se dedicó al negocio de peluches y venta de cosméticos de belleza por pedidos, con ambas actividades obtuvo buenos resultados, gracias a ello viene siguiendo sus estudios superiores en una Universidad Privada de la ciudad de Juliaca.Su independencia económica la ha convertido en una mujer responsable y segura de lo que con esfuerzo está dispuesta ha alcanzar en la vida, en estos momentos no cuenta con suficiente capital para invertir en su negocio de venta de cosméticos de belleza, debido a que hace algunos días decidió invertir todo su capital en su negocio de venta de peluches de segundo uso.Y solicita vuestro apoyo para continuar con su labor.

loans.use: To increase her capital so that she can continue her business of selling cosmetics

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza is very cheerful and industrious. Since her beloved sons were born, she has worked with dedication alongside her husband, Elmer. They sell natural products on market days in the small towns surrounding her home city, Juliaca. She and her family currently live in a rented room. This young couple hopes to be able to give a safe roof of their own to their children. They are both aware that in order to do this they will need to work even harder and your help would an important contribution toward crystallizing this family’s dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maritza, es una dama muy alegre y hacendosa, desde que les concedió el don de vida a sus dos amados hijos trabajó denodadamente junto a su esposo Elmer, con quien se dedica a la venta de productos naturales los días de feria en los distintos pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad natal, Juliaca.Ella y su familia actualmente viven en una habitación alquilada, el deseo de estos jóvenes padres es brindarles un techo propio y seguro a sus amados hijos, ambos son conscientes que para ello tienen que esforzarse mucho más y vuestra ayuda podría significar un aporte importante para cristalizar los sueños de esta familia.

loans.use: To increase her capital so that she can buy a larger stock of items for her business.

loans.name: Promejoramiento Group

texts.en:
The Promejoramiento community is a six-month-old group in need of funding for its second loan. These women are all mothers from the remote highland village of San Jose Chacaya. They are mainly dedicated to raising livestock and planting/sowing agricultural products. Others dedicate their lives to making and selling food, and administrating fruit stands and a small grocery store.

These women are openly very happy with their hometown. The general feeling is that they like the sense of community in their town and its citizens' latent desire to grow and prosper. Silvia Feliciana P. P. pointed out how much they enjoyed dancing or watching people dance at the yearly fair, which brings the entire town together in the church’s central square. Events like the fair are the ones for which the credit proves most helpful, allowing them to stock up in order to maximize profits during these periods of condensed sales.

They unanimously made a point of mentioning how thankful they are of the possibility of receiving these “very helpful” loans that allow their microenterprises to “go very well,” as Maria R. A. expressed. She went on to say that they feel a sense of empowerment when receiving the funds, a kind of responsibility to do something bigger than ever before with it, and prove to their group and, most importantly, their family, that they can pay back the money. They unanimously agreed as well that it was relatively easy to pay back the money. In addition, they all enjoy meeting with their communal bank, which not only allows them to support each other mutually in repaying loans, but provides a few fun social hours every month.

“Without this money, it is impossible to overcome,” stated Natalia T.. She mentioned the barriers of the cycles of steady profits and expenses, but the drowning and constant increases in costs of living that keep their businesses at such a minimal size. Reliable microloans allow them to overcome these barriers.

Their ultimate investment goal is growth, which will lead to money, which will allow them and their children to live comfortable lives, despite today’s unprecedented costs of living. The fact that every one of these mothers sends her children to public school is proof of their claims of dedication to the family. They send all of their children to school despite the large expenses and the need for labor at the business. Esperanza Juliana started receiving small loans when she was a mobile sweets and chips vendor, and today, she requests and consistently repays 400 USD and higher to purchase wholesale items for her well-established store, while sending her two girls to school. Natalia T. passes house to house selling from two large (head carried) baskets tamales, rice, beans, and atol de platano, some of which she grows on her own fields with the help of her husband. She brings her children along to help if they are not in school.

Increased profits from growing more vegetables, buying wholesale to supply larger family stores or investing in buying and raising more livestock at once are the economic benefits which keep these mothers consistently pay off and return for more loans. This dedication holds as an ultimate goal to lift their children to a higher starting platform by paying for their schooling successfully and providing them with adequate health care. It seems that their children, their ultimate pride, are a reflection of their own life, and through these loans they choose to better their children’s lives, making up for the hardships that they have had to live through.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale seed, fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Nilvia Marisol

texts.es:
Nilvia is married and has two children. She started her own business in order to help her husband with the household expenses. Two years ago, she started selling shoes, clothing, toys, and assorted products at the local outdoor markets. Because she now has more customers, she deals with a large volume of merchandise, which has led her to pay transportation fees.

She currently needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, because she would like to buy a freight tricycle in order to avoid transportation fees. She would like to transport the merchandise herself since the markets in which she works are not far from her home. With your help, Nilvia will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Nilvia es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Ella inicio el negocio para apoyar a su marido con los gastos de la casa. Comenzo hace 2 años con la venta de ropa, zapatos, juguets y productos diversos en los tianguis, actualmente el volumen que maneja de mercancía la ha obligado a tener que pagar fletes para transportarlos, ya que sus clientes son mas

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses ya que desea comprar un triciclo para evitarse el gasto de fletes y poder transportar la mercancía, ya que los tianguis donde labora no estan lejos de su domicilio. Con tu ayuda Nilvia saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase freight tricycle

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
In one of the most commercial streets in the town of Juliaca, we find ourselves in the small office of Luzmila’s business, whom for the last two years has devoted herself to selling hamburgers and salchipapas (Hot-dogs and French fries) on the street. Luzmila established this business with many hopes of improving her quality of life and that of her family. It is for this reason that since she started-up the business, she has worked to provide an excellent service to her customers. Currently, she has a large number of regular customers which she wishes to retain: in order to do this, she is thinking of acquiring chairs and tables to improve her customers’ comfort. Luzmila hopes from the bottom of her heart to receive your help.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

En una de las calles más comerciales de la ciudad de Juliaca ubicamos el puestito de negocio de Luzmila, quien desde hace 2 años viene dedicándose a la venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas en forma ambulatoria. Luzmila inició este negocio con muchas perceptivas de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, es por ello que desde un inició se esforzó para brindarles un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.Actualmente cuenta con gran cantidad de asiduos comensales a los que desea seguir conservando, para ello tiene pensado adquirir sillas y mesas para mayor comodidad de sus clientes. Luzmila espera de corazón recibir tu colaboración.

loans.use: Injections of capital in order to install  tables and chairs in her daily work space

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es:
Wilber is a responsible family man and father who cares for his relatives with great attention. He comes from an agricultural family and today it is these activities which provide a major source of income which allow him to support his 3 sons. His dream is to see his sons succeed and it is in order to achieve this that his efforts know no limit. In this case, his wish is to improve his seeding and to care for his animals, for which he needs a loan. Your help is very important for this hard-working and humble worker.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Wilber, es un padre de familia responsable que cuida de los suyos con mucho empeño, proviene de una familia que es netamente agricultora y hoy ésta actividad es una gran fuente de ingresos que le permite sostener a sus 3 hijos. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos superados y es por ello que no mide sus esfuerzos por lograrlos y en esta oportunidad su deseo es mejorar su siembra y cuidado de sus animales para lo cual requiere de un préstamo. Vuestro apoyo es muy importante para este padre humilde y trabajador.

loans.use: Injection of captial to improve his buisness

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a decisive woman who struggles every day to secure her sons’ daily sustenance as they are on the daily path to self-improvement. It’s for this reason that she gets up very early every day in order to gather the harvest from her cultivation fields: her main work centres on the cultivation of potatoes and maize, and it is precisely these products that serve to improve her home’s economic situation, as once dried she offers them to an export company based in Lima. She wants to improve production this year and as a result Florinda is asking for a loan. Let us make sure sure that the labours of this hard-working mother have a favourable result.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Esther, es una mujer decidida, que cada día se empeña por lograr el sustento diario de sus hijos que están en el camino diario de la superación, es así que ella se levanta muy temprano para poder recoger la cosecha de sus campos de cultivo, su principal dedicación se centra en cultivar papa y maíz, y precisamente este es el producto que le sirve para mejorar la economía de su hogar una vez secado los oferta a una empresa exportadora de la ciudad de Lima. Desea mejorar su producción este año y por esa razón solicita un préstamo, hagamos que la labor de esta trabajadora madre tenga un resultado favorable.

loans.use: Increase in capital in order to improve production

loans.name: Antonia Alvina

texts.es:
Alvina is a young entrepreneur who wanted to continue with her studies, but upon observing her family’s financial situation, which was challenging, she decided to pursue a job that would not take too much time away from her and that would generate the income needed for her education. This is why she decided to sell clothing 3 years ago. She has managed to increase her client base little by little. Her profits allow her to not only pay for her studies, but also help with the household expenses.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase merchandise and offer her customers a wider selection of apparel. With your help, Alvina will keep making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Alvina es una joven emprendedora, que deseaba seguir estudiando pero al ver la situación económica de su familia, la cual era muy dificil, ella decidió dedicarse a alguna actividad económica que no le quitara mucho tiempo y que le generara ingresos para poder seguir estudiando,fue asi que deicidio dedicarse a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años, y logro así, poco a poco ir creando sus clientes, sus ganancias ahora le permiten no solo pagar sus estudios sino contribuir con el gasto de su familia.

Ella necesita de un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y tener mas variedad que ofrecerla a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Alvina seguira progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Rosalina is an insistent and hard-working woman: years of work have made her into a courageous and valiant woman, able to continue following her separation from her husband three years ago. She has taken total control of her house in company with her three small children and has made considerable effort in weaving cloths, which already provide her with sufficient economic income to provide for those she loves most. Please help Rosalinda and don’t delay her in her path towards self-improvement.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalinda, es muy empeñosa y trabajadora, los años de trabajo la han convertido en una mujer de mucho coraje y valor para continuar tras la separación de su esposo hace 3 años ella ha tomado el control total de su hogar en compañía de sus tres pequeños y se esfuerza mucho más en su fábrica de tejas, ya que esta le proporciona los ingresos económicos suficientes para solventar a los que más ama.Apoya a Rosalinda y no se detendrá en su camino hacia la superación.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve her work

loans.name: Nueva Ilusion Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank Nueva Ilusión is a new bank that just began with 18 members, who after weeks of working and learning are beginning to be very happy. Many of them were invited by members of other big Village Banks.

The members have different businesses such as the sale of clothing, artisan work, vegetables, groceries, construction materials, candy and sweets, cereals, food, cosmetics, and the agriculture of vegetables.

Each member has a different history – such as Raquel who lives in the community of Totorilla. With her family she is committed to agriculture and growing vegetables which she sells in the Nery Garcia market – and she uses the income from these sales to pay for her studies. Another bank member, Lucia, sells sweets at the door of the San Ramon school. She says that at first they would push her away, but because of her consistency she has now established her place there.

The members need varying loan amounts totaling 8,400 soles. The loans will be invested in the purchase of shirts, sweaters, sugar, rice, meat, wheat, barley, cookies, candies, cosmetics, seeds and abono (fertilizer).

The dreams of the women are that their businesses are prosperous and their children become professional and that they one day own their own homes.

loans.use: To buy shirts, sweaters, sugar, rice, meat, wheat, barley, cookies, candies, cosmetics, seeds and abono.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is a humble family mother who makes daily efforts to provide her children with the best things every day, by way of setting-up her own business. She sells orange and pineapple juice in a place near her home every morning: in the afternoons she also sells snacks. She wants to improve her business and install a work space in order to increase her earnings for the benefit of her dearly loved family.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Ana, es una humilde madre de familia que se esfuerza diariamente por brindarle a sus hijos lo mejor cada día mediante el emprendimiento de su propio negocio. Ella se dedica la venta de jugo de naranja y de piña en un lugar cercano a su casa todas las mañanas; y por las tardes se dedica también a la venta de lonches. Desea mejorar su actividad e implementar su espacio de labor a fin de acrecentar sus ganancias en beneficio de su amada familia.

loans.use: Injection of capital to rennovate her work space

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Thanks to the love and support of her family, Monica is more and more motivated to carry on each day. She has always been a very enterprising woman and for the last 12 years she has been selling medicine from a small pharmacy that she opened from her home. She would now like to re-open this pharmacy after improving the infraestructure of her house so that she can also rent a part of it and thereby earn enough to support her kids. It is for this reason that she would like a loan; as it will allow her to improve the atmosphere of the building. You can support the noble labour of this very hard-working mother.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Mónica, está cada día más animada a seguir adelante gracias a la motivación y al amor de su familia, ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora y hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de fármacos en una botica que instaló en el local céntrico de su propia casa, y ahora su deseo es poder reabrir esa botica y a su vez mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para poder arrendar cada ambiente y de esta manera tener los ingresos necesarios que necesita para el sostén de sus hijos. Por este motivo solicita un préstamo los cuales le servirán para mejorar los ambientes de su inmueble. Vosotros podéis apoyar la noble labor de esta trabajadora madre de familia.

loans.use: An injection of capital to improve the building before renting it/Inyección de capital para mejorar su inmueble a fin de prestar sus servicios de alquiler.

loans.name: Pelaya

texts.es:
Mrs Pelaya is an acredited farmer and even now working in the fields brings her a lot of satisfaction. For more than 30 years she and her husband have been living off their agricultural knowledge. Now Mrs Pelaya completely dedicates herself to maize, cress and wheat production which she herself sells in order to earn an income. Her greatest desire is to see her last 2 sons finish university. Although this will only happen in a few years time, this is her greatest motivation. Support Mrs Pelaya to achieve her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Pelaya, es una acreditada mujer del campo, sus años D. experiencia en el cultivo D. la tierra hasta hoy le trae innumerables satisfacciones, porque por más D. 30 años, supo junto a su esposo sacar provecho del conocimiento D. las actividades agrícolas. Actualmente, Doña Pelaya, se dedica enteramente al cultivo del maíz, alfalfa y principalmente al trigo D. las cuales ella misma se encarga D. comercializar para obtener ganancias, su gran anhelo es ver a sus 2 últimos hijos terminando sus carreras para lo cual faltan aún varios años y esa es la razón D. su diario esfuerzo. Apoya a Doña Pelaya en sus deseos fervientes D. superación.

loans.use: An injection of capital to improve active production/Inyección de capital para mejorar su actividad productiva.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida is a much admired woman who's constancy and perseverance has allowed her to support her family through the small business that she set up that is now growing. She has a small shop in her house in which she sells basic articles that members of the community need. She would like to take this opportunity to ask for your support so that she can increase the amount of merchandise she has.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Elida, es una mujer admirable que con mucha constancia y perseverancia ha podido sacar adelante a su familia con el emprendimiento de su pequeño negocio con tendencia creciente. Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en casa y a través de la cual provee artículos de primera necesidad a los miembros de su comunidad. En esta oportunidad solicita vuestro apoyo para incrementar su mercadería y ofertas dentro de su establecimiento.

loans.use: An injection to capital to better kit out her small work space/Inyección de capital para implementar su pequeño espacio de trabajo.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen has had a lot of success selling calf meat and she never misses an opportunity to expand the space that she has at home to raise animals so that she can sell them at the local market. Her desire is to increase her merchandise so that she will have a stable position in the market. She always puts in a lot of effort and her main motivation is her love for her 3 kids. She would like a loan so that she can buy more animals to sell their meat.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen, es una mujer exitosa en el campo de la venta de carne de ganado vacuno y no desaprovecha oportunidad alguna en el amplio espacio de su domicilio para criar animales para beneficiarlos y luego venderlos en el mercado local. Su deseo es crecer en mercadería con el objetivo de tener un puesto estable para lo cual sabe que tiene que esforzarse constantemente motivada por el gran amor que siente por sus 3 hijos. Su petición de un préstamo atiende a la necesidad de adquirir mayor cantidad de animalitos para mejorar la oferta de sus carnes.

loans.use: An injection of capital to improve her prices/Inyección de capital para mejorar la oferta de su mercadería.

loans.name: Saturdina

texts.es:
Saturdina is a very enterprising woman. She works long hours each day including getting up very early to feed her animals and take them out of their pens. Along with her husband she then sews olluco, potato, onions and broad beans. They both wish to continue with their labours as they really want to improve the quality of life of their family and contribute to the development of their much loved kids.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Saturdina, es una mujer muy empeñosa, trabaja diariamente desde altas horas de la mañana para sacar a sus animales y pastarlos en la amplitud de la pradera, mientras se alimentan junto a su esposo se dedica a cultivar la tierra y siembran olluco, papa, habas y cebada. Desean continuar con esta labor debido a que tiene muchos deseos de contribuir con el mejoramiento de su calidad de vida familiar y el desarrollo de sus amados hijos.

loans.use: An injection of capital to improve earnings/Inyección de capital para mejorar sus actividades.

loans.name: Allpaurccuna Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank Allpaurccuna, which means "From where does the Earth come" in Quechua, is dedicated to agriculture and the raising of animals, and many of the women in the village bank are dedicated to the purchase and sale of cochineal (a red dye that comes from a certain insect), tuna, and other products that they sell in the city of Ayacucho.

The members have different businesses such as selling tuna, cochineals, young animals, fertilizer, and other goods relating to agriculture.

The members of the bank need varying loan amounts totaling 5,700 soles. The loans will be invested in the purchase of tuna, cochineal, tara, young animals and fertilizer.

The dreams of the women are that their children will be professionals, their businesses will get better, and that they will continue to have good production on their ranches and farms.

loans.use: The loans will be invested in the purchase of tuna, cochineal, tara, young animals and fertilizer for agriculture.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva has been working in agriculture since she was a small child. Now that she is a mother and has an obligation to maintain the well-being of her household, she works more eagerly than ever at her familiar tasks. She wishes to improve her products, with this objective: to collaborate with her beloved children in the work of making their dreams reality.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Eva, desde pequeña ha estado vinculada con la labor agrícola, ahora que es madre y tiene la obligación de mantener el bienestar dentro del hogar, se dedica con más ahínco a sus labores acostumbradas y desea mejorar sus productos con el objetivo de colaborar con los sueños de sus amados hijos.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to improve her products.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
