Lucía has decided to invest the effort in developing the farmland she owns in her native community. Due to her strong commitment to her work she has not been able to start a family but she has the joy and support of her sisters and nieces to make every one of her days beautiful. The farmers of her area sow crops that are in high demand. For this reason she has decided to make an investment to increase her crop production, with the aim to increase her earnings, as well.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Lucía, ha decidido forjar con esfuerzo sus tierras de cultivo en su comunidad natal, debido a su inmenso compromiso con su trabajo aún no ha podido formar una familia pero cuenta con la alegría y apoyo de sus hermanas y sobrinas para hacer de cada uno de sus días los más hermosos. En su localidad siembran productos agrícolas de inmensa demanda y por esa razón ha decidido mejorar su siembra a fin de acrecentar también con esta nueva inversión sus ganancias.

loans.use: Injection of capital into her business in order to improve her production.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora is a hardworking mother of 4 small children. She works daily in crop production and livestock rearing in order to earn a living for her beloved family. She is very happy with the demand for her products, but is worried at the the same time. To meet all of her current demand, she urgently needs an investment of working capital. For this reason, she has come here looking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Teodora, es una trabajadora madre de cinco pequeños niños se dedica a diario tanto a la actividad agrícola como ganadera en beneficio de su amada familia. La demanda de sus productos la tienen muy contenta y también muy preocupada debido a que para complacerlas en su totalidad necesita de un incremento de capital de trabajo muy urgente y por esa razón recurre en búsqueda de vuestra ayuda.

loans.use: Injection of capital into her business in order to improve her agricultual production.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina decided many years ago to earn her living caring for her animals, always with a desire to increase the number of animals she owns while also improving her production of potatoes and ulloco, another root vegetable commonly consumed in Andean South America. Her efforts are always centered on sustaining her 4 minor children, who depend economically on her and her husband. With them in mind, she is now applying for a loan with which to meet her growth goals in livestock and crop production. You can support Celestina so that her wishes become reality.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Celestina, hace muchos años optó por dedicarse a las tareas del cuidado de sus animales con el deseo de incrementar la cantidad de ganado que posee y también de mejorar su producción de papa y de olluco, siempre sus esfuerzos están concentrados en sostener a sus 4 menores hijos que dependen económicamente de ella y su esposo, por ese motivo ahora solicita un préstamo para lograr el objetivo que se ha propuesto. Vosotros podéis apoyar a Celestina para que sus anhelos se conviertan en realidad.

loans.use: Injection of capital into her agricultural business.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria Cristina started her business to earn extra money and help her husband with the costs of educating their children. She wanted to try something different. She'd worked as an employee for different department stores, but when her children were born she had to stop her studies and her work to take care of them. She saw the opportunity to start a business which would allow her to make her own schedule and continue to care for the children, while earning an income which would help her with her complete her own education as well as care for her family.

In October 2006, her mother in law invited her to join a group promoting a line of natural products. Maria Cristina liked the products very much and was able to sell them easily, generating a good income for herself. She decided to dedicate herself to this work and since then things have been going well.

She is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 4 months, to increase her stock so she can meet the demand from her customers, grow her sales and increase her income.

María Cristina inició el negocio por el deseo de tener un ingreso extra que le permita seguir progresando económicamente y de esta forma ayudar a su esposo con la educación a sus darle a nuestros hijos. Ella deseaba probar algo diferente, ya que había trabajado como empleada general en diferentes tiendas departamentales, pero al nacer sus hijos tuvo que dejar de estudiar y de trabajar para atenderlos, y después se dio la oportunidad de emprender su negocio que le permitiera tener su propio horario sin desatender a sus hijos y al mismo tiempo obtener un ingreso para terminar sus estudios y también darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Comenzó en octubre de 2006 cuando su madrina la invitó a formar parte del grupo de promotoras que coordina y como le gustó mucho ya que los productos naturistas se venden con relatividad facilidad y deja muy buenas ganancias, decidió dedicarse a esto, hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $400 para pagara en 4 meses, para adquirir mas productos que le permita tener un mejor surtido para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes y así aumentar las ganancias.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE PRODUCTS, INCREASE HER STOCK TO MEET THE DEMANDS OF HER CUSTOMERS, AND GROW HER SALES AND HER INCOME.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdelena is a self-sacrificing mother who together with her beloved husband works daily to provide stability and well being for the family they love. Sales of her products have increased steadily over the years and the business has brought her much satisfaction. Now, thanks to the demand she is seeing from clients, she would like to improve her production in order to fulfill each and every order she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Magdalena, es una abnegada madre que junto a su amado esposo se esfuerza día a día para brindarle estabilidad y bienestar a su amada familia. Durante muchos años la comercialización de sus productos ha ido en aumento y le ha otorgado muchas satisfacciones ahora debido a la demanda de sus clientes desea mejorar su producción para cumplir con todas y cada una de las solicitudes de compra.

loans.use: Injection of capital into her business, allowing her to increase her production.

loans.name: Carmen's Group

texts.en:
Carmen, Sabina and Beatriz are all members of the Village Bank Marcela.

Carmen is 26 years old, lives with her boyfriend, and has one daughter who is just one year old. Sabina is 30 years old, lives with her boyfriend, and has three children. Beatriz is 25 years old, lives with her boyfriend, and has one new baby of three months.

These three women all have different businesses for which they use their loans from FINCA. Carmen has a business of selling meat in the market, which she has been doing for about a year. Sabina has a business of selling fruit in the market Magdalena, which she has been doing for one year. Beatriz has a store where she sells all different sorts of things including food and drink – she has had this business for about four years.

Sabina, Beatriz and Carmen need loans of 1000 soles, 400 soles, and 600 soles, respectively, with which they will buy more products (fruit, food and drink, and meat) to add to their businesses.

Sabina dreams of succeeding at her business and building her own house one day; Beatriz dreams of expanding her business; and Carmen dreams of having a big house and a store in which she can sell her meat.

loans.use: To buy more products (fruit, food and drink, and meat) to add to their businesses.

loans.name: Yossi

texts.es:
Yossi is a very talented woman whose creativity has led her to start an embroidery business in her small home. She starts work early in the morning each day. Her great and original finished pieces have brought her popularity, which is why there is a high demand for her work. Now she would like to increase her capital in order to fill her customers’ orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Yossi, es muy talentosa y su creatividad la ha conducido a implementar un espacio de bordados en su pequeña casita. Diariamente y desde muy tempranas horas se dedica a desarrollar esta actividad y sus grandes e ingeniosos acabados le han dado popularidad, por esa razón ha obtenido una gran demanda y ahora desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para cumplir con cada una de las solicitudes de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
From a young age, Hermelinda has always worked in the agricultural field. Even today, alongside her husband, she works in agriculture with the aim of providing well-being for their beloved children. She grows potatoes, ollucos (a South American root crop), corn, and broad beans. She also raises bulls in order to sell them. Her desire for progress motivates her daily, which is why she has decided to improve her business activities with the help of a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hermelinda, desde muy joven se dedica a las labores agropecuarias y ahora en compañía de su esposo con el objetivo de procurarles bienestar a sus amados hijos. Siembra papa, olluco, maíz y habas, además de engordar toros para su posterior venta.Su deseo de progreso la motiva a diario y por esa razón a decidido mejorar cada una de sus actividades con la inyección de un préstamo.

loans.use: Capital for improvement of agricultural activities

loans.name: Albina's Group

texts.en:
Victoria, Maximiliana, and Albina are members of the Village Bank Covadonga.

Albina is married, 36 years old, and has three children. Albina sells groceries in the Ayacuchan jungle, and distributes mainly to the stores, bringing peanuts and coco from the jungle and selling them in the city of Ayacucho.

Victoria is married, 40 years old, and has four children. Victoria sells vegetables at a stand that she rents in the Nery Garcia Market – a business she does every afternoon.

Maximiliana is a widow, 55 years old and has six children. Maximiliana sells food at the bridge in the city of Ayacucho, which she does every afternoon.

Victoria, Maximiliana and Albina need loans of 300 soles, 600 soles and 1500 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of onions, lemons, meat, pans, plates, coffee and peanuts.

Victoria, Maximiliana, and Albina's dreams are to build their businesses and to offer a good education to their children.

loans.use: To buy onions, lemons, meat, pans, plates, coffee and peanuts.

loans.name: Geny Del Rosario

texts.es:
Geny del Rosario took over her sister’s general store 3 years ago in order to generate income without having to leave her children unattended. She has two daughters, ages18 and 16, and two sons, ages 23 and 12. She wanted to help out with the family expenses. Because of her efforts, both her client base and the demand for her products have grown thanks to her great service.

She now needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase a greater quantity of goods and meet customer demand. With your help, Geny will reinforce her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Geny del Rosario inicio su tienda de abarrotes hace 3 años, ya que antes era de su hermana ella la adquirio para poder tener un ingreso sin dejar a sus hijos solos es madre de 2 mujeres que actualmente tienen 18 y 16, y de dos varones uno de 23 y uno de 12, ella deseaba contribuir con el gasto familiar, debido a su esfuerzo su clientela ha aumentado y la demanda de productos tambien gracias al buen servicio que les proporciona.

Ahora ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercancía para cubrir la demanda que tiene. Con tu ayuda Geny consolidara su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is a hard working mother who raises small animals in her home for a living in order to sell them. Thanks to her dedication, the animals reach the adequate size and are in high demand in her area. Customers make orders daily so that she can sell them the best animals. With the hope of making her work more efficient, she wishes to increase her capital. She would like to find her best ally in you.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

VICTORIA, es una trabajadora madre de familia que se dedica a criar animalitos en su domicilio para posteriormente comercializarlos, gracias a su dedicación estos alcanzan el tamaño adecuado y se han convertido en animalitos de gran demanda en su localidad, a diario le otorgan peticiones para que ella pueda otorgarles uno de sus mejores ejemplares. Con el deseo de continuar su labor de modo más eficiente desea incrementar su capital de trabajo y en vosotros desea obtener a su mejor aliado.

loans.use: Capital for raising animals

loans.name: Mayas San Juan Group

texts.en:
The women of the Mayas San Juan community formed a new group of about two weeks of age and are looking to receive their first loan. Most of these women either own a weaving business or a daily consumption store. The women of this group know one and other quite well from their San Juan La Laguna community and expressed determination to prove themselves to their families, their group members, and their microlenders. They were content with being part of a community of “united women without envy of each other” as Cecilia C. V. put it.

There was consensus that the loans were going to be easy to repay. These loans would allow them primarily to invest in their business for higher future profit. Most women in the weaving industry create guipiles and cortes, the traditional indigenous outfits, to sell in the upcoming June 23rd town fair. Seven of them needed funds to invest in their stores which they hoped to set up near the fair. With more products to sell at once, their profits can be much larger during the peak sales of the festive season. They organized this meeting early precisely because of their hopes to receive their loans before the fair.

Melchora Isabel C. owns a traditional clothing store which focuses on sales to tourists. Thanks to her credit, she has been able to produce enough textiles to sell to an intermediary American friend, who exports to the USA. She hires friends to maintain her production rate and allow her time to continue to study in hopes of achieving the equivalent of a high-school degree.

She, along with five others of this new group, stood out as confident role models who began six years ago with loans of 40 USD and are now receiving loans of up to 400 USD. Most of them are in leadership positions such as group president or secretary. Iris Yolanda I. began without any business whatsoever, and is now the proud owner and manager of a crafts and textile business. Cecilia C. now travels to well-known Antigua, Guatemala, to sell the hammocks she makes in large amounts with the help of the loans.

The primary vision that these dedicated businesswomen share is to provide their children with the clothing, food, and education necessary for them to “have it better off than they did as children” and to go on into their adult life with a head start, as Cecilia C. expressed. Alicia C. Y. emphasized the need for this type of individual effort aided by the loans to collectively help their entire town, region, and soon country, prosper.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of market items. Purchase threads and dyes for weaving larger quantities at once.

loans.name: Mario Alfonso

texts.es:
Mario Alfonso is a young man who has recently married. He learned how to make furniture in his job, and five years ago he decided to start his own business. From his home, he makes small pieces of furniture which he sells to people he knows. Thanks to his hard work, he and his wife are improving their quality of life. Although they don't yet have a family of their own, Mario wants to be able to provide a good life for their children one day, and that's why he works so hard.

He is requesting a loan, which he will repay in 3 months, so he can purchase the necessary materials to make more furniture and keep up with the demand of his customers. With your support, Mario can continue to grow his business and support his family.

Mario Alfonso, es un hombre joven que acaba de casarse, en su trabajo aprendió el oficio de fabricacion y tapicería para muebles, por ello al salir de su trabajo, hace 5 años decidio emprender el negocio por su cuenta, en su casa elabora pequeños muebles y sillones que vende entre sus conocidos, y gracias a esto ha podido sacar adelante a su esposa, ya que aun no tienen familia. el desea darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos cuado los tenga por eso se esfuerza en su negocio.

El solicita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses ya que la demanda de sus clientes ha aumentado y requiere comprar mas material para elaborar los muebles. Con tu apoyo Mario saldra adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIAL NEEDED TO MAKE THE FURNITURE HE SELLS, CONTINUE TO GROW HIS BUSINESS AND SUPPORT HIS FAMILY

loans.name: Leoncia's Group

texts.en:
Felicitas, Alejandra, and Leoncia are members of the Village Bank Huascahura.

Leoncia is married, 68 years old and has five children. Leoncia and her husband make handicrafts on the loom, such as tapestries, which they sell at the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

Felicitas is married, 36 years old and has three children. Felicitas sells meat, cheese and young animals from house to house. She buys the animals at the fairs and they are very beneficial to her.

Alejandra is married, 56 years old, and has seven children. Alejandra and her husband buy cattle from different towns around the region and sell them in the fair at Ayacucho.

Felicitas, Alejandra, and Leoncia need loans of 600 soles, 300 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of pigs, sheep, cows, thread and dye.

Felicitas, Alejandra, and Leoncia's dreams are to better their businesses and that their children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, sheep, cows, thread and dye.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia started her business to help with her family's household costs. Her husband's salary as a laborer in the fields was not enough to cover their expenses nor support their six children. She began her business by selling a small piece of land she'd inheritied and investing the money in a small clothing stand. Little by little she has grown the business and helped improve the quality of life for her family.

She is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase more merchandise and increase her sales.

Leticia inició el negocio para complementar el gasto familiar ya que con el sueldo de su esposo quien se dedica a labores del campo no les alcanzaba para los gastos del hogar ademas de la manutencion de su 6 hijos. Ella comenzó su negocio con el dinero de un terreno que le heredaron y que vendio, puso un pequeño puesto de ropa , mismo que ha ido creciendo poco a poco y es lo que le ha permitido darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y asi lograr impulsar sus ventas .

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS AND CONTINUE TO HELP SUPPORT HER FAMILY

loans.name: Maximiliana's Group

texts.en:
Mariela, Maximiliana, and Lucia belong to the Village Bank Huascahura.

Maximiliana lives with her boyfriend, is 34 years old and has three children. Maximiliana sells cereals in the Ayacuchan jungle – her sales are wholesale and she distributes to stores and also buys fruit from the jungle that she sells at the market in the city of Ayacucho.

Mariela lives with her boyfriend, is 19 years old, and has one child. Mariela sells various products such as cleaning articles and hooks. She sells these things on Sundays at the fair in the city of Huanta.

Lucia is married, 38 years old and has six children. Lucia weaves sweaters by hand and sells them to her neighbors as well as to people who order them from her. Lucia also buys baby chickens which she sells in the different towns of the region.

Mariela, Maximiliana, and Lucia need loans of 900 soles, 900 soles and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of toothpaste, asphalt, brushes, detergent, beans wheat, barley and chicken.

Mariela, Maximiliana and Lucia dream of having a mototaxi, building their own houses, and that their children complete their studies.

loans.use: To purchase toothpaste, asphalt, brushes, detergent, beans wheat, barley and chicken.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Village Bank Ollantay. She is married, 69 years old and has four children. She lives with her husband and a grandchild who is eight years old and is under her care.

Elena and her husband sell clothes. Her husband travels daily while she travels twice a week to the fairs. They buy their products in Lima. Elena has a car that allows her to drive to the city.

Elena needs a loan of 3000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of coats, blouses, skirts, and sweaters.

Elena's dreams are to buy another car, build a house and save enough money for her grandchild.

loans.use: Elena needs a loan of 3000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of coats, blouses, skirts and sweaters.

loans.name: Carmela's Group

texts.en:
Josefina, Rocio and Carmela are members of the Village Bank Stars.

Josefina is separated, 73 years old and has four children. Josefina sells food at the Nery García market and also sells cheese to institutions on credit.

Rocío is a single mother, 35 years old and has four children. Rocío sells porridge in the center of the city of Ayacucho. She also has a small locksmith workshop in her house, where she works with the help of another person. Roció is also a singer of Peruvian music.

Carmela is married, 42 years old and has four children. Carmela sells spices and chopped vegetables in the Magdalena market.

Josefina, Rocío and Carmela need loans of 800 soles, 800 soles, and 1000 soles respectively, money which will be invested in the purchase of cheese, sugar, corn, ají peppers, and a cutting machine.

The dreams of Josefina, Rocio and Carmela are to buy a refrigerator to begin a new business, have a place in the center of the city, make a CD, better their homes and that their children become professionals.

loans.use: Josefina, Rocío and Carmela need loans to purchase cheese, sugar, corn, ají peppers, and a cutting machine.

loans.name: Miriam Sonia's Group

texts.en:
Teofila, Miriam, and Robertina are members of the Village Bank Estrella.

Teofila is married, 56 years old and has five children. Teofila travels to the different fairs of the region where she buys cereals and sells them at the Nery García market. She is also dedicated to raising young animals.

Miriam lives with her boyfriend, is 36 years old and has two children. Miriam sells aggregates - such as sand, concrete, and cement - to people and brings them to their homes by the use of a dump truck. She is also dedicated to the production of gypsum.

Robertina lives with her boyfriend, is 30 years old and has four children. Robertina sells fruits at the market Las Américas. Robertina is also going to begin selling salchipapas and other food from the door of her home.

Teofila, Miriam and Robertina need loans of 400 soles, 1400 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of barley, wheat, gypsum, and various fruits and to cancel the rental of a stand.

Teofila, Miriam and Robertina´s dreams are to build their businesses, buy a car, better their quality of life, and to have other businesses.

loans.use: Teofila, Miriam and Robertina need loans of 400 soles, 1400 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of barley, wheat, gypsum, and various fruits.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva began her business because she needed to help her husband with the monthly expenses and the support of the children. Five years ago, she opened a small general store at the entrance to her house, adding a plastic roof, and little by little stocking the store, eventually she put up a concrete roof for more comfort and security.

She is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 6 months, to stock more merchandise as she is running low. She also needs to purchase more seasonal goods, as people buy a lot of cold drinks, ice and other things to help with the heat of summer. With your support she will be able to continue to grow her business.

Eva inició el negocio ya que tenia la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que a el le pagaban cada 15 dias y por los niños necesitaba dinero antes y no tenian por lo que vieron la posibilidad de abrir un negocio ya que a este puede generar ganancias diario y asi poder cubrir los gastos que iban saliendo todos los dias. Comenzó con la tienda de abarraotes hace 5 años le ha funcionado, desde aquel entonces adapto la entrada de su casa con techo de lamina y alli instalo la tienda, despues poco a poco fue surtiendo mas al negocio y ahora ya le puse el techo de concreto para mayor comodidad y seguridad.

Sin embargo, ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses par suritr de mercancia la tiendita ya que se le acabo y casi no tiene nada, ademas de que necesita surtir con mercancia de temporada porque la gente compra mucho refresco, hielo y cosas para mitigar el calor. Con tu apoyo Eva podra consolidar su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO STOCK HER SMALL GENERAL STORE AND PURCHASE SEASONAL GOODS FOR THE SUMMER.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel is 41 years old, married and runs a tailoring business making typical garments for women. His shop is located in the village of Nimasac in Totonicapán, Guatemala. He started working at a tailor in 2002 thanks to knowledge he gained from working under boss Julio Rosales at another store. As time passed he took the initiative to put into practice all that he had learned and started his small shop, which has now grown thanks to the demand for his products. However, he has been unable to meet this demand due to lack of capital, which is why he sought the help of Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR. With the loan he will be able to purchase raw materials needed to make his products and satisfy his customers’ demands and be able to generate more earnings as well.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Don Manuel tiene actualmente 41 años de edad, es Casado, de oficios Tejedor "Elaboración de cortes Típicos" para Mujeres, su taller se encuentra ubicado en el Caserío Xetinimit, de la Aldea Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, el empezó a trabajar en el año 2, 002 como tejedor gracias al conocimiento que adquirió a través de su patrón, ya que el solamente era un empleado del señor Julio Rosales conforme paso el tiempo tuvo la iniciativa de comenzar a poner en práctica lo aprendido, comenzó su pequeño taller de elaboración de cortes típicos, en donde actualmente el taller a crecido ahora cuenta con una demanda de cortes típicos, la cual el no puede cubrir, por la falta de capital de trabajo por esa razón se vio en la necesidad de acudir a solicitar un crédito en la Asociación ASDIR, con el crédito a financiar podrá comprar la materia prima que necesita para poder cubrir la demanda de la clientela, de esa manera podrá generar mejores ganancias como también satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for tailoring shop / Capital de Trabajo, Compra de Materia Prima

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel is 32 years old and married. His business is located in his home in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, Sololá, Guatemala, and thanks to his efforts to get ahead and his positive attitude in the community he is now a well known and appreciated merchant in his area. Previously he had been a farm hand, working in the fields for different people, and with his hard work he was able to purchase land and cultivate bananas and coffee. Thanks to his harvests he's been able to start a small business buying and selling bananas and coffee, but he does not have the necessary capital at the moment to continue the business. For that reason he came to the offices of Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR to request a loan so he will be better able to serve his customers and differentiate from the competition. He only wants to continue growing his business and to be able to improve the quality of life for his family. His business currently employs two workers, so it can improve the quality of their families' lives as well.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Don Manuel tiene actualmente 32 años de edad, es Casado, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en la Aldea Chuisanto Tomás, del municipio de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, departamento de Sololá, y gracias a sus esfuerzos para seguir adelante y su actitud positiva en la comunidad ahora ya es un comerciante muy conocido y apreciado en la Aldea, ya que antes era un jornalero para realizar trabajos de campo con diferentes personas en la aldea, y con sus esfuerzos para seguir adelante consiguió comprar terreno y los cultivó de banano y café, gracias a sus cosechas que recibe de parte de su terreno logró iniciar un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de banano y café, por tal razón que no cuenta con el capital necesario para seguir dicho negocio se vio en la necesidad de acudir en las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR, para poder dar una mejor atención a la clientela y así poder hacer diferencia con la competencia, y solo así poder seguir creciendo en su negocio y poder dar mejores condiciones de vida para su familia. Actualmente cuenta con 2 empleados en su negocio de compra de banano y café la cual ha generado oportunidades de trabajo, como también a que la familias de los empleados tengan una mejor condición de vida.

loans.use: Buying and selling of bananas and coffee / Capital de trabajo, Compra y Venta de banano y café

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Lài is 43 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 2002. Her family main income is from farming and raising pigs. Right from beginning, she and her family invested all her loans in raising pigs. They started small. Round after round of loans, their operations had expanded. They have rebuilt the pig pen and the whole installation. Today they have 20 pigs, each weighing 40-50 kg. Their living condition has improved markedly. They are able to buy all the necessary goods for the household. Mrs Lài has 3 children: 2 are still in school and the oldest one is working making 1.500.000 VND a month. Her family income is 3.500.000 VND a month. This time she is requesting 16.000.000 VND to continue investing in her pig raising business

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lài 43 tuổi , tham gia Quỹ năm 2002, nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình là nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi, từ khi tham gia Quỹ cho đến nay các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị chủ yếu tập chung vào chăn nuôi lợn thịt, từ những năm đầu với vòng vốn nhỏ gia đình chị chỉ chăn nuôi với mô hình nhỏ, các vòng vốn của Quỹ được tăng dần theo hàng năm, việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị cũng được mở rộng hơn, chuồng trại của gia đình cũng được tu sửa hiện nay gia đình chị đang co 20 con lợn từ 40kg đến 50kg, việc đầu tư vào chăn nuôi của gia đình chị rất thuận lợi kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình, chị có 3 con, 2 con đang ở độ tuôi đi học, 1 con đã đi làm và thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 16.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình: 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị A. is 40 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 2002. Together with her husband, Nguyễn Đình Lộc ( 42 years old), they decided to participate in TYM program to improve their lives. They invested all their loans in breeding cows and raising pigs for meat. They are successful in their business. Their income from this business is quite stable. They always have 10-15 pigs in the stable. Right now, there is a batch of 10 pigs to be sold imminently, there are also 10 piglets to replace that batch of pigs. They have 3 children, 2 of them are still in school. The oldest one is working, making 1.500.000 VND a month. This time Mrs A. is requesting 13.000.000 VND. Their income is 3.000.000 VND a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2002, chị Nguyễn Thị A. 40 tuổi cùng chồng là anh Nguyễn Đình Lộc 42 tuổi, mạnh giạn tham gia Quỹ để phát triển kính tế, với số tiền vay cảu Quỹ qua các vòng vốn gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bò sinh sản và lợn thịt. Dự án chăn nuôi này của gia đình anh chị rất hiệu quả, cứ đều đặn hàng năm gia đình chị lại thu nhập từ bò sinh sản, chăn nuôi lợn với mô hình rất lớn trong chuồng luôn luôn có từ 10-> 15 con lợn. Hiện tại gia đình chi đA. có 10 con lợn chờ xuất chuồng và 10 con lợn bột, gia đình chị co 3 con, 2 con còn đang đi học, 1 con đi làm thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 13.000.000đ. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình: 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising pigs and cows

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan N. is a farmer in Ping Pong Village, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. In addition to farming, Mrs. Nan N. sews palm leaves and sells them for a profit. Her husband, Mr. Nhouch Loeurng, is a recycling collector. Mrs. Nan N. is 25 and the mother of one child, who is too young to work or study.

Although Mrs. Nan N. has two businesses, she cannot support her family well. Thus, Mrs. Nan N. needs to start a cow breeding business in order to improve her living conditions. Mrs. Nan N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise.

Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Vuong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vuong Thi N., 51 years old, is one of the first members of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in her cluster. She fully understands the importance of TYM Fund. Mrs. N. has 6 children. FIve of them got married and moved out. Mrs. N. was able to provide all of her children good financial support before they moved out. Her youngest child, who is still going to school, still lives with Mrs. N. and her husband. Mrs N. has always used her loan to breed pigs. At the beginnings, she only raise pigs to breed. Later on, she has more profit and she decides to also raise pigs to sell for meat. At the moment, her family has two breeding pigs and 20 piglets. She is applying for a loan of 925 USD to expand her farm. On average, her family earns 188 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vương Thị Nghĩa 51 tuổi, là những thành viện đầu tiên tham gia cụm, nên chị nhận thức rất rõ lợi ích khi tham gia vào Quỹ, chị sinh được 6 người con, 5 con đã được chị xây dựng gia đình và cho ra ở riêng, các con chị khi ra ở riêng đều được chị làm cho 1 cơ ngơi rất khang trang, 1 con đang sống cùng vợ chồng anh chị và con đang đi học, các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn nái, ban đầu gia đình chị chỉ chăn nuôi lợn nái, nhung qua các vòng vốn việc chăn nuôi co thu nhập, và dần dần gia đình chị tiêp tục đầu tư thêm vao chăn nuôi lợn thịt, hiện tai gia đình chị đang có 2 con lợn nái và 20 con lợn con. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình. 3000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Võ Thị Tịnh, 40 years old, joined TYM Fund in 2001. She has six children and they are all school-aged. When she joined the fund, she made plans with her husband, Nguyễn Văn Đức, to borrow capital and put it towards raising female pigs. The family's animal rearing business was advantageous for them. They gained experience on raising pigs.

In the beginning, they only raised one deer and two female pigs. They have been able to expand their animal rearing business to include ducks. With three hundred egg-laying ducks, their income increased to an average of 300,000 per day. Their income was steady such that they repaid the loan completely without a hitch.

For this round of loans, they are seeking 18,000,000 VND to put more towards raising pigs and ducks. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Võ Thị Tịnh 40 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2001, khi tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn chị đã mạnh giạn bàn bạc cùng với chồng là anh Nguyễn Văn Đức, vay vốn của Quỹ về đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn nái, việc chăn nuôi của gia đình anh chị diễn ra thuận lợi, kinh nghiệm về chăn nuôi lợn nái của anh chị được tích lũy, từ ban đầu chỉ nuôi 1 con nay gia đình anh chị đã có 2 con lợn nái và anh chị cũng đã mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi đầu tư vào nuôi vịt đẻ, với 300 con vịt đẻ thì thu nhập của gia đinh anh chị đã tăng lên bình quân mỗi ngày 300.000đ . Mức thu nhập đều đặn này viêc trả vốn vay gia đình chị hoàn toàn không gặp khó khăn, chị có 6 con và các cháu đang ở độ tuổi ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 18.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và vịt đẻ. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To raise pigs and ducks.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn S. lives in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a middle(wo)man who buys bitter melons from villagers and resells them for a profit. Mrs. Phorn S.’s business has improved, so she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Phorn S. is requesting a loan to buy more bitter melons to sell.

Her husband, Mr. Soy Sun, is a construction worker. Mrs. Phorn S. has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while three others attend school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Phorn S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding. Last year, one of her children got malaria and she spent $125 to have her cured. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more bitter melons to sell for a profit.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hương - 37 years old - joined the fund in 2003. She is a dynamic and agile woman. Her family has had success putting loans to use. They have put all past loans towards their business renting canvas backdrops, furniture and flatware to families hosting large events. Their customers consist of people in their community. Their business is steady. For every rental, the family brings in from 300,000 to 400,000 VND. With their investment knowledge and progressive business style, they change their rental materials regularly to suit the community's taste and therefore the business has been fruitful for them.

She has three children that are still in school. They would like to raise 19,000,000 VND to continue their event equipment rental business. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương 37 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, Chị là nguời phụ nữ năng động và nhanh nhẹn. Gia đình chị đã biết sử dụng đồng vốn hiệu quả, các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ đềui được gia đình chị đầu tư vào dịch vụ cho thuê phông bạt, bàn ghế, bát đĩa phục vụ các gia đình có công việc lớn, khách hàng của gia đình anh chị là các nhà dân ở quanh xã, cômg việc rất đều đặn bình quân mồi 1 lần cho thuê gia đình chị thu từ 300.000đ->400.000đ. Biết cách đầu tư và luôn phát triển theo xã hôi nên các đồ gia đình anh chị cho thuê thường xuyên được thay đổi nhằm đáp ứng được nhu cầu của người dân quanh địa phương, nên việc kinh doanh dich vụ này rất thuận lợi với gia đình chị. Chi có 3 con vẫn đang đi học. Vòng vốn nay gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ tiếp tục kinh doanh dich vụ cho thuê phông bạt, bàn ghế, bát đĩa. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To invest in event equipment rental business.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom C. is a villager in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She sells clothing and would like to request a loan to buy more fashionable clothes for her customers in order to expand her business. She will combine the rest of the money with her business profits and buy cow for breeding.

Mrs. Rom C. is a widow with two children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the other is enrolled in school.

loans.use: To buy more fashionable clothes to sell and to buy cow for breeding.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 30 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2003, is a skillful woman. Realizing her ability, she chose to become a tailor. Joining the Fund, she used the borrowed money in buying fabric material. Currently, she is owning a tailor shop. Her customers are very satisfied with her products. They come to her shop very often, especially youths. She is famous not only locally but is well-known to people in town as well. She is having a stable income, of 200 USD/ month. She has 2 children who are still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 725 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhật 30 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003, là người phụ nữ khéo tay hay làm. Chị đã nhận thấy những điểm mạnh của mình nên ngày từ khi chưa lấy chồng chị đã lựa chọn cho mình một nghề phù hợp đó là nghề may, tham gia vào Quỹ và tích cực vay vốn, các vòng vốn vay chị đều đầu tư vào mua vải. Hiện nay chị đã có một của hàng may quần áo tại nhà, với bản chất kheo tay sẵn có nên các sảm phẩm chị may đều được khách hàng hài lòng, khách hàng đến của hàng may của chị rất đông, đặc biệt là ở các lứa tuổi thanh niên, không chỉ là các khách hàng ở trong xã chị biết đến mà thậm chí cả những khách hàng ngoài xã cũng tìm đến cửa hàng chị để may. Với việc làm ăn như vậy kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định, chị co 2 con đang ở độ tuổi đi học. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 12.000.000đ. Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Tailoring

loans.name: Nhean

texts.en:
Mr. Nhean S. is a subsistence farmer in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. In addition to farming, he has a business collecting recyclable material. Her wife, Mrs. Phat Ny, is a grocer in the local market. Mrs Ny wants to expand her business, so Mr. Nhean S. has decided to as for a loan to buy more groceries for his wife's business.

Mr. Nhean S. is 30 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or attend school. Previously, Mr. Nhean S. obtained a loan from AMK to start his wife's business. His wife appears on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for his wife's business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 39 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2002. Her family income is mostly used in agriculturing and breeding animals. Since joining the Fund, she used the borrowed money in breeding pigs and planting vegetables. These activities help improving her family economy. She furnishes her house, improves her living conditions. She has 6 children and all of them are going to school. Her family realizes that investing in breeding pigs and planting vegetables is very effective. Therefore, she wants to borrow 550 USD this time to invest in the same project. Her average income is approximately 150 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị L. 39 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2002, nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị chủ yếu chông vào nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi, khi tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và chồng mầu, từ việc kinh doanh này kinh tế gia đình chị đã thay đổi theo hàng năm, gia đình chị đã mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình, đời sống hàng ngày được cải thiện, chị có 6 người con va các con chị đều được chị đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ. Gia đình chị nhận thấy việc đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn và chồng hoa mầu là hiệu quả nên vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000đ vẫn đầu tư vào dự án trên. Thu nhập bình quân.2.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: breeding pigs and planting vegetables

loans.name: Saory

texts.en:
Mrs. Saory R. is a middle(wo)man in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Saron Prak, is a recycle collector. Mrs. Saory R. would like to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy more bitter melons to sell for a profit. With the rest of the money, Mrs. Saory R. would like to invest in her husband's business.

Mrs. Saory R. is 27 and the mother of two children. One attends school while the other is too young. Previously, Mrs. Saory R. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a motorbike to start her husband's business. Last year, her youngest child got dengue fever and Mrs. Saory R. spent a considerable sum to have her cured.

Mrs. Saory R.'s husband appears in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: To buy more bitter melons and to invest with her husband business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 40 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2004. Living in a rural area with agricultural tradition, Mr. Nguyen Kham Hoa, her husband, always encouraged her to used borrowed money to improve family economy. At first, she used 200 USD in breeding pigs. Their advantage was that they had a big yard. Since breeding pigs, she saved a small area of her yard for gardening, planting a variety of vegetables. Therefore, they did not have to spend too much money in feeding the pigs. Seeing that combining breeding and gardening is very productive, they spend time in doing those. Mrs. T. has 5 children, 4 of whom are going to school. Her oldest child is working and earns 100 USD/month. This time, she wants to borrow 625 USD to invest in breeding pigs. Her average income is 200 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thảo 40 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004, xuất thân từ một vùng thuần túy làm nông nghiệp, khi tham gia vào Quỹ chồng chị anh Nguyễn khâm Hóa luôn động viện chị vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế gia đình, năm đầu tiên vay vốn gia đình anh chị xin vay 3.000.000đ với mức vốn ban đầu anh chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, thuận lợi cho gia đình chị khi chăn nuôi là nhà chị có vườn rất rộng, từ khi đầu tư vào chăn nuôi chi đã dành một diện tích nho nhỏ của mảnh vườn nhà mình để chồng những loại rau làm thức ăn cho lợn, với viêc gia đình chị chồng được rau cho nên việc chí phí đầu tư vào nuôi lợn của gia đình chị là rất ít. Nhận thấy việc chăn nuôi kết hợp với làm vườn là hiệu quả nên gia đình anh chị đầu tư nhiều thời gian vào dự án của mình, chi có 5 con, 4 con còn đang đi học,1 con lớn nhà chị đã có công ăn việc làm thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 10.000.000đ. dầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân.3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: breeding pigs

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ho Thi H., 50 years old, joined the Fund since 2004. Since joining the TYM Fund, her family economy experiences improvements by opening a local drink station. She regularly borrows money from the Fund. She has 2 children and both of them are building their own families and one of them is living seperately. Her children work and earn approximately 200 USD/month. She earns 3-4 USD/ day. Because of stable income, repaying weekly is not very problematic for her. This time she wants to borrow 725 USD to expand her drink service. Her average income is 225 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hồ Thị Hợp 50 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004, từ khi tham gia vào Quỹ Kinh tế gia đình chị đã có nhiều thay đổi, với việc kinh doanh hàng giải khát tại địa phương gia đình chị vay các vòng vốn của Quỹ rất đều đặn, Chị có 2 con và 2 con chị đều đã xây dựng gia đình và 1 con đã ở riêng, hiện nay vợ chồng chị đang sống cùng 1 người con, con chị cũng đi làm và thu nhập bình quân 2.000.000đ/ tháng, chị bán hàng giải khát tại địa phương cho thu nhập đều đăn bình quân 50.000đ/ ngày. Với thu nhập đều đăn này thì việc hoàn trả vốn của gia đinh chị là không mấy khó khăn. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 12.000.000đ tiếp tục mở rộng mặt hàng giải khát. Thu nhập bình quân: 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Drink service

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Phoeurn S. is a villager in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She sells fruit. She is now in poor condition, because she has only one business. Mrs. Phoeurn S. wants to start a grocery business, so she has asked for a loan to buy groceries to sell in her fruit store in order to improve her living conditions. Mrs. Phoeurn S. is a widow with no children.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell in her fruit store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi P., 28 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2005. Despite her young age, she is very enthusiastic in business. Seeing that investing in food service in her area is of great advantage, she and her husband decided to open a local restaurant. At first, because of small amount of fund, she didn’t have a profound menu and as a result, she did not have too many customers. After joining the Fund, she used the borrowed money to invest in her restaurant, enriching her menu, and satisfying her customers. Her business is growing very well. She has 2 children, one of whom is going to school. This time she wants to borrow 500 USD to invest more in her restaurant. Her average income is approximately 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Phương 28 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2005, mặc dù tuổi đời còn rất trẻ nhưng trong làm ăn chị rất mạnh giạn, nhân thấy việc kinh doanh ăn uống tại địa phương là sẽ thuận lợi, chị đã bàn bạc cùng chồng là anh Nguyễn Hoàng Lai mở của hàng ăn uống tại đia phương, lúc đầu khi mở cửa hàng do vốn của gia đình chị còn ít nên một số hàng ăn của gia đình chị chưa phong phú nên số khách hàng đến quán của gia đình chị vẫn còn ít, khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã vay vốn đầu tư thêm vào các mặt hàng tại quán, các vòng vốn tiếp theo cũng vậy gia đình chị vẫn tiếp tục đầu tư vào quán ăn, với việc có vốn các mặt hàng ăn tại quán của chị đã đa dạng và phong phú hơn, đáp ứng được nhu cầu khách hàng. Khách hàng đến quán của gia đình chị ngày càng đông, việc kinh doanh hàng ăn của gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, chị có 2 con, 1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 8.000.000đ đầu tư vào quán ăn. Thu nhập bình quân. 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Restaurant business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. L. Thi Tran, 26 years old, joined the Fund in 2002. She is very quick-minded and clever, which led her to the observation that her town does not yet have a salon or a wedding gown rental shop. In order to get this service the people have to travel to the bigger town. From this realization, she discussed her plans with her husband to go study cosmetology. After gaining the necessary knowledge and training in this field, she and her husband were determined to invest some money in opening a salon, with the advantage of being right in town and accessible to the local townspeople. After a short time her salon had become the destination for many brides and grooms in town. As the business grew, their salon also expanded in size. She has one child who is still in school. In this round of funding her family is requesting 15,000,000 VND to continue investing in the salon. Their average income is 3,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị trần Thị Liên 26 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002, nhanh nhẹn và khéo léo đó là những yếu tố quyết định sự lựa chon nghề nghiệp của chị, thấy rằng trên địa bàn xã nhà chưa có hiệu trang điểm và cho thuê áo cưới, với dịch vụ này khi co nhu cầu người dân ở xã phải lên tận huyên mới có, xuất phát từ đó chị đã bàn bạc cùng chồng thống nhất chị đi học trang điểm, khi đã có kiến thức trong tay chị cùng anh quyết định mở của hiệu tại nhà. Tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn gia đình chị đều đầu tư vốn vào cửa hiệu, với lợi thế ngay trên địa bàn chẳng mấy chốc cửa hiệu của chị đã là nơi đến của bao cô dâu chú dể các địa phương quanh xã . Việc làm ăn ngày càng phát triển, cửa hiệu của chị cũng được mở rộng hơn, chị có 1 con và con chị đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào cửa hiệu. Thu nhập bình quân: 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in expanding salon

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov C. is a subsistence farmer in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Her business now faces small problem because Mrs. Pov C. has insufficient draft animals Thus, Mrs. Pov C. asked a loan to buy one more cow to work with the cow she has now. Her husband, Mr. Mom Suon, is a bed maker.

Mrs. Pov C. is 32 years old and the mother of four children. One is employed in a garment factory. Two others attend school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Pov C. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a pig for breeding. Last year, one of Mrs. Pov C.’s children got dengue fever and she spent $75 to have her cured. Her husband appears on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to use as a draft animal

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Q. Thi Duong, 47 years old, joined the Fun in 2003. Prior to joining, her family’s main income was from farming and working the fields; after joining the Fund, she planned with her husband to open a restaurant. Their restaurant has a large variety of dishes with reasonable prices. They are open all day; in the morning they only serve hot soups like porridge and beef noodle, and in the afternoon they serve rice dishes and other small plates. With this good service, the restaurant receives many customers. She has 3 children, 2 of which are grown, and 1 still in school. Her family’s finances are now very stable. In this round of funding her family is requesting 14,000,000 VND. Their average income is 3,500,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Quyết 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, những năm về trước nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị chủ yếu tập chung vào nông nghiệp, khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị được vay vốn, chi đã bàn bạc cùng chồng mở quán ăn, Quán ăn của gia đình chị với nhiều món ăn đa dạng giá cả hợp lý, phục vụ cả ngày, buổi sáng chị bán các đồ ăn sáng như cháo, phở, buổi trưa gia đình chị bán hàng cơm và các đồ nhậu. Với những điểm như vậy nên khách hàng đến quán ăn nhà chị rất đông, chị có 3 con, 2 con lớn đã trưởng thành, 1 con đang đi học kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn.Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 14.000.000đ. Thu nhập bình quân. 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Mrs. Khon H., 27, is a middle(wo)man who buys bitter melon to resell in the local market in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Soeurng Chrum, is a construction worker and farmer. Although Mrs. Khon H.’s family members have different business activities, they are still in poor condition. Thus, Mrs. Khon H. would like to start a cow breeding business.

Mrs. Khon H. has asked for a loan to buy a cow. Previously, Mrs. Khon H. obtained a loan to buy bitter melons to sell for a profit. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for a breeding business.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha P. lives in Ping P. Village in KamP. Speu Province, Cambodia. She is currently employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Somaly Kim, is a construction worker and pig breeder. Mr. Somaly Kim’s pig breeding business has improved, so he would like to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Sokha P. is requesting a loan to buy more pigs for her husband's business.

Mrs. Sokha P. is 25 years old and is the mother of a child who is too young to work or attend school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for her husband's business.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Mr. Khon K. is a subsistence farmer in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. In addition to his farming, he is a construction worker. Mr. Khon Khutl’s plantation business now has a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy the cows that he needs to plow his rice field. Thus, Mr. Khon K. asked for a loan to buy two cows.

Mr. Khon K. is 38 years old and the father of five children, four of whom attend school while the youngest one is too young to work or enroll in school. His wife, Mrs. Kan Vich, is a farmer. Previously, Mr. Khon K. obtained a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborer to plow his rice field. Last year, two of Mr. Khon K.’s children got lung disease and dengue fever, so Mr. Khon K. spent $125 to have them cured. His wife and his daughter appear with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows to plow his rice field

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thu Thi Vu is 48 years old and has 3 adult children. In times past her family was having many difficulties with their finances. In 2000, she joined the Fund to build a business and create jobs to improve her family’s finances. After 8 years of using the Fund, thanks to her hard work and clever business skills in utilizing the loan successfully, her family is becoming more stable and growing day by day. In this round of funding Mrs. Vu is requesting 10,000,000 VND to invest in more stock to serve the people of the town. The family’s average income is 3,000,000 a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Thục năm nay 48 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con hiện đã trưởng thành. Trước đây kinh tế gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương và vay vốn đầu tư vào buôn bán tạo công ăn việc làm và tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Sau 8 năm tham gia vào Quỹ, nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn ,biết cách tính toán sử dụng vốn có hiệu quả kinh tế gia đình chị Thục đã ngày càng ổn định và phát triển. Vòng vốn này chị Thục mong muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư vào mua thêm hàng hóa phục vụ nhân dân trong thôn, xã. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình: 3000000/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy more stock goods

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim C. is a villager in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is currently employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Rom Roeurng, collects recyclables and is a farmer. Mrs. Sim C. is 33 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom work in a garment factory while the remaining three attend school.

Even though the family members have different business activities, they are still in poor condition. Thus, Mrs. Sim C. would like to start a cow breeding business. She asked for a loan to buy a cow. Previously, Mrs. Sim C. obtained a loan to buy a pig to raise. Last year, her husband, Mr. Rom Roeurng, got high blood pressure and Mrs. Sim C. spent $750 to have him cured. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for a breeding business.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. T. Thi Tran has been a participant with the Fund since 2000. Before joining the Fund the family’s income depended mainly on working the fields. After joining the Fund, Ms. Tran has discussed with her family regarding using the loans to invest in retail businesses and opening a restaurant to serve the people in the neighborhood. Ms. T.’s house is in the center of the town, so she has many advantages in business endeavors. Everyday her husband goes to buy food from large retailers for her resell and serve the customers. Thanks to her husband’s help and her determination, the business has improved and become more stable day by day. Since receiving more income from the business, she has saved up money and built a nice 2-story house and bought some other conveniences for the family. In this round of funding Ms. Tran would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest more in the store to better serve the customers, increase profit, improve the family’s income, and provide for her two children to attend school. The family’s income is about 3,500,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Thủy là thành viên của Quỹ tình Thương từ năm 2000. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu là từ làm ruộng. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ, chị Thủy đã bàn bạc với gia đình vay vốn để đầu tư vào việc buôn bán, mở hàng ăn phục vụ bà con trong xã. Nhà Chị Thủy nằm ở Trung tâm xã do vậy chị gặp rất nhiều thuận lợi trong kinh doanh. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi mua đồ ăn từ các đại lý về để chị chế biến bán cho khách hàng. Nhờ có sự giúp đỡ của chồng và bản chất chịu thương chịu khó của người phụ nữ công việc làm ăn của chị đã ngày càng ổn định hơn. Từ khi có thêm thu nhập từ công việc buôn bán chị đã tiết kiệm và xây được ngôi nhà hai tầng khang trang và mua sắm thêm một số tiện nghi trong gia đình. Vòng vốn này Chị Thủy muốn vay 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng nhằm phục vụ khách hàng tốt hơn để tăng thu nhập, phát triển kinh tế gia đình, đầu tư cho 2 con ăn học. Thu nhập 3.500.000/ tháng

loans.use: expand store

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Vu, 31 years old, has been participating in the Fund for 9 years. Before joining the Fund she worked in the fields like many other women in the region. In 1999, she started planning with her husband to join the Fund for seed money to go into business and improve their family’s finances. Everyday her husband uses the money borrowed to go buy baby pigs in town and surrounding areas to sell to retailers with freezers. Mrs. Vu buys wheat from farmers and resell it to processors who grind the wheat. In the first few funding rounds, since they were new to their respective businesses, the couple only borrowed a small amount. After some time the couple became familiar with their businesses and bravely increased their loan amounts. The businesses have increased the family’s income day by day; currently the family’s income ranges from 3,500,000 VND to 4,500,000 VND per month. Thanks to this improvement the children are better off in their daily lives and their schooling. Mrs. Vu would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy more stock for her business without having to pay a high interest rate with credit.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Tuyết năm nay 31 tuổi và đã tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương được 9 năm.Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị chỉ làm ruộng như bao người phụ nữ khác tại địa phương. Năm 1999 chị đã bàn bạc với chồng tham gia vào quỹ tình thương vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Hàng ngày chồng chị đã sử dụng vốn để đi mua lợn con trong xã và các vùng lân cận về bán cho các nhà máy đông lạnh, chị Tuyết đi thu mua lúa của nhân dân về bán cho các đại lý say sát gạo .Những vòng vốn đầu do mới làm quen với công việc buôn bán nên anh chị chỉ dám vay mức vốn nhỏ. Sau một thời gian anh chị thấy công việc buôn bán đã quen dần và thấy cách hoàn trả theo tuần của Quỹ rất phù hợp vì thế anh chị đã mạnh dạn vay mức vốn lớn hơn.Với công việc buôn bán hàng ngày thu nhập của gia đình chị đã tăng dần, hiện nay thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt từ 3500000 đến 4500000 đ/ tháng. Nhờ đó các con của chị đã được đầu tư hơn trong cuộc sống và học tập. Chị Tuyết mong muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư thêm vốn để đi mua hàng không phải mua chịu với giá cao.

loans.use: Business, Resale

loans.name: Dung Dinh

texts.vi:
Mr. Dung Dinh N., 50 years old, is borrowing 2,478,000 VND to buy pigs to raise. He has been participated in one round of funding and has finished the repayment. Besides raising livestock, his family also grow flowers and his children sell goods at the market. The family’s income is 110,000 VND per month. Ms. Vien Thi N. is borrowing 2,006,000 VND to buy chickens and pigs. Ms. Bang Thi N. is borrowing 2,006,000 VND to buy pigs. Ms. Hoa Thi N. is borrowing 2,600,000 VND to buy chickens to raise and sell. Ms. Hien Thi N. is borrowing 2,600,000 VND to raise pigs. The total for the group is 10,502,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

Chú Nguyễn Đình Dũng (MS: 020027), năm nay 50 tuổi. Chú vay 2.478.000 VND về mua lợn chăn nuôi. Chú đã tham gia được 1 chu kỳ vay vốn và đã hoàn trả xong. Ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chú còn trồng hoa màu, con chú bán hàng ở chợ. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chú là 110.000 VND/ ngày. Chị Nghiêm Thị Viên (MS: 020029), vay 2.006.000 VND về chăn nuôi gà, lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Bang (MS: 020030), vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 020061), vay 2.006.000 VND để nuôi gà thịt. Chị Nguyễn Thị Huyền (MS: 020062), vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. (Nhóm nay đã được đăng và được cấp ID : 50849 nhưng nhầm số vốn vay. Nay nhóm được đăng lại. Tổng số vốn vay thực tế của nhóm là 10.502.000 VND).

loans.use: Chăn nuôi

loans.name: Mairam

texts.en: A. Mairam is 48 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Khujand and is engaged in the commercial services and national boot sales businesses. Mrs. A. works as a registered nurse in the local policlinic and has been selling massi, the national boots, in her free time for the past 18 years. Mrs. A. has now applied for a business development loan of US$775 to be repaid within 4 months. She will use the money to increase her business assortment and turnover. Mrs. A. thanks KIVA for its important work and the support it provides to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Increase in business assortment and turnover

loans.name: Buchwa Community Based Distributors Group

texts.en: Buchwa community based distributors is a group in Migori Kenya with a membership of 40. Six members of this group have applied for US $ 1400 to help them improve and expand their income generating activities.

loans.use: Improve and expand their income generating activities.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: M. Aziza has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. She has been a reliable client and has not had any problems with loan repayment. Mrs. M. is 26 years old and lives in Khujand. She is involved in the commercial services and underwear and socks sales business. Mrs. M. is now asking for a business support loan of US$1,050 for a 4-month term to be able to purchase a new assortment of goods.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: K. Fotima was born in 1968 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs. K. has been trained as a midwife, but is currently engaged in her family's business in trading livestock at the local animal bazaar. It is the family's only source of income, and Mrs. Kurbpnnazarova likes the work she is doing. She is now applying for a loan of US$625 for a 5-month term, which she will use to open a trade outlet. Mrs. K. thanks KIVA for its important work and the support it provides to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Opening of a trade outlet

loans.name: Unry

texts.en: A. Unry was born in 1958 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. Mrs. A. does not have higher education; however, she has good business skills. Therefore, she has been able to earn income running her own business for the past 18 years. Mrs. A. sells livestock in the local bazaar. She is very polite and has had no problems with the repayment of previous loans. Currently, Mrs. A. needs a loan of US$625 for business turnover increase. She plans to repay the loan in four months.

loans.use: Business turnover increase

loans.name: Yakubjon

texts.en: M. Yakubjon has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008. He lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan, a high mountain region where livestock and yarn businesses are particularly developed. Mr. M. is engaged in the commercial services and livestock sales businesses which are his family's main source of income. Of the two, he is particularly experienced in the livestock sales business. Mr. M. has now applied for financial support for his existing businesses, asking for a loan of US$625 for a term of four months. He plans to use the money for business development.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Maksharali

texts.en: U. Maksharali was born in 1961 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Maksharali is involved in the commercial services and livestock trading sectors in which he has ten years of experience. In addition, he works in the collective farm. Maksharali currently needs a business development loan of US$625 for a 6-month term.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi O. is 41 years old. She lives near Day River, which makes it very easy for her job, fishing. In 1999, Mrs. O. joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to take loans to buy fishing tools. Everyday, Mrs. O. and her husband, Mr. Vu Van Phuong, go farming during the day and go fishing during the evening to earn some extra income for their family. They have 3 children. Two oldest ones have been able to help their parents. From fishing, Mrs. O.'s family earns about 188 USD per month. Right now their boat is broken; other tools such as fishing nets, etc also need replacement. That's why Mrs. O. would like to borrow 425 USD to fix their boat and buy more nets for the coming fishing season.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị O. năm nay 41 tuổi.. Gia đình chị sống ở gần Sông Đáy nên rất thuận tiện trong việc đánh bắt cá. Năm 1999 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương vay vốn để đầu tư mua sắm các công cụ phục vụ cho công việc đánh cá của gia đình. Hàng ngày chị cùng với chồng là anh Vũ Văn Phương tham gia công việc đồng áng, tối về anh chị lại đi đánh bắt cá trên sông để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Anh chị có 3 con., hai trong số 3 con của anh chị đã lớn và đều có khả năng phụ giúp bố mẹ làm kinh tế. Công việc đánh bắt cá đã mang đến thu nhập ổn định cho gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000/ tháng. Sau một thời gian làm công việc đánh bắt cá hiện nay thuyền của anh chị đã hư hỏng, các dụng cụ khác như lưới... cũng cần phải thay thế, bổ xung. Vì vậy chị mong muốn được vay thêm 7 triệu đồng để đầu tư sửa chữa thuyền mua thêm lưới để phục vụ cho mùa đánh bắt cá sắp tới

loans.use: Catch Firher

loans.name: Abdumalick

texts.en: J. Abdumalick was born in 1957 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. He is married and has five children. Mr. J. is involved in the commercial services and livestock trading in which he has 18 years of experience. Additionally, he works in the collective farm. Mr. J. has applied for a business development loan to be repaid in six months. He is thankful to KIVA for its important work and the support it provides to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi H. is 31 years old. She has 2 children who are still going to school. In 2003, she joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to take loans to invest in breeding animals and retailing. Besides breeding pigs, Mrs. H. also buys fruit from retailers and sell it at her house. She earns about 125 USD per month from selling fruit. Not only that, her family also earns some extra income from transporting construction materials by Mrs. H.'s husband's boat. For this loan cycle, Mrs. H. has discussed with her husband. She wants to borrow 625 USD to buy more fruit, expand her store and rebuild her farm. Mrs. H.'s family income is about 188 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Hà năm nay 31 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Năm 2003 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi, buôn bán. Ngoài việc chăn nuôi lợn, hàng ngày chị đi lấy hoa qủa từ các đại lý về bán lẻ tại nhà cho thu nhập 2.000.000/ tháng. Ngoài thu nhập từ việc chăn nuôi buôn bán của chị, gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ việc chở vật liệu thuê bằng thuyền của chồng chị .Vòng vốn này chị đã bàn bạc với chồng và muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư thêm vốn mua hoa quả, mở rộng quy mô kinh doanh và sửa sang chuồng trại để chăn nuôi. Thu nhập của gia đình : 3.000.000/ tháng

loans.use: Feed Pigs

loans.name: Fariz

texts.en:
Fariz is 39 years old.  He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Kalbadjar region of the occupied territory of Azerbaijan. Fariz is married, with 2 children. They have settled in Baku city, Sabunchu region.
 Fariz started his business 8 years ago. Now he needs a loan of $625 to buy clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to improve his business.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi N. was born in 1964. She has 2 children who are still going to school. In 2001, Mrs. N. joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to take loans and buy pigs for her farm. Besides farming, in order to earn extra income and provide a good education for her children, Mrs. N. also carries sand basket on her head to transport sand near the riverside. Each day, she earns about 3 to 3.75 USD from carrying sand. Her husband is a construction worker. He often has to go to Hanoi or other provinces to work. He earns about 4.25 to 6.25 USD per day. After 7 years working with TYM Fund Mrs. N.'s family income has increased significantly. In 2007, they were able to build a small house. She is planning to rebuild their farm and buy more pigs to raise. She would like to borrow 625 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Ngân sinh năm 1964, gia đình chị có 2 người con hiện đang đi học.. Năm 2001 chị tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương vay vốn để mua lợn về chăn nuôi. Để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình và đầu tư tốt hơn cho con cái đi học, hàng ngày, ngoài việc chăn nuôi trồng trọt tại nhà chị còn tranh thủ đi đội cát thuê ở các bến sông thu nhập từ 50.000 đến 60.000 đ/ ngày. Chồng chị là thợ xây dựng anh thường xuyên đi làm tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh lân cận cho thu nhập từ 70.000 đến 100.000đ/ ngày. Qua 7 năm tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương, cùng với sự hỗ trợ của chồng thu nhập của gia đình chị đã ngày càng tăng lên. Năm 2007 gia đình chị đã tiết kiệm xây được nhà mái bằng kiên cố. Gia đình chị đang có kế hoạch sửa sang chuồng trại, mua thêm lợn giống về nuôi. Chị mong muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng.

loans.use: Feed Pigs

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi H. is 31 years old. She joined joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 2001. Before joining TYM, her life was very difficult because her children are very small. She uses her loan to invest in her tailor shop, making clothes and selling them to other villagers. With her cleverness and reasonable prices, her shop attracts more and more customers. Besides farming, she earns about 156 USD per month from her tailor shop. She would like to borrow 625 USD to buy more materials to make clothes.

Translated from Vietnamese by PH. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Hương năm nay 31 tuổi. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 2001. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị gặp nhiều khó khăn do anh chị phải hoàn toàn tự lập khi lấy nhau và các con còn nhỏ. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị Hương đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào công việc mua bán vảy may quần áo phục vụ nhân dân trong xã. Với tay nghề khéo léo, mức tiền công phù hợp cửa hàng của chị đã ngày càng thu hút được nhiều khách hàng. Hiện nay ngoài việc chăn nuôi trồng trọt, thu nhập từ công việc may mặc của chị cho thu nhập khoảng 2.500.000/ tháng. Chị mong muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư mua thêm vải may quần áo phục vụ nhân dân

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Babalarov

texts.en: Babalarov S. is 52 years old, married, and has three children. He earns income breeding calves for meat production in the Internally Displaced People's Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. S. has more than 20 years of experience in this field and currently needs a loan of US$900 to be able to purchase three additional calves for US$300 each.

loans.use: Purchase of three calves

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vu Thi D. is 47 years old. Before, she and her husband took building materials to other areas to sell. However, this activity required them to be away from home, making it difficult to take care of their children who were still going to school. In 2005, she joined the TYM Fund. She sold her boat and combined the profit with the borrowed money to sell coals to local people. Because of her experience in selling building materials, she uses the borrowed money effectively. Every day, Mrs. D. and her husband buy coals from wholesale people, then sell it to local people. Her income from this activity is approximately 200 USD/ month. She wants to borrow 550 USD to invest more in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Duyên năm nay 47 tuổi. Trước đây hai vợ chồng chị làm nghề chở vật liệu bán nhưng công việc này luôn phải đi xa nhà dài ngày ảnh hưởng đến công việc chăm sóc, dạy dỗ con cái đang tuổi đi học. Năm 2005 chị tham gia vào quỹ Tình thương, chị đã bàn bạc với chồng bán thuyền và vay thêm vốn của Quỹ để buôn than phục vụ nhân dân. Do đã có nhiều kinh nghiệm trong công việc buôn bán vật liệu xây dựng trước đây nên gia đình chị đã sử dụng vốn rất hiệu quả. Hàng ngày anh chị thu mua than từ các thuyền sau dó bán lại cho nhân dân . Thu nhập từ công việc buôn bán than của gia đình chị đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Trong thời gian tới gia đình chị muốn có thêm vốn để đầu tư vào công việc buôn bán than vì vậy anh chị đã bàn bạc và quyết định vay mức vốn 9 triệu đồng.

loans.use: coal business

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo H. is 35 years old. She is divorced and has a son studying at school. Marhabo has never had anyone's assistance in helping her son get ahead. For five years, she has sold assorted products such as detergent and food items like macaroni, tea, sugar, etc. This has been her only income to support and educate her son, and it has not been easy for her to have the entire responsibility for her family. But her love for her son is what motivates her from day to day.

Marhabo is requesting a loan of 1500 Somoni ($450 US Dollars) that will be used to expand her selling goods and meet her clients' demand. She promises to return this amount in 6 months.

The well-being of this brave woman and her son is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of her business. They sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing goods for selling to increase the variety of goods sold.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., joined the TYM Fund since 2001. At first, she used the borrowed money to buy general products and fertilizer and sell them to local people. Besides working on the rice field, and breeding animals, her husband also helps her in travelling to the wholesale stores. She has 1 child who is 17 years old. Her family economy improves and she has a stable income from her business. She wants to borrow 925 USD to buy more fertilizer to provide the local people for the upcoming crops. Her income is approximately 200 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.
